campaign.story:
Hi everyone!

I'm Alec Shaw, a Seattle based musician/producer currently fundraising for my fourth solo studio project, thank you for taking the time to check out my Kickstarter campaign. This is my first time asking people publicly to help me fund my album, so it's something that is a little scary for me. I've always put everything I have into the music I make, but due to COVID-19 I'm not able to pull it off alone.

2020 started with my first featured plays on KEXP Seattle, a world famous independent radio station for new artists. This shot me to new heights in my career. Within a couple weeks I was flying to LA meeting with record labels, playing industry showcases, booking festivals I've always wanted to play, getting praise from artists I've loved for years, and had a slew of sold out shows opening for incredible artists. After 5 years of working hard, playing multiple shows a week, and self-producing my albums, it felt like I was finally getting my break.

As you know, in March of 2020 everything came crashing down with the pandemic. The music industry being hit the hardest of all, and none of my dreams had been realized... YET.

I finished writing the last songs on my fourth album that April, called my producer friend Andy Park (Death Cab For Cutie, Noah Gunderson, Macklemore) and between the COVID induced panic attacks got to work setting the songs to tape. With a limited budget my plan was to play all the instruments myself, and for studio time using the money I had earned producing other artists that year. It didn't take long for what started as bunch of demo quality performances of me (playing instruments I didn't necessarily excel at) to become a collection of beautifully crafted songs with vivid arrangements.
I had friends step up and contribute to help me create what I had imagined the songs to be, friends that believed in my vision and wanted to see it come to life even when it seemed impossible. These were drummers, guitarists, string players, choir directors, studio owners, and engineers, all people that make the music community what it is. I believe this contributed to making this project develop its purpose. These six songs are all my best work.
Photo By: Mark Alvis. Jon Berry (Violin) Alec Shaw, Katie Kuffel (Cello), Ed Brooks (Pedal steel) Recording "I'll Just Let You Down" for "Quantity" at studio Litho
I didn't leave any song on that I was unsure of, and because of this I'm thinking of naming the project "Quantity" as a testament to the thing I had to let go of during this trying time. In the past I would get caught up thinking more is better. “More money, more songs, more instruments, more shows, larger audiences.”

During this season when the hustle was taken away (or put on pause), we had to play music together purely for the joy of it again. I forgot all about the quantity and all that was left was the soul. That's the thing that matters in music in the end. That's what people connect with and what I had to connect with to create this Album.

I'm in the final push. As things will be opening up soon I need to be able to offer this to you, and I can't do it without you!
Here are the things your contribution will go towards paying:

- Studio Rental / Recording Engineer
- Producer fees
- Paying the Musicians
- Post Production / Mixing and Mastering
- Photos / Album Art & Design
- Printing CDs & Vinyl
- Promos
- Kickstarter Fees / Shipping

Thank you so much for those who have supported me this far, and a big Thank You to all those who have just started. I can't wait to make music for you again and hopefully in person soon.

 Here is one of the songs that is featured on the album I was able to release already!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Funding my album through Kickstarter is taking a huge risk. I need to reach my goal or I won't receive any of the money. I know there are many people who have and will support me, but due to the size of my audience and that they are mostly younger I know that I will need all the help I can get to reach my goal. I also know that 2020 was a difficult year for more than just musicians. Anyone who was impacted, who lost a job, or couldn't work is still struggling now or still recovering making it a hard time to raise money in general. My hope is to see us all together in 2021 experiencing new music with our loved ones, and not feeling afraid.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! Here to give you a long overdue album update.

As everything has slowly started to open up here in Washington I've been slammed with music production work the last couple months, as has everyone else working on my album, causing some delay.
I'm really excited to say I have my masters finished after revisiting the mixes a few times. I really wanted to dial in these songs and make them something I'm really proud of and that you will enjoy, and now that I have the final product I'm really happy I spent the extra time dialing it in. All the people involved in recording, mixing and mastering have definitely helped make this the best album I've done. I can't wait for you to hear it.

If you havn’t already heard, we made it to my goal! thank you so much everyone. I can’t wait to have this album finished and it’s only possible because of YOU. 
I’ll update everyone as soon as it is finished and then I get to send you your rewards. keep your eyes out for a backer survey coming at you soon, to get the info I need to fulfill your rewards!
Thank you from the bottom of my heart,
Alec
We've had an incredible start with 15% being funded in 1 day. I'm so thankful and excited to keep this fundraiser rolling. I can't wait to share this project with you

campaign.story:
----FINAL DAY LIVESTREAM----
----STRETCH GOALS ANNOUNCED!----
MEET BOWSER AND ONYX
Onyx The Fortuitous  aka "Weird Satanist Guy" has been a viral presence on the internet since 2012. It is time to take him to the NEXT LEVEL with his very own FEATURE HORROR/COMEDY "ONYX THE FORTUITOUS AND THE TALISMAN OF SOULS." 
Onyx is the brainchild of writer and performer Andrew Bowser. Through an ongoing series of viral videos spanning nearly 9 years, Onyx has permeated every corner of pop culture. The character has amassed over 300 million views online and his content has been shared by numerous celebrities and referenced in multiple hit songs. 
As a director, Bowser has helmed numerous independent films that have had premieres at SXSW, Seattle International, and Chattanooga Film Festival. He has worked with Legendary Pictures, Warner Bros. Games, Blizzard Entertainment, Funny or Die, Chrysler, and Marvel. He has also directed horror mainstays like Barbara Crampton, Bruce Campbell, and Adrienne Barbeau. 
This film is the culmination of Bowser's abilities as a director and Onyx's potential as a resonating comedic character. 
THE TALISMAN OF SOULS is a horror/comedy in the vein of 80's favorites like GREMLINS and FRIGHT NIGHT. It's a throwback to an era when horror movies were equal parts absurdity and humanity. 
Poster art by Lukas Ketner
The story follows fledgling Satanist Marcus J. Trillbury (Onyx) as he attends a once-in-a-lifetime ritual at his idol BARTOK THE GREAT'S dark mansion. Once there, Marcus meets a group of other worshippers. As the group is led by Bartok and his assistant Farrah in a series of rituals meant to "better them," it becomes clear that their intentions are more nefarious. As his new friends are losing the battle to keep their souls, a question of great destiny looms over Onyx's head: is he doomed to be a nobody or is he the only one who can defeat Bartok and save his friends from damnation?
Inspiration for "Talisman of Souls"
THE VISION BEHIND THE FILM 
 ---NEW "FILM ONLY" REWARDS! ---
FULL REWARDS BREAKDOWN!
CAMPAIGN PRODUCTION CREDITS : 
MAIN TITLE DESIGN BY JUSTIN CROWELL
MAIN TITLE THEME BY ROB AMJARV
MAIN TITLE SOUND DESIGN BY MIKE JAMES GALLAGHER
TITLE HEADER ILLUSTRATIONS BY CHEY EPSEJO
Through his many years creating content in this industry, Bowser has amassed an amazingly talented team to surround him and Onyx on this project.
DAN ADLERSTEIN/DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Dan is an LA based DP who works on a wide variety of projects in television, commercials, narrative, documentary, and digital content.
He has worked extensively in TV, shooting for HBO, CBS, Netflix, Amazon, HULU, AppleTV, and more.  His commercial work includes campaigns for Old Spice, Kahlua, Zappos, Fox Sports, as well as many other brands. His narrative work has been featured in festivals worldwide, including Sundance and Cannes.
Dan is an alumn of Wesleyan University where he majored in Film Studies, focusing mostly on film history and theory.  He went on to earn an MFA in Cinematography at the AFI Conservatory.
Dan is a member of IATSE Local 600 and on the Industry Experience Roster as a Director of Photography. He recently shot the Netflix show "Aunty Donna's Big Ole' House of Fun" and Bowser's short "Little Willy."
STUDIO ADI/SPECIAL EFFECTS
STUDIO ADI is a group Academy Award winning creators of special characters and character effects. Calling upon a diverse range of talents and techniques, they create prosthetic make-ups, animatronic puppets, actor duplicates, and replica animals. With over twenty-five years of professional experience, they bring "real" character effects to the set to interact with actors, lighting, and practical atmosphere. Studio ADI prides themselves on working with the industry's leading CGI companies to find the right balance of digital and practical effects.  They continue to provide filmmakers with realistic and economical character effects that best serve the story and the production. Their credits include films such as IT, Godzilla VS. Kong, The Predator, and The Nun.
MATT MAHAFFEY/COMPOSER
Matt Mahaffey is a self-described quirky musician. After having niche success with a rock band, he found out - much like Mothersbaugh and Elfman - that his ideas fit better over the course of 11-75 minutes of picture than it did in a 3-minute pop song. The Shrek universe was his first job in film/tv and it was the gift that kept on giving.  He started a composer collective with his wife, creating scores for dozens of television shows over the last decade, including "Rise of the Ninja Turtles."
He's worked with some of the biggest names in the industry, including doing 3 years on the road with Beck and writing and performing on his Grammy-award winning album Morning Phase. He also received Gold Sales Awards for Keith Urban’s Fuse and Lupe Fiasco’s Lasers, among others, and Platinum Sales Awards for Vitamin C and HelloGoodbye. Matt also scored "Little Willy" and Bowser grew up idolizing his work in the band Self.
MIKE JAMES GALLAGHER/SOUND DESIGNER
Mike James Gallagher is a sound designer and re-recording mixer currently living and working in Los Angeles. As a sound designer he has worked for clients like Netflix, Hulu, Marvel, Lagavulin, Pro Sound Effects, Crypt TV, and Nerdist, among others. His work has also been featured in numerous festivals including Sundance and Edinburgh International. In 2018 he created the popular sound-oriented YouTube channel INDEPTH Sound Design (https://www.youtube.com/indepthsounddesign).
Mike met Bowser at Comic Con 10 years ago and they've been collaborating ever since on projects including Monster Machine, Worm, and Little Willy. He also enjoys writing about sound for picture, most recently writing the episode "Storytelling with Cinematic Sound Design" for the popular YouTube channel Film Riot. Some of his latest sound design work is featured in the Netflix series, Song Exploder, which was adapted from the acclaimed podcast of the same name.
BOWSER'S DIRECTING REEL
LITTLE WILLY (SHORT FILM)
THRILL ME! (SHORT FILM)
SELF TAPE (SHORT FILM)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any production there are risks. But In the last year we have seen unprecedented challenges due to the Covid-19 pandemic. This project has been built strategically from the ground up to not only be easier to shoot under these circumstances, but be safer and more contained. The cast is small and the number of locations needed are minimum. We will be hiring a Covid safety specialist for the entirety of the shoot and have confidence we will deliver a stellar product despite these restrictions. The team assembled for this film are professionals, and would only choose to work in a professional, respectful, and safe environment.

All physical rewards will be manufactured to order. While we don't foresee delays there is always the risk that there could be unexpected delays in manufacturing and shipping.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Onyx The Fortuitous and The Talisman of Souls

campaign.story:
We are the rock band The Presidents Of The United States Of America! Or rather, we were. We stopped performing in 2015, after 20-ish years of circling the globe kicking out the jams in tiny clubs and massive festivals and everything in between. Like Zamfir, the Master of the Pan Flute, we have "enchanted millions". Maybe YOU were one of these people!** 
**Or two of these people, if you are looking over the shoulder of a co-worker or spouse. 
Our debut album came out in 1995, first on a tiny Seattle label called Pop Llama, then some <action-packed> months later on COLUMBIA RECORDS. At some point early in the process, we did a sub-license <----(music business term!) with a small Spanish label for vinyl, and they made a few copies.  They continue to be battled over to this day. See below ......
I'm being told there may have been a Dutch version as well? Maybe a bootleg? Who knows ANYHOOOOO there aren't very many out there is what I'm trying to tell you! 
Yikes $185! Yikes BAD COVER!
 Great question!  
1995 was a time when vinyl seemed like a format whose days were numbered. Because OMG COMPACT DISCS! We stayed very busy circling the globe and kicking out the jams and selling gajillions of these "CDs." Here are some of the concepts we may have lost track of during this turbulent time:
clean laundry
time zones
occasionally eating salad 
releasing our album on vinyl 
It wasn't until years later when INTERNET let people talk to us that we found out we had made a huge mistake
So here we are, coming up on its 25th birthday....BOOM VINYL PUSA! 

This is a celebratory FANCY-PANTS edition, white vinyl with green and bronze marbling. There's even a poster inside that you can take right down to your local tattoo shop and say "please put this across my back!"**
**do not actually do this.
We are post-rock-band. While we remain friends and enjoy frequent lunches together, we have no label, no management, no infrastructure, no "team". That's OK though! We  don't need any of that stuff!*** Thanks to INTERNET and whatnot the music is out there for anyone who wants to hear it (that's my vague understanding of INTERNET.)
And (this is important) we own most of our music, including this album! So involving a label again is kind of the opposite of what we want moving forward. Kickstarter gives us the chance to bring this directly to you, and (also important) figure out how many of you are interested in having one of these hot slabs of wax!  Also: not for nothing, but our research shows that people in general like and trust Kickstarter the most out of all the crowdfunding sites!
***except the lunches.

What kind of a question is that.....what CAN'T you get??
First, the TECHY STUFF: 
Both formats here are from when we remastered the album in 2005 with Vlado Meller (who is a big deal in the mastering game). It's a little bit shinier than the original, and we like it a lot. So much in fact, that we could find no legit excuse to remaster it again for vinyl.*****
 Everyone gets a link to the album as either WAV or 320k mp3 files. I don't know what that means, but I'm sure they will be higher quality than listening on a streaming service, or most regular mp3 files. So that's nice. 
tl;dr the digital stuff will sound better than what you have unless you have the 10 year anniversary edition in some form already.
AND I believe we've already mentioned there is a HOT SLAB OF WAX involved! Please take this moment to admire it again! 
*****TURNS OUT the main reason one would want to re-master specifically for vinyl has something to do with the gain levels of stuff that was originally mastered for CD yadda yada I don't know I may have fallen asleep while I wrote this sentence anyway Vlado addressed that and it sounds great so let's relax with a martini poolside

 And here is a handsome shirt that we thought looked nice, and you won't find it anywhere else, so I mean it seems pretty important to get one now, right? Fun fact: After the campaign we will contact you to SELECT A SIZE and we will hound you constantly until you do. Eventually we will send some gym socks and a chia pet, and you will have no-one to blame, because you did not SELECT A SIZE on the friendly survey we sent you! 
S, M, L, XL! Sorry, limited sizes!
And look here: a snappy enamel pin. This is a victory lap that can be worn out and about on a hat or lapel! In case you were wondering it is 1.5 inches a side. 


STRAIGHT UP OUR NOSES
KIDDING. The only thing that ever went up our noses were farts on a tour bus. 
But yeah, us! There's all the normal things that need paying for...pressing, shrink wrapping, packing, mailing etc...there are many bites taken from the apple before the applesauce phase....
I am using the "apple" metaphor because apples are often used to make "pie" and Kickstarter even suggests using a "pie chart" in this section, but I donut know how to make a "pie chart" even though I love pie. I love all desserts, did you even notice that I said "donut" instead of "do not"?
We're thinking of this as a fun way to get a thing into the world that we should have done years ago, while not having to do very much of the actual work ourselves. Instead we're hiring talented people to oversee production, fulfillment, art, and our fragile tempers. Everything is being made here in the USA by independent businesses. The HOT SLABS OF WAX are being pressed in Athens, GA by Kindercore, and inserted into jackets from LA's Stoughton Printing. The handsome shirts will be screened by Ruby Sue Graphics, likewise in Athens. 
Here is some info about our fulfillment partner:
they are called Fulfillment Merch, and they have a website.
they are very good at shipping vinyl.
they use vinyl-specific packaging made from recycled materials, which is nice.
people seem to like them! 
holy cow they are ALSO in Athens, GA....this must be some coincidence!


Seriously, fam.....
We have been so lucky to be able to play music in your earholes and your hometowns and your cars for 20-ish years. YOU made it happen, and we have been humbled and honored by your continued interest and dare I say passion for our particular silly brand of rock and roll music. We hope this particular WAX piece of the big puzzle gives some of you more joy. You gotta love everybody...!
XO PUSA
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Rather than separating risks and challenges, let me talk a little about what I'm calling: GENERAL ANXIETIES.

UGH shipping costs. I wish these were less! We've spent considerable energy making sure the numbers are correct territory by territory. There's some info on our fulfillment partner somewhere up there in the main story!

TIMELINES: Everything should go smoothly and we'll be getting stuff into your actual hands by the middle of April (after this campaign runs for four weeks). We've got good people helping us in all aspects of production and fulfillment, so please oh please let it all go smoothly!

ALSO....we're not touring, because we're not touring, sorry! We will call you if that changes!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Due to reduced staffing and having to order more shipping boxes, our fulfillment partner is taking a little bit longer than anticipated to finish shipping. For updates on your shipment, please email service@fulfillmentmerch.com with your backer number. You will receive an autoreply, but they will get back to you directly as quickly as possible. 
Before emailing double-check your junk and spam mail for tracking information from Fulfillment Merch.

When will my album ship?
Kickstarter orders started shipping last week and will continue through next week. Our fulfillment partner is taking extra time to ship to allow for social distancing. Seriously, we know you are dying for this tasty wax, but we are in interesting times, so we can take a couple of extra days to allow for worker safety. :)
Where is my tracking information?
Your tracking information will be sent to your email (the address you used for Kickstarter, if you are like me, you have multiple addresses, so make sure you are checking the right address) from our fulfillment partner Fulfillment Merch. If you don't see it, check your junk mail.

COOOOL ......so everyone wash your hands and swab down your computer or phone or wherever you are reading this RIGHT AFTER you look back through all the Kickstarter emails for the subject line RESPONSE NEEDED (wouldnt hurt to search your junk box) and fill out those surveys if you haven't already.
Some of you may have gotten EMAILS (wouldn't hurt to search your inbox and junk for mgmt.pusa@gmail.com)  about this as well, and thanks for re-entering all this bullcrap that we need to get you your hot wax. DONT WORRY! Whether you filled out the initial survey, or responded to the EMAILS, or both, YOU ARE COOL we got it! If you made sure your SHIPPING ADDRESS was correct, KUDOS TO YOU!

Congrats folks, you just did the 7th most funded and 8th most backed music Kickstarter in history! It's possible I got those backwards, but they are both pretty great anyway, right? As you can see, we are THRILLED.
hold on to your britches, we're going to start sending reward-specific SURVEY EMAILS tomorrow. By far the most important action is that all of you who opted for a TSHIRT need to SELECT A SIZE when you get the email. Don't gum up the works! Don't screw the pooch, ETC!

updates.update_userinfo: WE ARE THE CHAMPIONS, MY FRIENDS
updates.update_content:
Here you can see us grappling with what we are already calling THE AUTOGRAPH OBSTACLE.** This is the epic story of us coming together to defeat AQUEOUS GLOSS jackets, which <spoilers> are tough for sharpies!
We. Have. The. Solution.
PAINT PENS.
Look at these handsome jackets being rolled all over Stoughton's machines. It's mesmerizing! I have lierally been mesmered by watching this!
NICE job everyone! Only ONE MILLION to go!

campaign.story:
Nice to meet you! My name is Harald Geisler. I am a typographer specialised in handwriting fonts. Here on Kickstarter I created fonts based on Albert Einstein's and Sigmund Freud's handwriting. Now, with approval of the King Estate in Atlanta, I would like to continue the series and create a font based on Martin Luther King jr.'s handwriting.
What does Dr. King's handwriting look like?
The civil rights activist and minister's speeches and actions resonated around the world and continue to inspire generations today. We all know what his voice sounds like, but as a typographer I became curious: how did he prepare his speeches and organised his thoughts in writing, and what does Dr. King's handwriting look like?  
On your computer or smartphone fonts are the “software” that make text (letters, punctuation, numbers, etc.) appear on your screen: 
In programmes like Word, Pages or Open Office you can choose different fonts to write in. Common fonts are Times, Arial, Helvetica and if this project is successful (fingers crossed): soon the Martin Luther King font.
Everywhere you work with text, you can use the font. Here is an example of how to use handwriting fonts to create a paper: 
Support this campaign and you can soon use Martin Luther King's handwriting with your projects: college papers — surprise your teacher with a paper about Martin Luther King in his handwriting, student assignments — surprise your students with a test "handwritten" by Dr. King, holiday-cards, invitations, hand-outs, a personal recipe book, tattoos, cover art for your new album,  email-art, titles for a video project, online-art or a cover for your book… 
Here you see the current state of the Martin Luther King font prototype:  
The font will work with your computer (PC, Mac, Linux) and phone or tablet (Android, iPhone, iPad). First time you install a font? Have a look at this Helpful Font Guide - PDF on how to use and install fonts →here.
What will the Martin Luther King font be based on? 
My aim with these handwriting projects is to open a door to the content of an author through the aesthetic of handwriting and the general interest for typography and fonts, and with that to create awareness for the cultural activity of writing and to imagine a creative vision for the future of writing in the 21st and 22nd century.
As a typographer I search for meaningful ways to relate to writing. The available styles of typefaces are often copies or versions of another with little variation.  I believe that writing today needs new ways to relate and adequately express oneself. I hope that the Martin Luther King font will become a meaningful addition to your writing. 
Practically creating a handwriting font requires samples of every (lower- and uppercase) letter of the alphabet. I select a variety of manuscripts that are representative of the author's hand and are interesting and relevant to give an insight to the author's body of work and time. Like this here: 
Dr. King's notes regarding Hegel's Philosophy (ca. 1952 / 1953). From the King Library and Archives, Atlanta.
The cards you see above are Dr. King's study notes about Hegel's philosophy while he studied at Boston University, they can be found in the King Library and Archives in Atlanta or the Howard Gotlieb Archival Research Center at Boston University. While creating the font I will share with you background information about the manuscripts used in the creation, why they are important and where to find them.
To complete this art project, 27,059€ are needed (find budget details below). The way Kickstarter works is that you can pledge for this project. In return for your peldge and to encourage you to support this project, I am offering you rewards. For example other handwriting fonts that I created here on Kickstarter or a poster, in return for your pledge. You can also make a donation if you just want to support this project, this can be done by pledging and choosing "no reward" or by simply pledging a bit more than your chosen reward tier. Donations are great, because I do not have to pay taxes on them. 
Either way: If this project does not reach its funding goal until the end of the campaign (25. October 2019), I will not be able to complete the Martin Luther King font and all pledges will automatically be transferred back to the backers.
My wish is that this project gets into the hands of as many interested people as possible. I do not want to exclude anyone for financial reasons, that is why I keep the entry reward as low as possible at 1 Euro. If you wish to support this project with more I have created some very interesting rewards below.
The "Personal Typography Coach" reward is very dear to me, because it is about more than sharing the font, it is about enabling you to use the font in the way you want to. 
Think of it as booking a session with your personal typography coach. There is something you like to do with the font, but you don’t know yet how to do it. Harald will help you personally! May it be a leaflet, school paper, holiday card, instagram series or tattoo — First I will listen to what you are aiming to do and we talk about your project through a 30 minute Skype, phone or email conversation. From there I’ll create a step-by-step tutorial based on your skill level (novices are welcome), software and device you use. I will improve the guide based on your feedback and share the tutorial with all backers.
All projects are welcome: you’re working on a paper about Dr. King, a student assignment, you like to use the font in your Newsletter or email, create hand-outs, holiday-cards, a recipe book or album cover. This may be a general question like: how do I get the font on a t-shirt? or about fine tuning the drop shadow on the cover art for you latest album…
— All questions are welcome.

50/100/150/200€ @work commercial licence • Receive the Martin Luther King Font(50€) and additional Fonts(100/150/200€) to use at work in a commercial context (e.g. Design Studio, Advertising Agency, Newspaper, etc.) on PC, Mac, Linux, iPhone and iPad.
€800 Presentation + Q&A // €1,500 Workshop with Harald Geisler • These rewards are for individuals, groups or universities and schools interested in typography, font making, crowdfunding, handwriting and everything that relates to this project or typography in general. A presentation will be with Q&A session about the project. The workshop will take either two or four days. Schedule, topic and details to be discussed. I will travel everywhere, but additionally you will have to cover traveling costs (flight, train and hotel) from Frankfurt, Germany. 
Your contribution will make the Martin Luther King font better and will go directly to everybody who receives the font. Your generous support will allow me to add one additional alphabet to the font — which makes its appearance more complex and one alphabet closer to the original.
I can not thank you with a physically equivalent reward but you will be credited accordingly and feel free to pick from all the rewards above. 
You have a question about the rewards — simply reach out to me through Kickstarter or my website. I am happy to help you. 
Below you will find additional information to answer common questions about the project. If you have a question that is not answered below, feel free to contact me through Kickstarter or reach out in the comment-section of the project, I am happy to hear from you.
Overview:
The ABC of how a "handwriting"-font is made.
How can a font look like beautiful handwriting? 
Improvising the @ sign
Inspiration - (History of the project) 
Timeline - When will the font be ready?
Budgeting • How will the funding be used?
Kickstarter References
Press
Technicalities: Font specifications 
Credits
I  created multiple handwriting projects, for example the Sigmund Freud Typeface, based on Freud's handwriting, the Albert Einstein Font and Martin Luther Font. With each project I refine my process and everything I learn benefits the next project. Let me walk you through the basic steps of my process:
A. Understanding Movement — Every writer has their own way of moving on paper, which can be described with characteristic angles. For example the angle at which one letter connects to the next — not all letters connect at the same angle, but there is an average. In the picture below the blue guides show the average "connecting"-angle of Dr. King's handwriting:
B. Recreating Movement — For each letter I recreate the movement path that was used to draw the letter on paper. This movement-path uses the characteristic angles (i.e. connecting, ascending and descending angle) to describe the movement and is stored as a vector in the design software: 
C. Adding contrast to the letter — The movement-path is then modified to render the ink flow of the used writing tool. In this case a pen that creates thick down strokes and a slightly thinner upstroke. This digital form is then stored in the Font file, which is a rather technical process. If you wish to read more about it, I have written an in-depth article →here.
The example above already shows characteristics of Dr. King's handwriting. Analysing how a writer makes the bow of an “l” or the slope of a “g” also affects ones own handwriting and has surprising side-effects. During past projects I found myself suddenly writing my grocery lists with Einsteinian (or Freudian) loops and hoops. 
Handwriting has a vivid character because one never writes the same letter twice. When I type the word 'look' in a regular font, the two 'o' look the same. 
In the preparation of creating a handwriting font I look at all kind of documents, and mark certain letters that I find are typical for the writers' hand. In the example below you see a selection of lowercase "d" — notice how they are similar but also different in the beginning, middle and ending of a word: 
Capturing one version of each letter in the beginning, middle and end of a word is not enough: I create multiple versions of each letter that are stored in the font-file. The font is then programmed to exchange the different versions as you type. This way each word will appear different, depending on its position on the page. The more letter-sets I draw into the font, the closer it gets to  handwriting. I call this method polyalphabetic substitution. 
The most complex font I made so far is the Albert Einstein Font. It holds five versions of each letter (Set 1-5) and different weights. Here you see comparisons of the font with original samples of Einstein writing "Allgemeine Relativitätstheorie" (German for "General Theory of Relativity"):
I mentioned that "everything I learn benefits the next project". One aspect I was not able to fully address in Freud nor the Einstein font, but is already implemented in the current state of the Mart Luther King font prototype. In handwriting a lowercase letter can look different in the beginning, middle or end of a word, which means this font should reflect that with additional lowercase letterforms (a in the beginning of a word, a in the middle, a at the end, b in the beginning, b… vs. just a, b, c, … ).  
This may sound like a small detail, but accordingly the Martin Luther King font will have triple the amount of lowercase - letters to be drawn per variation… a lot more work! But I am convinced the result will be worth the effort. The plan for the font is to add 3 variations per Letter (lower-case, uppercase, initial and final case too!). This is the minimum to bring the appearance of the font on the margin to handwriting. The more funding the campaign gets, the more variations per letter I can add to the final font — making the final result better for all backers!
For me it is important to not scan the image of letters, nor simply to trace them with an automated software. By focusing on movement and creating in this analog-digital way, I become familiar with the hand of a writer by re-writing characteristic letters. Learning the movement that a writer made to create a letter is essential to creating its digital counterpart. 
Become familiar, study, reproduce and learn the original movement is essential when it comes to creating signs that were uncommon at Dr. King's time. For example one will hardly find an @ sign nor the letter combination www in his notes. After digitising all available letters, I use the collected knowledge about a writers movement to create a profund improvisation; for example the @-sign can be seen as the movement of a lowercase "a" connected with the bow of a parenthesis. 
This is an excerpt of my creation process, →here you can find an in-depth article about my process written in 2014.
Kickstarter campaigns have Stretch-goals, so that backers get animated to support the campaign further than its funding goal. This project is very dear to me and it is important for me to make it happen as I lay it out in this description. However this project is calculated on shoestring budget, in which many days and weeks that I already put in this project are not accounted. From past campaigns I know that the benefit of a higher funding is not that easy to calculate. For example in the rewards I say that if one person pledges 8500€ I will add one more alphabet to the font. This means that I would have 8500€ to spend solely on working on the font,  with little to none production of a physical good, handling, packaging by hand or shipping involved. The same amount coming from 100 or 1000 backers would involve additional accounting, shipping, handling, etc., which can easily add up to a huge amount of time and certainly production money.
With that in mind I ask myself: what would be a "good"stretch-goal for this project? What makes the font better for all backers? Answer: the more variations are stored in the font the closer it comes to actual handwriting. For each additional 15.000€ I can add an additional alphabet in a comfortable and safe way — and I am offering something that I can fulfil.
First I keep my fingers crossed, that the campaign reaches its goal — and then for every additional 15.000€ I will add one more alphabet to the font, making it better for all backers of this project. 
2014 in the context of the 50th anniversary of Dr. King's visit to East Berlin (1964), I came upon a radio recording of a speech he gave in Marienkirche. I took a note of the introduction because of what he says about his name: 
PLAY

"I come to you not altogether as a stranger, for the name that I happen to have, is a name familiar to you, so familiar to Germany and so familiar to the world. And I am happy that my parents decided to name me after the great reformer."
What influence is it on a person to grow up with a name linked to history? Is it a burden or is it an inspiration to carry a name? For Martin Luther King jr, I imagine this connection must have been a source of inspiration.
With the handwriting fonts project I am proposing a similar situation: What does it mean to write your thoughts and ideas with the "hand" of Dr. King, Luther, Einstein or Freud? Is the author lurking over your shoulder as you write or are you dictating, is the font a disguise or mask to hide behind, is it a role to switch into and to see and act as if you were, is it a challenging discussion on paper or an uplifting empowering writing together? I hope that these projects enrich your daily reading and writing experience and serve as a source of inspiration and a playful encounter with history.
Back in 2014 listening to the radio feature, I wrote Martin Luther King (1929-1968) on a board in my studio. A friend saw it and suggested then that I should create a Martin Luther (1483-1546) font first. I launched a successful Kickstarter campaign in 2017, the 500th aniversary of the reformation. In the Luther project description you can read that I had planned to create the Dr. King font in 2018 commemorating the 50th anniversary of Dr. King's assassination. But Luther's half a millennia old handwriting occupied me longer than expected. After the campaign succeeded scholars from different fields (Historians, Palaeographers, Latin scholars) contributed freely to the documentation, expanding the work beyond what I had planned. These contributions gave the project new angles to the subject, which I value very much. I am curious to see how this project about Dr. King's handwriting will develop and invite you to contribute and join this journey. 
21 days after the campaign ends all Backers of the campaign will receive access to the current state of the font AND digital rewards. The final font will be available to all backers in February 2020. Before that all backers will receive updated versions of the font as I am working on it. You will be able to give feedback to the font as I am developing it, which will make the final font better. Physical rewards like Posters will be send out by February 2020. For details please see timeline below.

If you like to see my other typography Kickstarter projects have a look at this list:
Fonts:

These typographic projects would not be possible without a platform like Kickstarter and Backers like you. 
❤  Thank you.
Press
Technicalities: Font specifications 
The Martin Luther King font will be delivered in OpenType format with PostScript outlines. This format is a standard and widely supported by all common operating systems like PC, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android etc. 
Features:
 Terminal forms(special letter-variations at the end of a word)
 Initial forms(specifically lowercase letters that are different in the beginning of a word)
 Stylistic Sets (so you can pick which h you like better)
 …and much more!
Language support • Every language has specific needs, for example in German two dots are placed over vowels (ä,ö,ü) to indicate a modification. Here is a list of the languages the font will support: Afrikaans, Albanian, Asu, Basque, Bemba, Bena, Bosnian, Catalan, Chiga, Congo Swahili, Cornish, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Embu, English, Esperanto, Estonian, Faroese, Filipino, Finnish, French, Galician, German, Greek, Gusii, Hawaiian, Hungarian, Icelandic, Indonesian, Irish, Italian, Kabuverdianu, Kalaallisut, Kalenjin, Kamba, Kikuyu, Kinyarwanda, Lithuanian, Luo, Luyia, Machame, Makhuwa-Meetto, Makonde, Malagasy, Malay, Maltese, Manx, Meru, Morisyen, North Ndebele, Norwegian Bokmål, Norwegian Nynorsk, Nyankole, Oromo, Polish, Portuguese, Romansh, Rombo, Rundi, Rwa, Samburu, Sango, Sangu, Sena, Shambala, Shona, Slovak, Slovenian, Soga, Somali, Spanish, Swahili, Swedish, Swiss German, Taita, Teso, Turkish, Vunjo, Zulu.
All fonts are licensed for private (non-commercial) and educational (in the context of your work as a teacher in a school or university) use.
Commercial use: If you are planning to use the font commercially, for example in your design work or in any context that you could describe with "at work" or involves you doing something that you receive money for… please pledge for the commercial license. Thank you. You can read my End User License Agreement here: https://haraldgeisler.com/eula 
EULA • What is an EULA? 
EULA means End User License Agreement. Since a font is design and software we need to agree on many things for example what are my responsibilities and what can you expect from this software. You can read the EULA for all my fonts right here.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every artistic project bears risks. Every project is new and brings up unforeseeable risks and challenges both technically and artistically. I have published three comparable projects (Albert Einstein font, Sigmund Freud Typeface - a letter to your shrink, Martin Luther Font) and seven logistically comparable projects (Typographic Postcards I + II, Typographic Wall Calendar 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2016) which involved design, production, packaging and shipping of printed goods, so I know about the artistic, logistical and technical pitfalls to avoid. The research and preparation that I already made for this project assures me that I will complete this project within the projected timeframe.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backer,
I wanted to update you about the current status of the Martin Luther King font. Since the campaign on Kickstarter did not reach its goal, I set out to produce the font "Letter by Letter." and created a website where you can download the font for free. You are invited to donate to the project if you wish.

updates.update_userinfo: The font must go on… lowercase letters: complete. Let's continue.
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
Thank you very much for your feedback and kind words after the last update. It means a lot to me. And it is insightful and helpful to read how you see the project. This expansive view encouraged me and helped me to find out how to continue the project.
I spend the weekend and today, creating a website to continue the Martin Luther King Handwriting Font. All feedback went into shaping the plan of how to proceed, of course, there are many different opinions, and not all can be met.

Dear Backer,
Thank you so much for supporting the Martin Luther King Handwriting font. It is great to see that 378 people think that the Martin Luther King font is a project that should happen. The Kickstarter campaign has 50 hours to go, and reached roughly a fifth of the required funding. It is uplifting that new backers are joining the project every day, and backers continue to raise their pledges to support the campaign.

Dear Backer,
I would like to share with you these videos, that give an insight to how I create a handwriting font.  The videos show the making of the letter "z" and "q" for the Martin Luther King Handwriting font. They play 100 times faster than the original speed. In the first step, I analyze the pen's path and place tangents along the letter. A Bezier curve aligning along the tangents recreates the writing movement. The trail then extends to represent the pressure applied through the pen. Finally, the drawing is then inserted into the font and tested.

campaign.story:
Iris is a completely redesigned circle drawing tool.
The Iris is your perfect tool for drawing and measuring circles. Simply rotate the rings to open and close its captivating aperture mechanism. Iris will inspire you with every stroke of your pencil. 
Iris is our second Kickstarter. We at Makers Cabinet are experts in drawing and writing implements and the designers of the Høvel pencil plane. 

 At Makers Cabinet, we believe that drawing and writing tools should guide the path towards creativity rather than limit its potential. Instead of being a burdening generic tool the Iris is intuitive and unique. 
We aim to inspire everybody that uses the Iris with a sense of satisfaction. Its mesmerising mechanism sparks delight in everyone that sees it open and close. We believe that the Iris helps rejuvenate the flow of creativity at moments of mental block. 
The scalable Iris drawing tool.
 The concept of the Iris came from conversations with our Kickstarter Community. Our supporters said that circle drawing tools lacked innovation and were difficult to use. These tools were unreliable and short-lived. So, we set out to completely redesign the circle drawing tool.
As amateur photographers, we noticed that camera apertures were reliable mechanisms and were surprised that they had not yet been developed for other purposes. In response to this observation, we designed an instrument that brings the quality of the camera aperture to your desk.
The mechanism of the camera aperture has endured 200 years of photographic history. Owing to this resilience, the Iris is the perfect replacement to the inadequate rotary drawing compass. 

Rotary compasses are:
Difficult to hold
Useless without a ruler
Restricted to certain mark-making tools
Immortalised by the holes in our pages
Iris is:
Easy to use
Compatible with any mark-making tool
An accurate measuring instrument
Seamless on your page

 At Makers Cabinet, we strive to create objects with a guarantee of longevity and durability. Iris is the product of this ethos. 
Iris is engineered using the most durable and effective materials. Its rings are machined from solid brass that patinas, improving with time and use. The leaves are resistant to ink and graphite as they are stamped from carefully selected stainless spring steel that retains its shape. The Iris houses twenty intricately designed leaves that enable you to create accurate circles with every stroke of your pencil.
The Iris is a reliable measuring instrument. In conversations with our users, we were inspired to add a scale along the side of the circle aperture. This allows you to effortlessly draw circles and measure diameters. The scale is marked with a high fidelity laser etching that denotes accuracy down to a millimetre. 
Reminiscent of a camera’s aperture enclosure, its scale is marked with a red dot. This allows you to read the diameter of your circle without the impediment of any other tool. Below the Iris’ leaves sits a natural rubber footprint that seamlessly grips to your page. This means that all your focus can be on the circles you are drawing and not the instrument that you are using.
Every Iris purchased in the Kickstarter comes with a wooden base. 
Our first wooden base prototype was intended to simply support the Iris on your desk. However, at Makers Cabinet, we design every tool with the intention to be both beautiful and functional.  
Accordingly, our updated base locates the centre-point of a circle. To achieve this, simply lay the Iris flat on your surface and place the base against the inside of the aperture. This added feature enables you to take your drawings to the next level. 

In 2017 we launched our first Kickstarter for the Høvel pencil plane. Høvel is a completely redesigned pencil sharpener which planes your pencil to a perfectly crafted point reminiscent of woodblock planes.
Since we launched the Kickstarter, the Høvel has won a Stationery Award, has been stocked in 20 stores worldwide and galvanised our business. Get a Høvel at a reduced rate by backing the Iris here today.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The design is complete, with our initial prototypes completed and Iris is almost ready to go into production. Redundancy measures are in place, with a manufacturer in reserve should we encounter problems with the first. However, unforeseen delays can and often do happen. 

This being our third Kickstarter between us we are confident that we can deliver an awesome product on time and with amazing quality. We promise to remain transparent throughout the campaign and during production to keep you updated on our progress.

Please note that you, the backer are responsible for any duties 
charged by your local postal service upon receiving your reward.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We're back with a new campaign - Ferrule
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
We hope you are well and having a good week.
Over the past few years, we have received many requests for a variety of products for Makers Cabinet to design. We are very pleased to announce that we have launched our fourth Kickstarter Campaign, Ferrule.

updates.update_userinfo: Stria is officially live, Early Birds available!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
We are pleased to announce that our third Kickstarter Stria is officially live. Stria, Makers Cabinet’s third Kickstarter, is an elegant folding ruler designed to be cherished for many lifetimes. Stria comes in both polished brass and stone-ground steel, and has a one-of-a-kind dovetail hinge with built in tactile feedback at 45° increments to intuitively find the angles most important to your work.

Dear Backers, 
We are thrilled to announce that the production of Iris is complete. We are starting the process of fulfillment this week. For this reason, this is your last chance to update and edit any shipping details. Please follow the link through CrowdOx to access your survey if you haven't already.
Everyone will be given a tracking number so we can ensure that your order gets safely delivered to your door.  We are shipping out orders in two batches, and this week we will send out all orders to the EU. At the start of next week, we will send out all orders to the rest of the world. We are super pleased to be able to meet our November shipping target and can't wait to get Irises in your hands in time for the holiday season!

Dear Backers,
We are nearing the end of production for the Iris and we are so pleased with the results. We have spent the past week visiting our production facilities and carrying out quality control on Irises. This included checking that it functions perfectly with the scale aligning, the blades moving precisely, and guaranteeing that the finish and wooden bases are perfect. They are looking brilliant and we are so proud of the finished outcome. We cannot wait to send them out to you!

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update and Some Iris Tips
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
We have received our final Iris samples and the results from our factory are outstanding. We have conducted our final testing stage and have rigorously inspected every element. We are so pleased with the results and we’ve given the go-ahead with production. Fulfilment of your Irises is still on track for November!
If you haven't filled out your CrowdOx survey you must do so as soon as possible. Without your survey information, we will not be able to ship your order. If you haven’t already filled out your survey please follow this link to retrieve your survey:

Hello backers and newcomers curious about the Iris!
Greetings from the Makers Cabinet team. Since we last updated you we’ve been hard at work getting our production partners set up for our first batch of Irises. We’ve come to a penultimate iteration in Iris prototyping and we're so excited to share it with you. In recent months we’ve been working hard on a few critical details, alongside some aesthetic details which we have been fully committed to.

Dear Backers, 
A couple of days ago we closed the CrowdOx backer surveys as we found that some customers were being overcharged and some were being undercharged for their orders. We have now resolved this issue and the surveys are back online and running smoothly. If you have not already attempted to complete your survey we would now like to invite you to finish your survey in order to ensure that your rewards are sent out on time.

updates.update_content: We finished shipping today. Thank you everyone for your great support of the Triangle Campaign and the kind messages after recieving your cards. I've been asked what colors are next by many of the backers. :) We haven't made it that far yet, but let me know in a personal message if you would  be interested in other colors of the Triangle deck :)

Hello all,
Quick shipping update. We are 90% through shipping in the US and Canada. All shipments will be sent by mid week. We appreciate your patience and hope you enjoy the cards. 
Thank you!!

Hello Everyone,
At this time of year I want to send a special thank you to all of you for your support.
Shipping: 
All International orders have been shipped. USA and Canada Orders will be shipped as soon as we have the goods cleared from customs and arrived at the Fun Factory.

International shipping started on Friday. The domestic items are still in LA waiting for clearances. We have word that the customs could be cleared early this next week then they will be shipped out to everyone in a hurry :)
Here is a picture of the empty cartons from the international shipping :)

updates.update_userinfo: Clearing customs in Germany and US
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
I want to keep you up to date on where we are with shipping. We are currently going through customs checks.  The decks have been in Germany for a week and LA for a few days going through clearances. It looks like we will have clearance in Germany in the next few days and international shipping will begin as soon as they arive at the fulfillment warehouse. For domestic and Canada shipping right now they are giving us a tentative date of the 12th for clearance, so we would expect to have the decks to ship to you around the 15th. We'll keep you posted and let you know as soon as we begin to ship.

Hello Everyone,
Making Triangle cards was a serious challenge and triumph when production finished. We are so pleased with the end product and know that you will be as well. The domestic cards are due to our warehouse on the week of Nov 11th. They will be quickly shipped out to all of you.  The International pledges will be shipped from Germany starting on the 3rd of November. Thank you so much for your patience we know you will love them.

The main problem was in tooling and getting the correct angle for all of the cards and tucks. But we perservered and the end product is amazing. We expect to be shipping the last week of October. Here are pictures of the samples that made it to the Fun Factory ahead of the others.

Hello All,
We are finishing production now. We hope to be shipping by months end. Here are some pictures of production. We are so excited to get these sent out to you. 
MS

campaign.story:
...has been long. In the summer of 2013, armed with an idea, prototypes and a few supplier quotes we made a heart-felt appeal to this community right here, to fund our idea and help us create a new toy company.  Your trust and generosity, with some steadfast determination and relentless work on our part made for a successful mix.  
It has now been six years, eight campaigns and we can finally legitimately say that we made an impact in the design toy space continuum.  There has been press, we are present in stores in 46 countries but we still come back home, right here on Kickstarter where we first started.   
Truly, accurately, we couldn’t have done it without you.   
And we’re going to keep going:  we made a pledge that you will be the first to know when we have fresh ideas and new product.  Are you ready for the next one? 
Our 2018 Candycars campaign and post-campaign sales were met with unmitigated success; we fulfilled our campaign pledge in a record 45 days, and every single backer that supported us was able to proudly beam about a brand new toy - the result of a novel way of making toy cars:  combining a diecast base with a cute, simple painted wooden body.  They roll like the wind, have a solid heft and won’t be around for 10,000 years like their plastic cousins.  We consider that a plus.  
For this next round, we’ll crank up the cuteness and playability:  we picked lovable food trucks and other vans full of personality, added a beefed-up wheel design of our own, and came up with a few squishy toppers, for a new tactile sensation.   
*drum roll* 
If you don't like tacos, this truck is nacho type.
Our taco truck was inspired by the trailblazing spirit of the very first food trucks. Designed with true SoCal vibes in mind, it has fun and fiesty coats of paint, some spanking orange wheels, and a terrific taco up top.
Do-nut be alarmed. 
You're supposed to be this amazed -- it's impossible to glaze over this beauty. Already a crowd favorite, our donut van made its instagram debut back in March and has been garnering drools ever since with that striking hot pink topper.  
Now’s the time to seal the deal and make sure you get one reserved! 
Nothing says NYC like a hot dog stand.
As New Yorkers, we must pay tribute to the hot dog – it's the quintessential New York street food. Our hot dog truck is a minimalist, design-focused, vehicular interpretation of the hot dog stand with a mustard-yellow top and a perfectly toasted base.  Don't worry, we skipped the dirty water.
Chicago-dog fanatics, get outta ‘ere. 
Soft-serving up good looks.
As far as a symbol of simpler times and a carefree way to stuff sugar and calories in your childhood, you can’t beat the ice cream truck.  We popped a melty top, added a bright pink base, sprinkled a pun, and voila! Iconic toy made. No ice cream truck jingle – you’re welcome. 
We don’t know how to put this, but our news van is kind of a big deal. 
Brought to you by the broadcast division of Candylab Media, it possesses an inquisitive personality.  It will magically appear wherever your other Candycars get mixed up in news worthy happenings. On the practical side of things, the dish is real stamped steel, and may have some actual tiny radio reception abilities.

Geared up and overflowing with cool.
Our S.W.A.T. van stops crime in its tracks. Rolling around and chasing bad guys all while looking like an absolute stunner, our S.W.A.T. (Sweet Wheels And Tires) van gives the phrase "action-packed" a whole new meaning.
Got (a) coin? They’ll take good care of it.
Don't be fooled by its small stature, our armored van is tough and hardy – the perfect guardian for all sorts of goodies. 

And that’s the crew!  We created 7 distinct designs and personalities, each with a stunning box, sure to impress children (and adults) way too accustomed to disposable blister packaging.  Scope this out before we move on to the reward levels! 
The specs on this new line are the same as you've come to expect from us: Well-made, custom parts, all wrapped in our environmentally friendly formula: solid European beech, water based paint and a durable diecast metal base.  It is all engineered in-house by a new generation of toy designers and product developers who all share a drive to make a better toy. 
We agonized over the donut/ice cream /taco /hot dog designs and tooling so the resulting parts are friendly to a child’s touch, squishy and soft, but hard enough to be used as a handle and rougher play.   
Est. Delivery Sept 2019
Want Multiple Rewards? This go-around we will  be working through Backerkit post-campaign. That being said, if you are interested in more than one reward please add the cost of the two rewards as well as shipping costs and pledge for that total. Then post-campaign you will enter Backerkit with a credit in which you can apply it to various rewards. If you have a super specific request send us a quick email to littlehelper@candylabtoys.com and we will see what we can do! 
Domestic Backers:  Starting with the Candylab Fleet reward we will be offering F-R-E-E shipping within the US. Yes, you read that correctly, free shipping!
International Backers: If you haven't noticed already we are only offering international shipping starting with the Candylab Fleet reward. We know, it's really expensive for you international folks. We strictly charge what postage actually costs and pay for warehousing, shipping cartons, labeling and on from the general overhead remaining. That is what carriers charge these days. 
All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying - your pledges are without sales-tax or VAT. All Kickstarter rewards will be considered gifts, however, most countries will assess duties/taxes and in certain countries the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later. If you refuse delivery, your package will be abandoned. Once abandoned, we can’t ship another package to you or issue a refund. Filling out your shipping address correctly is very important. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation. 
Of course for any questions regarding international shipping please send a note to littlehelper@candylabtoys.com
Feel free to access our Media Photography Kit here: https://bit.ly/2Ltg8es 
If you decide to use any of our images please credit Candylab Toys                                         
For any other press related inquiries please contact: littlehelper@candylabtoys.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are on our 9th Campaign. Based on longstanding relationships with our suppliers, we have already completed tooling and are fully ready to start production. We are confident that once the modest goal of this campaign is funded, we can safely deliver your rewards on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Using Wood and Metal.
Reusability and recyclability
It's made of mostly wood, which means that our product is meant to last a lifetime, not a year.
Sustainable materials
Our product is made of mostly wood, we use solid beech which is either imported from Canada or Germany. All of the paint we use in water based and non-toxic.
Environmentally friendly factories
As a sustainable brand we are constantly making sure the factories we work with are up to our standards. By standards, we mean great working environments, happy employees, and safe workplaces. We visit our factories several times a year and are sure to meet the people we work to face to face.

updates.update_content:
Hey tribe, as some of you have already noticed already, the rewards are OWT the door! Done, finished, dusted. 
Our warehouse team pulled off a small miracle - packing hundreds of packages, printing slips, labels and generally compressing all the mayhem accompanying a fulfillment process in a few really long days. campaign.story:
You are incredible! Thanks to you we’re funded and Brooklyn is getting a new arcade bar! We can’t wait to have all of you at Wonderville!
Now the fun stuff! If we clear our goal by an additional $15,000 ($85,000 total), we’ll celebrate by building a two-player PICO-8 arcade machine. It will be hand-made and painted by a local artist!
For those not familiar with it, PICO-8 is a fantasy, retro console in the style of the Commodore 64. It’s a lot of fun to make small games in, and a lot of our community has done just that! With this arcade we’ll be able to rotate what’s on display, showcasing different locally-made PICO-8 games in all of their 128x128 glory! 
If we clear our goal by $30,00 ($100,000 total), we'll be redoing the backyard to make it look amazing. Secret Project Robot has a great outdoor space, and with a little love we can get it (and the cabana!) looking better than ever!
Wonderville will be a brand new arcade, event space and bar in Brooklyn specializing in independent video games, created by a growing and vibrant community of game developers in New York City and beyond. 
We're not talking about retro arcade games from the 80s and 90s or just arcade versions of mobile games; these games are brand new, unique and ridiculously original experiences created by designers and artists today. Ever played games using only LED strips? Or door stops? Or juicers? At Wonderville you will! 
Up to this point, these games have only shown up at festivals and short-term pop-ups as physical installations meant to be played by a group of people in a public space, and then they disappear. But no more! Wonderville will house independent games as a permanent home for these modern treasures. The space will also host tournaments, playtest nights, board games, comedy, live music and rotating art installations and exhibits.
We have an amazing opportunity to inherit one of our favorite spaces, and transform it into a new celebration of independent games and interactive art, but we need your support to make it happen. Join us, and help make this venture a reality, and you can also receive amazing Kickstarter exclusive games, art and handmade arcade cabinets from independent game developers and artists!
We've got a lot of great game developers on board who are volunteering to make an exclusive game for this campaign! And we're combining it all to create:
At $20 ($15 for the limited EARLY BIRD), you'll get new games from some of the most innovative video game developers working today! A slew of devs are donating a brand new, exclusive game for the WONDERBUNDLE! This is an exclusive collection that you'll only find as part of this Kickstarter and nowhere else! 
You'll get 10+ new games by:
 BumbleBear Games (Killer Queen)
 Ramiro Corbetta (Hokra/Sports Friends)
 snowhydra games (Zarvot)
 Robert Yang + Eddie Cameron (Radiator 2 & Queer Space)
 Catt Small  (Breakup Squad)
 Stephen Clark (Witch Ball)
 Fernando Ramallo (PANORAMICAL)
 Nick Fortugno (Diner Dash)
 Ayla Myers (Just One Boss)
 Ramsey Nasser (Dialog 3-D)
 Andy Wallace (PARTICLE MACE)
 Nick Santaniello (VOLLEYGON)
 Paolo Pedercini/Molleindustria (Every Day the Same Dream)
Many of these games are being made especially for this event and none of them have been released anywhere else! These game makers have agreed to have these games be completely exclusive to this backer reward for one year after delivery (some time before September), so this is your chance to play them anytime soon!

For the past few years, we've been selling DBA Arcade Snackpack volumes filled with assorted games from the developers in our collective. For $40, you'll get the Wonderbundle, as well as both Snackpacks, with modern classics such as PARTICLE MACE, VOLLEYGON, Slam City Oracles, POWERBOAT Italia '88 and more! That's 20+ games and art from DBA Arcade to you!

For $45 you'll get an exclusive T-shirt ONLY available through the Kickstarter campaign. There are three designs by artists Marlowe Dobbe, Preston Spurlock, and Tim Fite. These will be available in all sizes and in both straight and fitted cuts! Pledge three times to score all three Kickstarter exclusive designs! Then come visit us at Wonderville in your shirt and prepare for lots and lots of high fives and nods of admiration.

Pin your indie arcade pride on your chest (or backpack, hat or your dog's collar) with a set of four premium custom designed limited edition enamel pins featuring Wonderville and other arcade designs. For $60 you'll get both games bundles, plus this set of exclusive Wonderville enamel pins designed by Chris Hernandez. Dreamboxx and Videofreak will use glitter enamel for their reflective and shiny bits, and Dreamboxxx will also be rainbow plated metal. These are limited edition, and will only be available through the Kickstarter campaign!



Alt.Ctrl Workshop hosted by Death By Audio Arcade and Brooklyn Research
On the weekends at Wonderville, we plan to host classes and workshops taught by game design instructors, fabricators, and designers from the community in Brooklyn and beyond. Pledge to one of our workshop tiers and you can choose to learn about game design in Unity, physical computing with Arduino, modular synthesizer design and/or animations in Processing. A laptop is the only required material for the workshops, no need to have any existing knowledge to take part, we'll get you all set! 
If you select one of these tiers, we'll coordinate to host the class on a date that works best for all students. If you cannot attend for some reason, we will give you a voucher for a future Wonderville class.
For our top tiers, we'll send you a custom-made bartop arcade cabinet or a full size arcade cabinet that includes all of the games in our collection: PARTICLE MACE, VOLLEYGON, KungFu Kickball, Slam City Oracles, Nothing Good Can Come of This, Powerboat Italia '88, Fútbol Forever and Crystal Brawl. 
We've built over 25 custom cabinets and we're confident these will be the best yet! The marquee and side art will be custom-painted by an artist from New York City - each one will be unique - and we can ship via freight anywhere in the lower 48 states. 
Through our five years on the road, Death By Audio Arcade has been showcased at many venues and festivals. Here's a small sampling of the press we've received during that time:

Kotaku: Meet The Guy Making Arcade Cabinets For Indie Games
Wall Street Journal: Nostalgic for the Atari-Era Arcade? Millennial Gamers Are Reinventing It
Gothamist : Step Into the Dreamhouse, Where DIY Arcade Games Meet Queer Culture
Bedford+Bowery : An Indie Game Arcade Has Opened at Elsewhere
The Fader: Meet Mark Kleback, The Technologist Bringing Old-School Arcade Games Into The Future
Wonderville, the brainchild of Mark Kleback, was born out of his work as a creative technologist and founder of Death By Audio Arcade.
Death By Audio Arcade is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization in New York City, founded in 2013 in the back of the punk warehouse, Death By Audio, in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. In addition to a music venue, Death By Audio was a loft space occupied by Mark and 12 other artists, musicians and DIY-enthusiasts. With access to a wood shop, Mark built his first arcade cabinet and started reaching out to local game developers to find games for his handmade arcade builds. Since independent musicians had dedicated spaces to showcase their art, why not indie game devs? 
Wonderville builds on the foundation of Death By Audio Arcade, which collaborates with game developers and teaches them how to cut and paint wood, solder electronics and assemble physical installations for video games. Most game designers are used to making games to be played at home on a computer, but by showing games in public spaces, these designers also learn how to make great social arcade games. 
We also host talks and panels and invite local artists to showcase games at public events. Since 2013, we've built over 20 custom arcade cabinets and we've been featured at the Smithsonian American Art Museum, MAGFest, World Maker Faire New York, South By Southwest, PlayNYC and Low-Level Festival. We've been a transformative organization for people looking to learn more about doing hands-on projects in an increasingly digital world.
Death By Audio Arcade at Elsewhere
When Death By Audio closed in 2014, Death By Audio Arcade was left homeless and shifted focus to partnerships with other local New York venues for months at a time. Over the past five years, we've had residencies at Elsewhere, Superchief Gallery,  Babycastles, Caveat, Our Wicked Lady, Flattopps, Flux Factory, Silent Barn, Dreamhouse, H0L0, Brooklyn Research, Flowers For All Occasions, and Secret Project Robot.
Stephanie Gross is co-founder of Wonderville and has a decades long history of helping artists and organizations become non-profits and leverage their talents to achieve their dreams. As a NY city employee, Stephanie is a valuable resource for former residents of the DIY underground art world looking to navigate the bureaucracy of licenses, permits, and city departments. 
New Year's Eve 2010
Steph and Mark met at a show in 2010 at Death By Audio, one of her first clients. They're now engaged to be married later this year! ❤️💍✨
 In late 2018, Rachel Nelson and Erik Zajaceskowski, the owners of Secret Project Robot, approached Mark and Stephanie about taking over their space. Secret Project Robot has been an artist-run venue in New York City for over fifteen years, hosting art installations, performance art, live music and community meetings. The opportunity was too good to be true. Not only would this space provide a home for the nomadic Death By Audio Arcade collection, but it would be a hub for the entire New York City indie game community. Not to mention it's 100% legal with a bar and liquor license!
 With your pledge, we'll have the funds to buy the business, with all of the necessary permits, licenses, inventory, and machinery. There are eight years remaining on the lease, and with your help, we'll be able to start with enough capital to run for the first 6-12 months. 
Paper Gardens Festival at Secret Project Robot
And Wonderville isn't just for DBAA games, we have plans to collaborate with our friends in New York (and eventually the world)! While we spent time as nomads, we met a lot of like-minded developers: we've done collaborative events with Babycastles and The Sheep's Meow and continue to discuss setting up a rotating gallery space. We've shown work by Bumblebear and Videogamo and many many more. We plan to have a Killer Queen Machine, a Black Emperor machine, and a Line Wobbler. We'll work with the NYU Game Center and host playtest nights and panel discussions. On the weekends, we will host workshops based around game design, electronics, and fabrication. 
Allen Riley of Death By Audio Arcade showing video game art at Superchief Gallery

We want to make sure Wonderville is a home for everyone doing or interested in indie arcade work! 
We'll also host live music! Secret Project Robot has an amazing stage and sound system that we plan to keep: DJs, musicians, bands, comedy shows, and other events are all on deck! We want to create a community space that bridges the gap between the games community and the wider New York arts and music community.
With your help, we can make all of this happen, buckle up and join us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The rent is too damn high! It's really hard to keep a venue open in New York City. We've already been pushed out of one underground space due to rising rents, and this time we want to make sure we have enough of a savings to get it off the ground. We have a solid business plan vetted by Stephanie’s non-profit background and informed by both Mark and Steph's years of living and working in music venues. We've also got many people volunteering their time to help with the success of Wonderville, but your contribution goes a long way!

Death by Audio Arcade will continue to operate as a 501(c)3 not-for-profit organization inside of Wonderville. We depended solely on donations and money from our events to sustain Death By Audio Arcade. In addition to this Kickstarter, you can make tax-deductible donations to Death By Audio Arcade.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
