updates.update_userinfo: thank you for supporting the arcade
updates.update_content:
Hello, this is Dustin Long, president of the Death by Audio Arcade collective. I wanted to thank you for supporting our Kickstarter last year in order to allow us to open Wonderville. It has been so important having a home for indie arcade games to live at, so that the public can experience and enjoy them.

Prior to the opening, DBAA's collection of cabs was essentially nomadic, moving from place to place, going in and out of storage, as best as we could manage. After the insanity of 2018, wherein we collaborated with over a dozen venues, art spaces, and like-minded indie game groups, we knew we needed to find a permanent space of our own. Thankfully, 2019 saw the opening of Wonderville, which served as an invaluable home into which we got settled.

Hey Wonderville Family!
It's been a while since our last update so we want to fill you in on how things are going since the COVID19 pandemic began back in March.
Wonderville had been closed from March 15th until this past weekend. During this time, we ran a few virtual events on our Twitch page including a big concert that took place inside of Minecraft! You can watch it on our Youtube channel. We also hosted the Super Social Distance Game Jam which resulted in some pretty amazing games over the course of a weekend. We've got a few remote events in the pipeline, so be sure to check our events calendar!

updates.update_userinfo: Reminder: Pick Up Shirts and Pins Tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Just want to send out a reminder that you can pick up your T shirt and pins tomorrow at Wonderville from 12pm - 6pm! We're spending today putting everything into packages so you can swing by and we'll have everything ready to go.
Hope to see you then!

updates.update_userinfo: Didn't receive your Wonderbundle? It should be fixed!
updates.update_content: Hello everyone! We realized that a few people did not receive their Wonderbundle code. Sorry about that! Yesterday we sent out another batch to the folks we missed. Thanks for your patience there. If you backed at $20 or more you should have gotten and email from Itch.io with the subject “[itch.io] Wonderbundle - The Wonderbundle is here! Thanks for backing Wonderville!” If you didn't receive the bundles, check your spam filter - it would have come from itch.io and you'll need to create an account (for free) to download the files for Windows or Mac. Please let us know if you didn't receive anything! Thanks again, we love you all <3 Mark and Steph

Hello everyone! Just letting you know that the Wonderbundle and DBA Arcade Games bundles were sent out via email yesterday! We're so excited to share these games with you, and it was so great to see everyone last night at the launch party!
If you didn't receive the bundles, check your spam filter - it would have come from itch.io and you'll need to create an account (for free) to download the files for Windows or Mac. Please let us know if you didn't receive anything!

Hey everyone!
We've got some exciting news in this update about Kickstarter Rewards! There's a lot going on so we'll break it down by type:
Wonderbundle!

Hey everyone!
We are so excited to send an update since we've ordered most of the rewards now and should be shipping them in September! But before we get into that, I wanna give a shout out to Diego Roa who was visiting from Buenos Aires and offered to paint a mural on the front of the building! Part of the mural will be animated (eventually) so come by and check it out in person!

Hello friends!
It's been almost two months since we took over the reigns at 1186 Broadway, and it's been busy! We'd like to tell you a little bit about what we've been up to, and let you know the status of some of the Kickstarter rewards!
Renovations

It's been almost a week and already we're so excited about the future of Wonderville! We've begun to book events beginning in May, and we invite you to follow our brand new social media channels to keep track of what's happening!
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/wondervillenyc

campaign.story:
Important: By backing this project you confirm that you are not Anish Kapoor, you are in no way affiliated to Anish Kapoor, you are not backing this on behalf of Anish Kapoor or an associate of Anish Kapoor. To the best of your knowledge, information and belief this material will not make its way into the hands of Anish Kapoor.
There's none more black!
Black 3.0 is a super special acrylic paint. We have spent nearly 2 years tweaking its formulation to create a black that absorbs between 98 and 99% of visible light! Quite simply we've created the blackest black acrylic paint.
Black 3.0 brush applied to sculpture
Last November we shared a beta batch of Black 3.0 with 1000 artists around the world for feedback and thoughts. We've now taken that information and reformulated it to be the best black we could possibly make. 
All the photos and video content on this page are created with the final formulation of Black 3.0 from the UK factory that are producing it for us, we are excited to be playing with it and feel like it's perfect!
We need your help so that we can pay the paint factory to produce their minimum order quantity of our recipe so we can share our creation with everyone!
 The science behind the Black!
We wanted a super-flat, ultra-matte black that absorbed almost all visible light. To achieve that we went right back to the basics of paint making. The problem with existing black pigments is they are all slightly reflective (carbon is the most common and if you think of coal or charcoal you'll know it has a shine to it), so we created a whole new pigment in the lab and we call it 'Black Magick', it is born matte! This means that the mattifiers we used in Black 2.0, which added a tiny grey tint, are no longer needed making a way blacker looking paint! We've also managed to formulate a new acrylic polymer to hold the pigment, it's special because it has more available bonds than any other acrylic polymer being used in paints. This means it can cling onto way more pigment, leading to a really dense pigment load and a depth of colour not previously possible. We have sourced some brand new nano-mattifiers which we have added, these flatten out the last bits of stray light without compromising colour. 
Unedited comparison with other well known black paints
We have benchmarked Black 3.0 against 45 existing black paints, this photo demonstrates a small section of those, being the most commonly available black paints in the UK. We also sent beta versions of Black 3.0 to 1000 artists around the world, they filled in a questionnaire and 93% of them preferred it to our Black 2.0 (previously the worlds flattest mattest black). 
It's super easy to use.
Other super blacks are complicated to use and extremely expensive. Most require heat, science labs and specialist training to apply. We wanted to make a super affordable, easy to use paint that was familiar to artists so they could concentrate on expressing themselves. 
We think that sharing your colours with others is nice! When Stuart heard that Kapoor was the only artist that could use the blackest black he felt sad but also a bit bad that he'd been making awesome colours and only using them in his own work. So he started sharing his colour creations on the internet with other artists. 
The holy grail of paints is the ultimate zero-point black. We've been on a mission to create exactly that for a long while because we want all artists to be able to express themselves with awesome materials. The limits of your creations should be your imagination not how rich or successful you are. 
We are a small team of artists and paint makers based in a studio in Dorset on the south coast of England. We are headed up by British artist Stuart Semple who has been making his own colours for nearly 20 years. 
We've created and shared tens of thousands of the artiest art materials with artists all over the world including LIT (the world's glowiest glow pigment). PINK (the pinkest pink), Gold (the goldest gold), Black 2.0 (the mattest flattest black paint), Dazzle (the glitteriest plant based glitters) and many more creations. 
You can see what we make and learn all about us on our website:
culturehustle.com
No matter what reward you choose you will get at least one bottle of Black 3.0 but your support means so much to us we wanted to thank you properly. Stuart and his team have been busy over the last few weeks designing the rewardiest rewards to thank you properly! These will only ever be available to kickstarter backers! He's come up with commemorative mugs, notebooks, sticker and badge packs and even a gorgeous organic screenprinted 'haus' street sack bag. Below are actual photos of the actual rewards you will receive :)  We hope you enjoy them as much as we enjoyed making them!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although we're a small team we've made and distributed tens of thousands of art materials to artists all over the globe. We've planned Black 3.0 properly and don't expect any problems or delays. As always if anything were to change we'd keep you in the loop and do our very best!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hi everybody, we're back :)
To our friends and backers, we've been together long enough that we can somewhat skip the intro.  Some of you have been with us for the past 5 years, 7 product launches and we cannot, would not, should not be here without you.  I know we say that a lot but we really do mean it.  We are immensely grateful — as designers, as product developers, as believers in a more fun and creative world — and we sure plan to keep going as long as you guys keep loving the things we make.
For the first time, we are launching a more mass-oriented, retail-ready product, but of course with Candylab DNA (it's better that way).  And you get to watch and see how this gets made!  This story is a little different than our usual, but still leads to the cool, innovative toys that you've come to expect from us. 
You know we do, and you do too. That's why we think you'll be glad to hear the seed of this idea:  Diecast little cars are a staple of every kid's bedroom and toy chest, making frequent appearances on adult shelves, toy collection and as fun office decor too.  What bugs us is that like any successful, long-running product, they've become commoditized. 
Today you can buy tiny 2-inch long diecast toy cars for a buck at virtually any gas station.  Of course, it's not the price that bugs us the most, it's the simple fact that the joy that comes with matchbox cars is gone. Those little guys are so often tossed around and forgotten, the magic disappears.  This mass invasion is a far cry from the 1950's when they were carefully crafted, and came in a box resembling a box of matches. Don't even get us started on plastic "diecast-style" cars. 
...is to provide a bit of an antidote to that while still doing what we do best:  wooden toy cars.  So we set out to design a "Wooden Diecast" car.  It sounds really simple but we banged our heads about for 2 years to be able to do this —  make a cute, cartoonishly-proportioned wooden body with fun, splashy colors on a custom-designed diecast base. Screw it all together carefully, give it an adorable name and sell it for single digit dollars in the spirit of matchbox cars.  Then we made more of them.  And now we're releasing it into the wild!
But here we are, and here they are! Countless hours, work, prototypes, scale studies, engineering, and color studies, we have the finished products in hand — beech wood body, alloy diecast base, custom engineered wood screw, metallic foil paint accents and the coolest packaging we could come up with. 
Now, for the good part.
We came up with the best combo packs we could imagine, and it's pretty straightforward. There are 6 designs total, and we packed them in some common sense combinations.  All are at affordable price points, because no one is against affordable, but great. 
Also, for the first time ever, Candylab announces... immediate fulfillment! Unlike our previous campaigns, every detail about these little guys have been finalized and ready to go which means they will begin the fulfillment process as soon as the campaign ends. And that means they're guaranteed to arrive in time for the holidays.
We're so sure of ourselves this time, we even made a giant red banner:
(For those of you who are waiting on your Beasts, fret not — they'll be there sooner than you think.)
 ** Please note, the Dream Come True reward is limited to our existing body styles and cabins. You can mismatch if you would like! The paint coat and decals are all up to you - have fun with it. 
Want Multiple Rewards? This go-around we will not be working through Backerkit post-campaign. That being said, we will not be allowing the act of combining rewards. If you have a super specific request send us a quick email to littlehelper@candylabtoys.com and we will see what we can do! 
Domestic Backers:  Starting with the Double Up reward we will be offering F-R-E-E shipping within the US. Yes, you read that correctly, free shipping!
International Backers: If you haven't noticed already we are only offering international shipping starting with the All Aboard reward. We know, it's really expensive for you international folks. We strictly charge what postage actually costs and pay for warehousing, shipping cartons, labeling and on from the general overhead remaining. That is what carriers charge these days. 
All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying - your pledges are without sales-tax or VAT. All Kickstarter rewards will be considered gifts, however, most countries will assess duties/taxes and in certain countries the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later. If you refuse delivery, your package will be abandoned. Once abandoned, we can’t ship another package to you or issue a refund. Filling out your shipping address correctly is very important. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation. If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation.
As mentioned above, if you have any questions regarding international shipping please send a quick note to littlehelper@candylabtoys.com
Access our Media Kit here.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are on our 8th Campaign. While we typically say nothing can go wrong, but it may, this time is different. Based on longstanding relationships with our suppliers, we have already completed tooling and production is well underway with little to no advance payments. We are confident that once the modest goal of this campaign is funded, we can safely deliver your rewards on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Preview
Stories for Ways & Means: The AUDIOBOOK
About:
What do Devendra Banhart, Nick Cave, Alison Mosshart, and Tom Waits have in common? They're all contributors to Stories for Ways & Means, a whimsical illustrated collection of short stories by some of our greatest living songwriters. 
The literary value of songwriting, for those who still had any doubts, was validated when a recent Nobel Prize in Literature went neither to a poet or a novelist, but to Bob Dylan. This long overdue recognition of the literary contributions of songwriters coincided with the publication of a book celebrating original children's stories written by musicians. In a stroke of serendipity, the release of Stories for Ways & Means couldn’t have been timelier.
It all started when Jeff Antebi (founder of Waxploitation Records) found himself wondering, "What kind of children's story would Devendra Banhart write if he was asked to write one?" "What would a story look like if it was written by Nick Cave, and illustrated by Anthony Lister?" Or "What would a story by Frank Black sound like if it was narrated by Danny Devito?" And so he set out to answer these questions. 
In the near-decade that followed, Jeff turned these "why-nots" into Stories for Ways & Means, a book of grown-up children’s stories by some of this era’s most compelling storytellers from the worlds of music and contemporary art—with proceeds benefitting NGOs and nonprofit organizations advancing children’s literacy worldwide (including Room to Read, Pencils of Promise, 826 National, and War Child.)    
SFWAM exhibition at the acclaimed Corey Helford Gallery in Los Angeles
The book includes collaborations with Tom Waits, Nick Cave, Frank Black, Devendra Banhart, Bon Iver's Justin Vernon, Laura Marling, Kathleen Hanna, Gary Numan, Jim James (of My Morning Jacket), Manuel “Guajiro” Mirabal (of Buena Vista Social Club), Will Oldham, Alison Mosshart (of The Kills), Anna Von Hausswolff, Satomi Matsuzaki (of Deerhoof), Elliphant, Alec Empire, Amadou Bagayoko (of Amadou & Mariam), Del the Funky Homosapien, Matthew Dear, Micachu, Song Yuzhe, Ernest Ranglin, Eugene Hutz (of Gogol Bordello), Gibby Haynes (of Butthole Surfers), Jason Lytle, Sera Cahoone and Spencer Krug (of Moonface) ...as well as painters/illustrators like James Jean, Anthony Lister, Dan Baldwin, Ronzo, Kai & Sunny, Alessia Iannetti, Asha Zero, Candice Tripp, Carlin Diaz, Cinta Vidal, Clare Rojas, Daniel Munoz "SAN", Dave Kinsey, David Bray, Heisuke Kitazawa or PCP, Herakut, Joe Coleman, Kirsty Whiten, Lidia de Pedro, Loa Hjalmtysdottir, Maria Rivans, Sage Vaughn, SEPE, Swoon, Will Barras and more. 
While creating the project, we made sure to record many of the writers narrating their own stories.  We also brought in special guests to narrate such as Andre Royo (Actor: "The Wire", "Empire"), Channy Leaneagh (of Poliça), Danny Devito, D.R.A.M., Ken Nordine (Handpicked by Tom Waits - American voice-over artist, best known for his series of Word Jazz albums), King Krule, Kumail Nanjiani (Actor: "Silicon Valley", "The Big Sick"), Lauren Lapkus (Actress: "Orange is the New Black", "Crashing"), Lauren Mayberry (of CHVRCHES), Lizzo, Madeline Follin (of Cults), Nick Offerman (Actor: "Parks and Rec"), Orvan Smárason (of Múm ), Phil LaMarr (Actor:  "Mad TV", "Futurama"), Sarah Jones (Tony Award-winning Broadway Actress), Vivian Bang (Actress: "Memoirs of a Geisha"), and Zach Galifianakis.
Hardcover Edition
The book was a smash success and received praise from Rolling Stone, Pitchfork, Bill­board, Juxtapoz, Noisey, Okayplayer, The Talk­house, DIY, Paste, Pigeons and Planes, Conse­quence of Sound, and more. Now it’s time to hear the stories spoken aloud, the way lyrics were meant to be! Help us produce the audiobook version with a star-studded list of narrators. See below for details and thank you in advance for your support! 
Stories for Ways & Means takes many forms including a hardcover art book, a contemporary art gallery exhibition, short animated films, and now—with your patronage—a fantastic AUDIOBOOK. 
Stories we plan to include in the AUDIOBOOK include:
 Will Oldham's story "Death To Boys" narrated by Vivian Bang.
 Tom Waits' story "Circus" narrated by Ken Nordine. 
 Spencer Krug's story "Right On Rosie" self-narrated.
 Sera Cahoone's story "Merle is a Fat Orange Cat" self-narrated
 Satomi Matsuzaki's story "Little Hollywood" self-narrated 
 Orvar Smárason's "Marglytta (Jellyfish)" self-narrated
 Nick Cave's story "The Lonely Giant" narrated by Andre Royo.
 Micachu's story "How To Escape From a Wasp" narrated by special guest King Krule 
"Guajiro"'s "The Tiny Trumpet Player..." narrated by special guest Policia's Channy Leaneagh

 Jim James' story "Oslo and Plum" narrated by special guest Phil LaMarr

 Gibby Haynes' story "The Next Big Thing" narrated by special guest Zach Galifianakis

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we are fairly sure that all of the narrations we have been working on will make it to the final audiobook, we cannot guarantee it. The nature of these situations involves creative, legal, and recording logistics. We were able to successfully manage and navigate an 8-year process to get the book created, so the audiobook should by icing on the cake. We don't see it as a risky venture.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: In the interest of maximizing the donation we can make, we've cut the prices of most of the artwork that was unsold by up to 50%.   The next few hours would be a good time to grab something.  :}

updates.update_userinfo: For the James Jean super collector
updates.update_content:
As we round the bend with 72 hours left, we've decided to do a James Jean super collector bundle.  All FIVE limited edition prints and a hardcover book.  :}
If you know any James Jean fans, let 'em know.

updates.update_userinfo: Signed Gnarl Barkley CD added as reward bonus
updates.update_content: We've opened up our vault and gone through the archives and found our secret stash of CDs signed by Gnarls Barkley.   Both Cee-Lo and Danger Mouse.   We were planning on keeping them, but have decided to add them to our Kickstarter.  :}

updates.update_userinfo: Limited Edition Signed R.L. Boyce CD added
updates.update_content: We've added a new item.   It's a softcover edition of book + CD signed by Grammy nominated artist R.L. Boyce.

Hi Everyone -
We're rounding the corner to the final week.
Thanks so much for supporting the project.
If there's anything you can recommend to help us keep spreading the word, we appreciate all feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: ALL Rewards AUTOMATICALLY come with AUDIOBOOK
updates.update_content: There's no Audiobook Bundle because ALL rewards come with Audiobook included.  :}

project_data.project_name: Stories for Ways & Means: The AUDIOBOOK

campaign.story:
The more we raise through the Super Kickstarter!, the more new Aquabats music and Super Show mini-episodes you'll get!!!
And during our FINAL COUNTDOWN LIVESTREAM, we smashed through our $600,000 stretch goal, unlocking ALL of this:
And here's what that means... 
UPDATE: We reached our first goal in under 30 minutes, which means...
Next year, The Aquabats will write and record a BRAND NEW ALBUM.. our first since Hi-Five Soup in 2011!
It also means we'll have NEW SONGS to play next year, so we can celebrate in your town when we hit the road for our THE AQUABATS! 25TH ANNIVERSARY TOUR!
UPDATE: We reached our second goal in under four hours, so...
The Aquabats will also make at least six NEW MINI-EPISODES of The Aquabats! Super Show!, and release them online! 
UPDATE: We reached our third goal in the final week, which means...
Now The Aquabats will make at least TWELVE NEW MINI-EPISODES – enough to have new episodes every month for a year! – and release a LIVE CONCERT ALBUM!
The concert album will be from April 2018's epic The Fury of the Aquabats: 20th Anniversary show at the Fonda Theater, which brought back Catboy, Chainsaw, Prince Adam, Baron Von Tito and more for an insane reunion!  And... 
All backers at the $35 PLEDGE LEVEL AND ABOVE now get the live concert as a FREE DOWNLOAD!
UPDATE: We reached our fourth goal during our FINAL COUNTDOWN livestream on September 29th, which means...
The Aquabats will be able to record TWO BRAND NEW ALBUMS in 2019... and all backers at the $55 PLEDGE LEVEL and above will get the extra album, before it comes out, as a FREE DOWNLOAD!
So you see, Oh Righteous Comrades, it's up to you to decide: does the world still need The Aquabats? The answer – and how much cool new stuff The Aquabats can make – is up to you!
Looking for our original stretch goals? 
Our original plans for more stretch goals also included a LIVE CONCERT FILM (at $750,000), a PRIVATE LIVESTREAM CONCERT for backers (at $1,000,000), and up to a year of weekly online episodes! We changed it up because you requested more new music, but we're not giving up on the other goals! Keep checking our UPDATES PAGE after the campaign, and we'll tell you what's next.
When you pledge, you'll get all kinds of super rad, exclusive rewards. 
See for yourself!
PLUS, all kinds of SPECIAL REWARDS and ONCE-IN-A-LIFETIME OPPORTUNITIES!
And don't forget, you can also get all kinds of extra rewards and exclusive items in our official ADD-ON REWARD STORE, including one of our most requested rewards:
CHECK OUT THESE REWARD DESIGNS:
                No problem, new friend! Start by watching this quick video: 
Awesome, right?! You can also...
LISTEN to a bunch of our songs and albums! 
WATCH some full episodes of The Aquabats! Super Show! 
Some professional TV-watching people really liked our show too:
In fact, believe it or not...
There are a MILLION ways to help the Super Kickstarter succeed, and get the world that much closer to having a brand-new Aquabats album and more Super Show! mini-episodes. 
SEE THE FULL LIST!
Or, here are some easy ways to help right now:
PLEDGE NOW!
Even if you change your pledge later, it helps to have as many Righteous Comrades as possible! Plus, you aren't charged anything until we meet our goal AND the campaign ends!

FOLLOW US! 
We're @TheAquabats on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube!
TELL OTHER PEOPLE! 
If you love The Aquabats and think you might know other people who would too, now's the perfect time to get them into it!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This won't work, and no one actually likes The Aquabats...?

Also, even though we know we've got friends all over the world, it's always possible that we won't be able to reach enough of them before this Kickstarter ends. But, if we reach our minimum goal, we'll be able to keep raising more funds AFTER the Kickstarter ends, which will give us time to reach more old friends!

But, as long as the Kickstarter succeeds, we've GOT THIS! We've made albums before, and we know how to do it again. We also have made two seasons of Super Show, and just made a new mini-season for this Kickstarter, so we know we can make some great new episodes for you, even on a tight budget!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: SECRET FRIENDS!
support.descp:
Are you just here to help the cause? Did one of The Aquabats’ SECRET FRIENDS send you?
However you got here, you’ll have The Aquabats’ ETERNAL GRATITUDE… and next year, we’ll also send you a special VIDEO THANK YOU MESSAGE.
And who knows… maybe our secret friends will throw in some extra surprise rewards!?
After the Kickstarter ends, you’ll tell us which friend sent you! Get more details about our SECRET FRIENDS at http://theaquabats.com/secretfriends!
This reward is now included with EVERY PLEDGE LEVEL, so if you've already pledged, you'll get this reward too -- and if you're just arriving, you can choose ANY pledge level!
INCLUDES:
Secret THANK YOU Video!

support.title: [[ JUST THE DIGITAL STUFF! ]]
support.descp:
Don't want a bunch of cool "stuff" sitting around cluttering up your life? No problem: this package is 100% DIGITAL MAGIC!!
This package is floating in another dimension because you won't actually receive ANY physical rewards… BUT that means you won't pay any shipping!! YES!!

updates.update_content: Dear Pajamazon-jamming Legion,

campaign.story:
Are you a Huell Fan? 
This year KCET is celebrating the 25th anniversary of the iconic TV show Visiting with Huell Howser. Nobody was more curious and open-minded about California than Huell Howser. During his time with KCET, he produced over a thousand episodes of his various shows.
Huell loved California!
He loved the big vistas, the hidden gems, the off-beat people who always turned out to have a story you didn't expect. And that's why California loved him.
Huell Howser takes in a performance of the song, "La Noche Está Serena," at the Lummis House in Highland Park.
Many of the programs haven't been seen in years.
Huell's old tapes won't last forever, they're sitting in his archive waiting to be digitally converted for broadcast and streaming. A lot of the early episodes still need closed captions and many need to be re-captioned to new standards. Each streaming platform requires its own file formats. For example, the process of making Huell available on Amazon is different than the process for KCET's Roku channel.
Huell visits William Gore Sr. and his wife, Lena Gore at the Cobbler Factory in Pasadena.
You can be a part of Huell’s legacy by actively participating in the preservation of his show. 
This is where you come in. You can engage directly with this program you love. Huell fans have been clamoring for more episodes to be broadcast on KCET. You’ve been asking us to make more episodes available for streaming. We heard you and created a Kickstarter campaign to do exactly that.
An original Betacam cassette of an early Visiting episode.
Join forces with KCET to make these classic programs available for everyone to see.
We want to broadcast and stream more rare and vintage episodes of Visiting with Huell Howser. What better way to celebrate 25 years of adventures? With the funds raised here, our team will digitize and re-caption these old tapes for broadcast on KCET and for streaming on multiple platforms like Amazon, Roku and Apple TV.
We’ve hand-picked the best early and rare episodes of Visiting from Huell's archives.
The next step is to pull the master tapes from the archives and get them into our new system at KCET. From there, our engineers and video coordinators can convert the episodes into the proper formats for each streaming platform so you can watch Huell where you watch your other favorite shows.
Congratulations, Huell fans - you did it! Thanks to you, there will be more Huell Howser in the world.
"Huell loved to be around people. He taught me the art of storytelling, and that made me a better cameraman."
      - Luis Fuerte
Huell Howser in a field of California Poppies.
"If, like me, you arrived in LA in the middle of Huell's long career, there are so many episodes you never got a chance to see, but need to see. Also, frankly, young Huell is drop-dead gorgeous."
      - John Rabe, 89.3-KPCC
Huell Howser and Luis Fuerte on location.
"If you have a good story, it doesn’t have to be overproduced. I want our stories to reveal the wonders of the human spirit and the richness of life in California, including its history, people, culture and natural wonders."
      - Huell Howser
Huell with Vahan, Ara and Khechig Manoogian in 1990.
  Huell fans unite and check out our rewards!
The images below are illustrations, the rewards are created and shipped once the campaign reaches its goal.
Pledge $5 or more: We've Made a New Friend
Thank you for joining forces to make more Huell episodes available for all to see.
Pledge $15 or more: Excitin'
Stay cool with this "I'm a Huell Fan!" personal fan made from recycled plastic.
Pledge $25 or more: Amazing!
Show everyone you're a part of Huell's legacy with this enamel pin with a bright nickel finish. Since you're amazing, you also get a purple and gold Huell postcard. PLUS, to celebrate reaching 50% of our goal, everyone that pledges at this level or above gets a bonus reward: a round purple and gold 2" vinyl Huell sticker thrown in for free! 

Pledge $60 or more: Spectacular!
Imagine how many new friends you could make walking around town in one of these spectacular "I'm a Huell Fan!" T-shirts. Available in tie dye, grey or white. You can select your size and color when you receive your email survey from Kickstarter. We'll throw in a postcard and sticker, too.

Pledge $80 or more: Now That's Neat!
Can't decide between pin and shirt? You can have both, plus a postcard and a sticker. Choose your T-shirt size and color when you fill out the Kickstarter email survey at the end of the campaign.
Pledge $100 or more: Oh My Gosh!
What would you carry in your "I'm a Huell Fan!" tote bag? It comes with an enamel pin, a postcard and a sticker.

Pledge $225 or more: Absolutely beautiful!
Superfans are key to preserving Huell's legacy - they go "full tote bag" and get a Huell gift bag stuffed with all of the above rewards, PLUS a signed copy of Luis Fuerte's book, Louie, Take a Look at This! My time with Huell Howser. Huell's longtime camera operator recounted their adventures together in his beautifully printed full color hardcover book and he wants you to have a signed copy.

Pledge $365 or more: Is This Guy Serious?
KCET staff wants to thank you in person with a guided tour of the station. You and a guest are invited. Of course, you also get the Huell superfan gift bag stuffed with all of the above rewards.

Pledge $625 or more: Louie, Take a Look at This!
Dinner for two with Luis Fuerte at KCET. Huell's longtime camera operator Luis Fuerte wants to meet you and personally thank you for keeping the spirit of the show alive. Join Luis and KCET staff for dinner at our station. Take home all of the above rewards, including a signed copy of Luis' book.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
KCET is a bustling public media organization with a commitment to serving the community. While we don’t expect any delays in fulfilling our commitment to you, it is possible that an urgent matter could impact our projected timeline. If that happens, we will do our best to get back on track as soon as possible since Huell Howser programming is important to the community we serve.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Celebrate Presidents' Day with a Huell Howser Marathon!
updates.update_content:
Join Huell as he gets the Presidential tour of Occidental College in Eagle Rock, where Barack Obama spent his Freshman and Sophomore years. We'll visit his dorm room, talk to some of his old professors, and learn how his two years there helped to shape him. The six-and-a-half hour marathon will follow Huell up and down the California coast visiting popular locations such as Mt. San Jacinto and Yosemite National Park.
The fun begins at 8:00 a.m. on Monday Feb. 18 only on KCET.

updates.update_userinfo: Join Huell's cameraman Luis Fuerte for a free screening and panel at the Central Library!
updates.update_content:
Join us Sunday, February 10 at 2pm at the Mark Taper Auditorium in the Central Library in downtown LA.
There will be a free screening of "Visiting the Central Library with Huell Howser" and a panel discussion featuring Huell's cameraman, Luis Fuerte. Other panelists include Huell's producers, Phil Noyes and Harry Pallenberg.

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards have all been shipped and more episodes are rolling out
updates.update_content:
Thanks again to everyone who contributed and helped to spread the word. You should all have your rewards by now and we hope to see folks walking around town sporting their Huell shirts and pins.
In the past 2 months, we’ve digitized 63 more vintage episodes of Visiting. Most of these haven’t been broadcast in well over 15 years. All of them are streaming here: kcet.org/shows/huell-howser

updates.update_userinfo: Amazing! Enamel pins in the mail!
updates.update_content:
The enamel pins are being manufactured, the T-shirts are being printed and everything should be in your hands by late October.   
October will also see KCET’s airwaves and website filled with classic Huell episodes that haven’t been shown in years. We just borrowed 40 tapes from Huell’s archives and they are being prepared for broadcast on-air and streaming on KCET.org, later they will hit our other streaming channels.

campaign.story:
You guys did it! Sorta!
From the Brothers Chaps and James Ernest comes Trogdor!! the Board Game. For centuries, the legendary wingaling dragon Trogdor the Burninator has terrorized the peasant kingdom of Peasantry with his scorching flames and greased-up beefy arm. Now, he has descended from the mountains once again and will not stop until he burninates the entire countryside and all those unfortunate enough to get in his way!
You and up to 5 friends -or maybe people you just paid to come over- take on the roles of a cult of hooded creepos calling themselves the Keepers of Trogdor who have devoted their lives to aiding the mighty dragon in his quest for total and complete burnination.
Just a few of the 9 Keepers of Trogdor available in the game. More like Creepos of Trogdor if you ask me.
Take turns guiding Trogdor on his destructive lost weekend around Peasantry. Help him avoid pesky knights and archers, devour peasants, burninate the countryside, and, of course, the thatched roof COTTAGES!!
A flaming peasant flees her flaming cottage. Or maybe she's running back in to save her rare vinyl.
Uh oh. We got a Trog-spinner.
All artwork and assets not final. You're gonna see those words a lot.
1 wooden Trogdor meeple
7 wooden Peasant meeples
1 removable wooden Flame Helmet for the Peasants
2 wooden Knight meeples
1 wooden Troghammer meeple
1 wooden Archer Twins meeple
3 wooden cottages with flippable burninated side
25 double-sided thick cardboard terrain tiles 
1 thick cardboard Trog-meter
1 deck of 36 casino quality, blackjack-sized Trogdeck cards
1 deck of 45 casino quality, blackjack-sized movement cards
9 tarot-sized Keepers of Trogdor cards
9 tarot-sized Magical Item cards
Instruction booklet
The game will come in a box with full color art by our pal Chris Schweizer (Crogan Adventures, The Creeps) who also illustrated the countryside tiles, item cards, and the Keepers of Trogdor.
Boring box dimensions: 12.5" high x 8.9" wide x 2.8" deep
Trogdor!! is a co-op puzzle, area control game where 2-6 players work together to help a beefy-armed dragon completely decimate a kingdom using unique powers and items all while avoiding knights and archers bent on stopping you. 
Play time is 30-45 minutes with variable levels of difficulty the players can set. The age is 14+.
How to burninate cottages: Surround, scorch the ground, flip that thatched-up mound. Stop-mo by Graw Mad.
Here's Strong Sad's hands with an episode of his tabletop review series 'Six-Sadded, Die' to play through a couple turns for you:
PLAY

Stack em to the heavens! Stack em to the heavens! You can play an unofficial game where you make up the rules yourself called Stack Em To The Heavens!!
The Wingaling Level is our base level tier. It includes the full boxed game (contents listed up the page a bit) with screen-printed wooden meeple game pieces.
Next is the Burninator Level. It has the full boxed game with wooden meeples like the Wingaling Level, but it ALSO includes a full set of high quality plastic miniature game pieces including:
Sculpts by Rick Van Velsor. Prototype 3D printing and scanning by 3D-printingtech.com
1 plastic Trogdor mini
7 plastic Peasant minis
1 plastic removable Flame Helmet for Peasants
2 plastic Knights minis
1 plastic Troghammer mini
1 plastic Archer Twins mini
3 plastic thatched roof cottage bases
3 plastic thatched roof cottage roofs with flippable burninated underside
NOTE: plastic miniatures come packaged separately but they WILL fit inside the box along with their wooden meeple step-siblings
Hey, guess what? Can you guess? All art and assets not final.
Hold on to your angry eyebrows because things are about to start getting fancy-go-nuts! We have partnered with the incredible artisans at Wyrmwood Gaming, makers of high-end, handcrafted wooden game boards, tables, and accessories to bring you the following insane tiers:
Did you need more beef with your Burninator? Then you require the Wyrmwood Beefy Level. This level includes: 
the full boxed game with meeples and plastic minis
this beautifully handcrafted and engraved wooden game board made of cherry.
Keep the countryside tiles in place and flip em with ease thanks to awesome tilt-a-tile technology (I just made that name up). 
Engraved compass rose so Troggie always knows where he's going
NOTE: this game board does NOT feature Trogdor engraved on the back like the next two tiers
Prototype cards and minis shown above. Did we mention all art and assets NOT final?
The Wyrmwood Majesty Level gets even more nuts! It has the full boxed game included in the Burninator Level PLUS this incredible, handcrafted cherry box and game board featuring:
engraved cherry wood 
removable engraved lid/game board with cool tilt-a-tile technology for easy flippins
engraved compass rose so Troggie knows where he's goin'
card/game piece storage box
detachable Trogshelf with recessed Peasant Void
separate engraved cherry Trog-meter
box dimensions: 18 13/18" x 18 13/18" x 2 1/4"(2 9/16" high with lid)
lid/playboard dimensions: 17 15/16" x 17 15/16" x 13/16"
Art and design not final. Do you love reading that over and over?
Again, prototype cards and minis shown here. But I have some good news, all art and assets NOT final!
The Wyrmwood Consummate Level is where the artisans (woodworking nerds) at Wyrmwood really get to show off their 'skills of an artist.' It has all the same contents and features of the Wyrmwood Majesty Level made with even more luxurious woods and materials and a built in Lazy-Susan! 
removable engraved lid/game board made of fancy woods I can't pronounce: Wenge, Waterfall Bubinga, Tiger Maple inlaid with Jet, Silver stringing, and Brass! 
gameboard still has cool tilt-a-tile technology for easy flippins
engraved compass rose so Troggie knows where he's goin' 
card/game piece storage box 
detachable Trogshelf with recessed Peasant Void
separate engraved Wenge Trog-meter
box dimensions: 18 13/18" x 18 13/18" x 2 1/4"(2 9/16" high with lid) 
lid/playboard dimensions: 17 15/16" x 17 15/16" x 13/16"
built-in Lazy-Susan so you can rotate the board to whosoever's turn it may be!
All art and assets not final comes with everything you see here.
Tilt-a-tile tech in action! The most satisfying card flip you'll ever see/hear. Bonus feature: all art and assets not final.
Built-in Lazy Susan lets you turninate the countryside! Makes the game fun for your friends who can't read upside-down!
Take a look at this incredible making-of video from the craftiarts at Wrymisan. Er, the Wrymisoods at Artiwood. The artifacts at Warmfood. Anyways, Strong Bad provided director commentary for it.
PLAY

We know you want more! Keep supporting us, and more crazy cool things will keep happening.
Our first stretch goal was to reach $150,000 allowing us to have new art made so the game can include all unique, non-repeating game board tiles and use spot UV on the flames on the burninated side to increase the effect of burnination (we didn't know what it meant either, it makes a part of the art shinier than the others. cool!). 
Art and assets so NOT final it hurts!
Our second stretch goal was to reach $250,000. See that "Stack Em To The Heavens" gif back up the page? We're gonna turn that into a real mini game and you'll get a little canvas bag with the rules on it to keep all the meeples in so you can take em with you and play at coffee shops and DMVs everywhere! We will also be able to bring you a Companion Soundboard Website with catchy Strong Bad phrases, music, and sound effects to enhance your game play.
You also unlocked a new Strong Bad Email! And the email Strong Bad answers will be from a lucky backer! That's right, the next sbemail that gets made will be chosen from 'emails' submitted in the comments by backers!
We know you love video content, so we're bringing you more! Strong Bad will be continuing his Skills of an Artist series by drawing one of your suggestions in the comment section of the campaign in an upcoming video. 
Oh man! Look! Here is that video we just mentioned a sentence or two ago! You can watch it now! Thanks to backer Chris O'Connor for the suggestion!
We're adding some game upgrades! We're upgrading the cards to be linen cards so they're easy to shuffle and feel luxurious right out of the box. In addition to that, we're adding some spot UV to the flames of the game box itself, giving your box the ultimate effect of burnination. 
For our fifth stretch goal, we'll be bringing you an all new Six-Sadded, Die video but in the meantime, grab the file (innie or outie) to 3D print your own Six-Sadded, Die! Help us get to 12,000 backers so we can do it! 
Art not final!
We decided to give you a surprise gift when we hit 12,000 backers! Strong Bad will be adding some of his own Keeper and Item cards for the game. 
For our sixth stretch goal, we'll be adding alternate Trogdor Meeples based on the designs by Coach Z, Strong Mad, Strong Sad, and Strong Bad to the game. We need 15,000 backers to do it! 
You guys sorta did it!
We're doing that thing that campaigns do! It's Backer Burnination Bingo! Do awesome stuff in real life, help Trogdor burninate this cottage and we'll do dumb stuff in return!
In our game, before you can use an action to burninate a cottage, you must burninate all the surrounding terrain tiles as well as the tile the cottage is on. In such fashion, help Trogdor burninate everything by fulfilling all the dumb demands on the terrain tiles and cottage itself! Once you’ve done them all, you will be rewarded by a live stream of Matt playing Strong Bad’s Cool Game For Attractive People and performing all the voices LIVE until he gets tired of it, or his throat gives out!
Submit your achievements to Maya at maya@homestarrunner.com. When you submit pictures and content to us, know that we may post your picture in an update to show your awesomeness! You can track what achievements have been reached on this board which will be just below the stretch goal section of our campaign.
UPDATE: We gave you the video of 25 people yelling 'Trogdor!' (though we'd still like to see that) since today (Aug 11, '18) is the 10th anniversary of the release of SBCG4AP and since the campaign's almost over. SO, On Sunday Aug 12th at 6pm EST, Matt is gonna do a Kickstarter Live while playing the game and performing the voices like we already said a couple paragraphs ago! Tune in and chat and comment and watch as the wheels come off!!
Matt and Mattsets NOT Final.
Art and assets NOT final. But in the ballpark. The meeply ballpark.
We're going to make a whole set of meeples of the 12 main Homestar Runner characters. Use them in this board game, or drop em into whatever other tabletop experience you want! You can also add these in BackerKit for an additional cost.
Oh, hey guess what? All art and images not final.
You allowed us to be able to make some screen-printed T-Shirt add-ons! There will be a Trogdor box art design and a 'Six-Sadded, Die.' design. You can add them in BackerKit during the survey period for an additional cost. 
"Bring the fun of pyromania into your living room with TROGDOR! the BOARD GAME! Finally all the delight of torching screaming peasants with none of the pesky jailtime that would accompany burning people in real life. Crack open a cold one, grab your personal DND Greg, and prepare to Burninate your cares away with the game that puts the "AAAAA" in "TABLETOP AAAAADVENTURE" Add actual lighter fluid and matches for a more realistic experience!*" *Legal Note: Please do not do this
-Alex Hirsch, board game copy writer extraordinaire, creator of Gravity Falls
"Trogdor my love, over my heart I have thatched a roof. I kissed every dried straw. Thatched them together with poems for you so tight. A tight thatch helps shed water away and insulate my heart for you Trogdor. Burninate me. Burninate my cottaged heart to cinders and consume me to fill your Trog-Meter.. then can you squish my ashes in the crook of your muscles damn boyee.:
-Pendleton Ward, poet, creator of Adventure Time
"The game is nostalgic, fun, and engaging. I didn't expect the amount of thought I'd have to put in to win!"
-Unfiltered Gamer
"Nothing brings players together like the smell of a burning peasant in the middle of his toasty cottage surrounded by the ashy wasteland of what once was his home."
-IndieTabletop
"Trogdor is quick, quirky, and actually a bit difficult...Homestar Runner knows their audience and delivers exactly the right product for its fans."
-Pawn's Perspective
"All art and assets NOT final!"
-Lem Sportsinterviews, haver of dozens of dollars
"If Peasant's Quest was too technologically advanced, you can instead have fun burninating the countryside in Trogdor! TOGETHER!!"
-Cardboard Stacker
“I tested a Trogdor game prototype that was was just a few random LEGO pieces, some pocket lint and a linoleum tile. Even in that early form, this game was so compelling that I quit my job and alienated my family just to play it more. This game will ruin your life in the best possible way. [Think of some good “burninate” pun for here before sending this blurb to the Chaps]"
-Paul Sabourin, 48% of Paul & Storm 
There's no good reason that the Trogdor board game took 15 years to happen other than the fact that Mike and Matt (the Homestar Runner people) started playing more board games with their kids and friends.
Troggie seemed like an easy fit for a tabletop game, so they cranked out a janky prototype, and it kinda worked!
3 dice AND 2 decks? What is wrong with you guys? Kerrek tracks seem cool though.
Once it was decided that this was not the worst idea ever, they contacted Pat Rothfuss who one time sent Limozeen a box of his fantasy novels. He made a board game once and it was good, so they asked him for advice.
Pat introduced them to James Ernest from Cheapass Games. With his help, the game became playable, perhaps even... enjoyable!
Courtroom sketches of Pat and James.
While James playtested and iterated all over the place, Chris Schweizer got busy working on art for the game and our pal Rick Van Velsor (who sculpted the Homestar and Cheat Commandos figurines) began sculpting designs for the vinyl miniatures (available in the Burninator level and above). 
Rick Van Velsor takes our janky 3D Tinkercad prototype and molds it into pure majesty!
Now, the game is ready to be produced and played by burnination enthusiasts everywhere.
For updates outside of Kickstarter, like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter. Our Community Manager Maya (Secret Hitler) will be posting there with reminders about the updates here as well as stretch goal and add-on announcements. You can reach out to them at maya@homestarrunner.com if you have any additional questions. 
We will be using our friends over at Amplifier to ship you your stuff to the rest of the world and BackerKit to collect your survey information. The following shipping costs are estimates and potentially subject to change (which you would be notified about):
FOR THE WINGALING, BURNINATOR, AND WYRMWOOD BEEFY LEVELS
Within the US: $15 
Outside of the US: $25
FOR THE WYRMWOOD MAJESTY AND WYRMWOOD CONSUMMATE LEVELS
Within the US: $25
Outside of the US: $35
The shipping costs will be handled after the campaign in BackerKit when the surveys go out. The Wyrmwood Majesty and Wyrmwood Consummate levels both weigh around 13 lbs, hence the shipping cost. 
TAKE NOTE: WE DO NOT SHIP TO EVERY COUNTRY IN THE WORLD, but listing the countries we do ship to is way too long, and we know you don't want to read it. Here is a list of countries we DO NOT ship to:
Thank you Homestar fans! Thank you spouses, friends, and fambly! Thank you Kickstarter! Thank you Pat Rothfuss! Thank you James Ernest! Thank you Cheapass Games! Thank you Jonathan Ritter-Roderick! Thank you Lay Waste Games! Thank you Greater Than Games! Thank you reviewers and playtesters!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Are you asking for some Risks & Challenges?!?!

-Unforeseen overseas production delays are probably the biggest potential issue. The vinyl figurines have a long lead time and we want them to be awesome. If something went wrong during that phase of production, it could cause a delay. We are building in buffers for that sorta thing just in case.

-We already have production quotes from PandaGM and Wyrmwood. We will use BackerKit once the campaign is over and ship from Amplifier, the same fulfillment company we use for all other Homestar merch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: UPDATE on Canada Delay and Overall Shipping

Fellow Keepers of Trogdor,
Thank you everyone for your amazing patience!  Here's the run down of where things stand. 
CANADA

Fellow Keepers of Trogdor,  
We are really sorry!! We have just been told that Snakes and Lattes (the fulfillment company handling Canadian shipping) has NOT started shipping as we thought they were going to yesterday.   We do not know the details yet, but they are having a meeting tomorrow with Quartermaster to discuss the schedule-so we will send another update out at that time. campaign.story:
Candylab is at it.  Again.  
We are compulsive designers, product developers and parents (well, some of us) that have not quite let go of the inner kid.  We design, engineer, and manufacture toy cars that are absolutely loved by children and would sit nicely on a shelf too. And quite a few people say it, because we have been doing this for some years now:  we make culturally cheeky toys for contemporary humans, and everyone gets to play!   
We were born right here on Kickstarter, and since they say practice makes perfect, we kept practicing and practicing. Toy biz is a tough biz, in fact, but having an early supporter base in you, our loyal backers, always reassured us and gave us confidence in our design chops. 
...we have a real treat for you. We have been working on a radical new type of body and whole new approach to our builds, a difficult trick in woodworking.  But we persisted and the result is pushing the boundaries of woodworking and craftsmanship. And we teamed up with our friend Joey Ruiter, a Design Superhero for an extra spicy look.  He rocks.  
We give you:
With a strong nod to the peak of mid 60's automotive design when slabs reigned supreme, we created 4 new designs.  
A direct channelling of Joey Ruiter's own White Beast, an iconic mid century luxury sedan turned into a monster sleeper with a swapped engine and bagged suspension. Smooth, abstract and stunning. We didn't stop here: we 3D scanned our friend and made him into a superhero action figure, so he can tell the entire story.
 The mirror image of the White beast. We'd say the evil twin, but really which one is it? With black matte body paint and whitewall tires, the Sheep sports a lowriding body and silky smooth presence.

This one ain't a beast name, but she's fast and silky smooth. Two-tone paint fenders, white letter tires, and an attitude of barely restrained aggressivity.

A decidedly more laid back vehicular spirit, this is a new, slick take on our now famous Woodies. It has a precise veneer job with real microwood, a magnetic surfboard included and it's the first Candylab car to have covered rear wheel fenders.
They all come in a custom designed, tight fitting box, same width and length for proper stacking with your other Candylab Collectibles. We will outdo ourselves:  Silver foiled, black matte board packaging. 
For the true collectors, we now offer a solid American Walnut wood base as an optional upgrade.  Each beast has 2 pieces of Neodymium rare earth magnets, which will snap to the 2 magnets embedded in the wood base, securing the car to it.  
A true Renaissance designer, Joey's work spans automotive, nautical, furniture, graphic and product design. He is the rare designer that takes the time to build and fabricate his ideas: futuristic dune buggies, boxy snowmobiles, bikes, furniture for world-class companies and much more.  His moving, road-worthy kinetic sculptures are admired worldwide in the car community and featured in tons of publications.  His no-nonsense take on form and function is an alternate and inspiring view in the design world. That's why we love his work so much. And he has great hair too!
   In other words, he is a Design Superhero and we want to celebrate that - so we made him into an action figure!
Combining Rewards: If you'd like to pledge more than one item, please identify shipping costs for each, and 1) add it all up then 2) Type in the corresponding amount in the pledge field. Your entire total pledge will be reconfirmed once the campaign ends.
Shipping: We know, it's really expensive for you international folks. We strictly charge what postage actually costs and pay for warehousing, shipping cartons, labeling and on from the general overhead remaining. That is what carriers charge these days. 
Combining Rewards Shipping costs: There are many possible combinations of the rewards, countries and shipping weights. We tried our best to offer a fair deal, but please read the FAQ detailing this aspect.
International Shipments: For this campaign ALL our international backers will be upgraded to DHL.All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying - your pledges are without sales-tax or VAT. All Kickstarter rewards will be considered gifts, however, most countries will assess duties/taxes and in certain countries the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later. If you refuse delivery, your package will be abandoned. Once abandoned, we can’t ship another package to you or issue a refund. Filling out your shipping address correctly is very important. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. A wrong address and package sent back will incur shipping charges back to USA on our account. If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation. If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation.
 Check out our Media Kit here.

updates.update_content:
Good News! Your packages are about to be packed up and we need to be sure we are sending your goods to the correct address. Please read on...
No address, no rewards. 
1. If you have not answered your survey please do so asap! There are only 25 of you. Link here: https://artful-toy-cars.backerkit.com/
2. If you've moved, please update your address ASAP. Especially if you are outside the US! Use the same link as above to get into your survey. DO not email us. If we send your rewards to the wrong, old address and we show a confirmation of delivery, please understand that we may not be able to resend your reward.

Thank you, thank you and thank you again!
Round #7, and we are victorious, with the most complex design to date, and all thanks to you!  We will take an extra step this time and recognize our repeat backers - we have supporters that have been with us through all 7 campaigns and that deserves recognition. 
While the campaign was smoothly running, we weren't sitting idle.  Production is in full swing, and we are setting up the next step for clarifying the multiple rewards selection process.   To everyone who pledged ANYTHING at all - even $1- you will receive a private survey link, that will enable you to:

campaign.story:
TLDR: I wrote a children's book to inspire little girls to fight for equality and take initiative in public office. Women make 20+% less than men for doing the exact same job and are significantly underrepresented in political office - women of color are even further underrepresented and under paid. My story follows Sabrina, a fourth grader who runs for student council to get equal sized cookies for all of her classmates. It also speaks to the importance of equality and diversity. Please support this campaign, in any way you are able, so I can spread Sabrina's story!
Background
Over the years, I’ve been incredibly lucky to work with women who have held political office and fight for equity, so I decided to write a children's book inspired by them. It’s about a 4th grader named Sabrina who sees inequity, and runs for office to put an end to it. I’ve always loved children's books and their ability to teach lessons and promote life skills in a simple but powerful way, and I want this book to not only teach about equality and why it's important to have more women in office, but to also show a diverse cast of characters.
This story ties together the ideas of gender equity (specifically gender wage equity) and the need for more women (and specifically women of color) to have a voice as representatives in political office, all while teaching the terms and concepts that are a big part of any election. Hopefully, it’ll inspire little girls to someday get involved in politics - or even run for office themselves!
A fun glossary of terms in the beginning allows children to learn new words and see how they’re used throughout the book. (Each term is specially highlighted in the text).
Let's look at some statistics that need to change!:
Women make up over 50% of the U.S. population, yet they are significantly underrepresented both in politics and boardrooms. Currently, women hold 106 (19.8%) of the 535 seats in U.S. Congress, 22 (22%) of the 100 seats in the U.S. Senate and 84 (19.3%) of the 435 seats in the House of Representatives. Only 70 women hold statewide elective executive offices across the country out of 312, that’s 22.4%. All these numbers are even lower for women of color, who make up only 7.1% of all members of Congress. 
Did you know that only 4.6% of all of the Fortune 500 CEOs are women? Women also on average take home less pay than men in the same jobs. In Seattle, where I’m from, women make about 73% of what men earn in the same positions (nationally it’s about 79%). For women of color, the numbers are even lower. 
This needs to change! And there are a lot of different ways to contribute to this change, but the earlier we start to educate people on these issues, the greater the chance we have to make a big impact. I think children’s books are a fun way to teach lessons, instill values, and bring up topics to discuss with little readers. 
Sabrina's Story: 
Sabrina is starting the fourth grade with her two best friends, Elliott and Lainey. After noticing that boys get bigger chocolate chip cookies than girls during snack time, Sabrina decides to run for a student council seat in order to fight for an equal share. She embarks on an election campaign and works with groups such as the Art Student Association and the Milk Drinkers Union to spread her message and gain support. 
Sabrina gets endorsements, Elliott takes a voter poll, and Lainey hosts a fundraiser while her opponent Oliver attempts to sway voters with the promise of a class pet. Sabrina shows that girls and boys complete the same classwork, play the same games at recess and should have the same size snacks!
Follow her on the campaign trail! 
Illustrator: 
Charlotte Tang, a woman-of-color illustrator will bring this diverse cast of characters to life! Charlotte worked hard on developing these characters and has done amazing, adorable initial illustrations. I cannot wait to see the rest!
Rewards:
Rewards for giving to this project range from a thank you and a unique postcard of a scene from the story, to the printed book itself! Super special limited rewards include 1ft diameter chocolate chip cookie pillows, and the chance to get a character drawn into the story just for you!  
More delicious rewards include ice cream and cookie parties provided by Molly Moon's Homemade Ice Cream and Hello Robin Cookies! 
see special edition cookie pillows below!  
Cost Breakdown:
Most of the funding raised will go towards paying the illustrator. The story is already written and has been edited, but it needs to be brought to life! I worked with an illustrator on the character explorations and some initial draft pages, but there is a lot more that needs to be done! There will be about 35 pages of illustrated scenes, plus a cover, glossary, binding and back. This will be over 100 hours of work and I want to compensate the artist fairly for her work bringing this awesome project to life. Also, how cool that something like this can help provide a job for a young woman illustrator!
Funding will go towards kickstarter and payment processing fees. 
Funding will go to getting the books printed. 
Anything raised over the amount needed for development will be donated to She Should Run, an amazing nonprofit organization dedicated to getting 250,000 women across the country running for elected office by 2030! They provide the information, the tools, community and the support to help women run for elected office.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any undertaking there are risks and challenges! 

This book has already been written and edited, but there are two important steps left to complete this project, 1) illustrations and 2) book printing. 

Though I have an illustrator in mind who worked with me on initial pages, there is always a risk that the illustrations may take longer than expected or that a new illustrator may need to take on the project. 

Also, there is always a risk with any printing project, but I have identified a great local print company with a history of printing great children's books. Again timeline can be a risk if they are working on other major projects. 

With all of that said, I am committed to work through any obstacles to ensure your copies of the book make it into your hands so that readers everywhere can learn and be inspired by Sabrina and her friends!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all! 
First, thank you so much for your patience! Sabrina for Student Council is officially all illustrated, edited (many times), and at the print shop now! I am so sorry it has taken so long! It's being printed at a little place in Tacoma, they are a small team so it's taking a while, but they told me it would be printed this Summer. The printing and binding itself ended up being well over double what the kickstarter estimated, so I also needed to save money to get it fully finished and printed! But we're almost there!

campaign.story:
Special Update - We are adding two stretch goals:
Thank you to everyone who has so generously participated so far. We are humbled beyond words at your support. Since we still have a week to go and many great rewards to offer we are setting two new goals and incentives:
If we reach $35,000, Mike Musburger will curate a vintage drum kit for the studio. Mike is a dear friend of ours and has drummed for the likes of the Posies, Fastbacks, Love Battery, the Supersuckers and countless others. He’s also an ace drum tech and of course a drum collector! He’s one of our go-to people when we need the best sounding drums.
Mike Musburger - drummer extraordinaire!
If we reach $40,000 we will purchase for the studio a Mellotron 4000D. The mellotron was a mythical creature invented in late sixties. It played samples of real instruments from a tape bank. You’ve heard it as the flutes on and strings on many famous recordings like Strawberry Fields Forever or Stairway to Heaven. The Mellotron 4000D is a modern version of the instrument which includes all of the original mellotron instrument recordings and a keyboard that’s custom built to play like the original instruments. It’s been very well received in the recording and live world and would get tons of use at the studio.
Mellotron 4000D
 Johnny Sangster & Andrew Smith founded Crackle & Pop! Studio 10 years ago as a creative space to make affordable recordings. The room quickly became a magnet for artists & gear & music and the trajectory of the studio has exceeded our wildest dreams. 
Johnny Sangster @ Crackle & Pop!
This last year two major events happened that have catapulted us head first into a studio expansion. Conrad Uno, of famed Egg Studios decided to retire and in an inspired moment, gave to us his Otari MTR90 2" multitrack and a Studer B67 1/2" mixdown deck. He also made us the caretakers of his Spectra Sonics recording console originally built for Stax Records in Memphis. Right around that same time our landlord at Crackle & Pop! informed us that the space directly below us would vacate this year. The space is twice the size of our current room with luxurious ceiling height. 
We are asking for your help  to sound proof and build out the downstairs space to house our new control room, recording booth and beautiful live room. We are incredibly honored by Conrad Uno's generosity and are super excited to take on this amazing opportunity.
Crackle & Pop! began in 2006 when Johnny & Andy cajoled each other into starting an overdubbing room. We found a quirky 500sq ft space in a multi-use building above a coffee roaster in the heart of industrial Ballard, in Seattle WA. Since then the studio has contributed to projects by Mudhoney, Maggie Bjorklund, Mark Lanegan, Earth, Jesse Sykes, Ken Stringfellow & Jon Auer, Cobirds Unite & countless others. We are proud to have become the home of many local producers & engineers. We've created the "Live @ Crackle & Pop!" video series supporting artists we love and taken on countless creative projects.
 Throughout the years we've looked at ways to possibly expand our footprint & capabilities but real estate in Seattle - as everyone knows - is crazy. Until now, nothing has looked quite compelling enough to tear us away from our awesome location in Ballard. 
2017 saw the closing of Egg Studios; a beloved, low-key room that was run by Conrad Uno of PopLlama Records. Egg was the home of the Posies, Young Fresh Fellows, Presidents of the United States of America, Fastbacks, Mudhoney and many more. 
Johnny & Conrad met in 1983 when Conrad recorded and released a cassette of Johnny's band the Sharing Patrol. Johnny left Seattle the next year to pursue the Sharing Patrol from Copenhagen Denmark and Egg & PopLlama continued to grow. Conrad had become friends with Paul Scoles of Ironwood Studio, and one day at a Mariners game Paul decided that Uno should have the recording console that he was storing in boxes in his attic.
That was the Spectra Sonics recording console that Paul had purchased from Stax Studio. It had been built for Stax in 1969 and was installed in their B studio. Conrad brought the board back to life and it became the heart of Egg Studio, contributing to the sound of hundreds of classic northwest records. 
The Spectra being refurbished in Johnny's home.
In 1997 Johnny moved back to Seattle and asked Conrad if he needed someone to help out at the studio while he was at the ballpark. The Posies were about to begin recording their "breakup album" & Conrad put Johnny behind the board. Conrad continued to encourage Johnny to be at the studio, in fact telling anyone who called to record with Johnny. Thus began a many year stint as the Egg "house engineer" and really the beginning of Johnny's producer career.
When Conrad and his wife Emily decided to retire, Conrad couldn't bring himself to sell off the studio gear. Instead he decided to give it away to his friends and to the engineers who had worked at Egg; Kurt Bloch & Johnny Sangster. Conrad became very excited with the thought of his gear living on in Johnny's recording space. Crackle & Pop! has now become the proud owner of an Otari MTR90 2" 16/24 track deck, a Studer B67 1/4" mixdown deck and we have worked out a deal with Conrad to be the caretakers of the wonderful & historic Spectra Sonics Stax Console. 
One of our two new tape decks.
The unit directly below our current location is a 1000 sq ft industrial space.  It has 12 ft ceilings in the half below us and 21 ft ceilings in the other half. For those that have been to the current Crackle & Pop! it will have a very similar feel with the addition of a full band / high ceilinged / tracking space. And there will be NO STAIRS to climb with your heavy gear!
Suite 1B
The new studio will consist of:
Control Room : Dimensions - 20'L x 16'W x 11'H, housing both the Harrison Console & Spectrasonics Console, the Otari & Studer decks, our Protools rig and extensive outboard gear.
Recording Booth: Dimension - 15'L x 12'W x 11'H, housing an upright piano and our vintage amp collection. 
Live Room: Dimensions - 18'L x 23'W x 20'H, housing our Hammond A100, Wurlitzer Piano, Guitar collection & Your Band!
Entrance / Kitchenette: 5.5'W x 15'L x 10'H, hang your coat, make your coffee here. 
"Friends" / "Gap"
The studio construction will be double sheet rock, double walls throughout to decouple us from the the outside world. There will be sight lines through from control room to tracking room. We intend to maintain the vibe that everyone loves so about our current space. Keeping the day rate affordable is at the top of our priorities and that is why this we are counting on you to make this Kickstarter a success. We will offer the room at a very affordable $300 a day.
Engineer Rachel Field recording the Tripwires
Our construction guru is Brian Burnside, local rock n roller and all around great guy. We have a great community of builders and friends who are all chipping in to make it happen. Still the buildout cost is estimated at 40k.
We’ve been saving our hard earned dollars and are already part of the way there. We know that the community around what we do is very strong and that together, we will make this happen. We’ve got a lot to offer in return so please take a look. We are so excited to make this dream a reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been in the recording business for 22 some years and have seen the changes in the industry. Our own studio has grown organically and with very little debt. We are quite realistic about what it takes to keep a tracking room open in a place like Seattle.

We are not afraid of working hard and we our confident in our track record and our community. This is a terrifyingly exciting prospect and we are confident that it can and will succeed.

As we mentioned above, real estate in Seattle is rather daunting in these times. We have a 10+ year relationship with our landlord here in our building and he fully supports us and our artistic endeavors. We have secured a long term lease and will be in business in our awesome Ballard location for many years to come.

Thank you for reading and thank you for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
