support.descp: Also our dear friends at Resonant Mastering have donated a mastering session as a reward. This session with Rachel Field as engineer can be for a single ep or full length album. We’ve worked with Ed Brooks and Rachel Field at Resonant (formerly RFI) for over 20 years and can honestly say that they are some of the best in the business. http://www.resonantmastering.com

support.title: Kurt Bloch Celebrity Guest Producer
support.descp: Spend a day with the inimitable Kurt Bloch recording your music @ Crackle & Pop! Kurt was one of the main producers using Egg Studio and he's one of a kind. He has kindly agreed to donating a day of his time to spend in the studio with you. Includes studio and engineer fees.

support.title: "House Concert" with Christy McWilson
support.descp: Invite up to 12 of your friends to attend a concert at Crackle & Pop! with Christy McWilson and her West Seattle 3. We will provide the space for the show and record and film it. You can bring your friends into the warmth of our recording space for an intimate show and as a bonus get a video recording from the performance.

support.title: Studio Time (10 day block)
support.descp: Lock in enough time to record and mix the next great rock album. Bring your own engineer or arrange for a house engineer (not included). Our house engineers fees start at $150, call for producer rates.

support.title: The Tripwires back you!
support.descp: A tracking day produced by Johnny Sangster with the Tripwires backing you. Bring a song or several and have Seattle's premiere pub rock band back you. Includes studio, musician and engineer fees for a one day session.

support.title: The Jukehouse Hounds back you!
support.descp: A tracking day produced by Johnny Sangster with the Jukehouse Hounds as your backing band. Kelly Van Camp, Robert Lee Mitchell, Keith Lowe and Johnny Sangster have been honing their roots and rock n' roll around the Seattle dancehalls for many years. Have them record one or several songs. Includes studio, musician and engineer fees for a one day session.

support.title: The Seattle Wrecking Crew back you!
support.descp: Eric Eagle, Dan Walker, Keith Lowe, Jeff Fielder. These gentlemen have played on hundreds of local records including many produced by Johnny Sangster. Nimble & versatile, these fellows are some of the best in the biz. Includes studio, musician and Johnny Sangster as producer for a one day session.

updates.update_content:
Another month of marathon like activity we are now an operational recording studio. We still have a long laundry list of little things to take care of and every week we get closer and closer. In the mean time we've had a few tracking sessions and a few mixing sessions and we couldn't be more pleased with the surroundings. The rooms sound fantastic (thank you Ed Brooks) and the flow and feel of the place is exactly what we were hoping for. 
We will be throwing an informal gathering to celebrate the progress so far the afternoon of Sunday Nov 11. Please shoot Johnny or Andy a message if you'd like to stop by.

updates.update_userinfo: The finish line is in sight!
updates.update_content:
Greetings Crackle & Pop expanders, it's been an exciting and busy last month here at the new studio in Ballard. We've had a ton of help from our friends and family and I'd like to take a moment to thank them. 
Jim Sangster took on getting our control room window(s) in place - not an easy task. Jim has also been our go to "how do we build this now?" consultant. Thanks Jim!

It’s been an exciting couple of weeks getting our wiring finished, drywall up and the very very messy mudding, taping and sanding. Now we are looking to get some paint on these freshly primed walls.
If there are any Seattle folks who are handy with a roller, brush or masking tape who would be up for volunteering some time this coming week, we’d love to have your help.
Send me a note johnnyssangster@gmail.com
Last Friday was a huge milestone for us as we passed our first inspection hurdle. This week we move on to installing electrical and insulation. Here's what it looks like so far:

updates.update_userinfo: Tim Kerr - Your Name Here Mural
updates.update_content:
We are three weeks into our buildout now. Our framing is nearly complete. And then this happened.
Tim Kerr, who had graciously volunteered a painting for our studio donors was in town and got very inspired when he saw the scale of our walls / ceiling. What we thought would be a painting somewhere on our studio wall became a full blown mural.

Greetings from the Neko Case tour. It's been a whirlwind couple of weeks and still quite a few weeks to go. Yesterday was spent in Memphis TN, the home of our Spectra Sonics console. I had the good fortune to meet Scott Bomar, a renowned composer and engineer who runs Electraphonic Recording there. He took me by the Stax Museum to take a look at a sister console to ours.

updates.update_userinfo: Summertime! And we are getting closer...
updates.update_content:
Hi there lovely backers,
the sun is out in Seattle and we are zooming forward towards our buildout start date. We get access to our new space July 1st and are busily getting all of our ducks in a row. We are finally able to share some pictures with you of the space. This one is from the far wall of the live room looking up at the unit that currently houses Crackle & Pop! It gives you a sense of the size and ceiling height.

Hello everyone. We are still celebrating with our hearts all a glow over here in Crackle & Pop! land with the realization that wow - we are going to expand!
We’ve begun reaching out both via the kickstarter survey tools and also via direct email. You should all hear from us in the next few days with how we’ll get your rewards to you. Our buildout should start July 1st but there’s a possibility that we can get access a few weeks earlier. Our goal is to be up and functional by Sept 1.

Yesterday was incredible. We zoomed right past our goal of 30K with a week to go. Thank you all. Your generosity and support has truly warmed our hearts.
Since we still have many very enticing rewards available we’ve decided to add two “stretch goals”. These are both things that we feel will excite our fellow musicians as they will be available to anyone who comes to use the studio.
If we reach $35,000, Mike Musburger will curate a vintage drum kit for the studio. Mike is a dear friend of ours and has drummed for the likes of the Posies, Fastbacks, Love Battery, the Supersuckers and countless others. He’s also an ace drum tech and of course a drum collector! He’s one of our go-to people when we need the best sounding drums.

campaign.story:
Cicero is a tool of 26 cards that you can place wherever you want and which helps you analyse, structure and write your speeches. 
We are Matteo and Andrea. We are inventors. We designed two very successful products (Intùiti Creative Cards and Fabula Storytelling Cards). And this time we decided to work on a solution for efficiently speaking in public.
You can place Cicero on walls, tables, floors or any other available surface, with the help of adhesive putty or tape. Each card is like a box to fill, so you can just arm yourself with post-its and a pen, and start working your speech!
You can place it on every available surface

COMPOSITION
In each deck you'll find:
7 GROUNDWORK cards; 
5 MAIN POINTS DEVELOPMENT cards; 
14 STRUCTURE cards: 
a booklet with instructions.
The composition of Cicero

THE GROUNDWORK CARDS
The GROUNDWORK cards are the white cards in your deck and they help you organise the basic elements of your speech.
They give you the right questions, for example:
Who's the audience? 
What are their expectations? 
How much time do you have? 
What's the goal of your speech? 
Place the GROUNDWORK cards and build the context of your speech, sticking around them notes, images and whatever comes to your mind!
The 7 Groundwork Cards


DEVELOPING THE MAIN POINTS
The Main Points are the cores of your speech. This is the most crucial phase: imagine it as a sort of brainstorming. Start asking yourself: "What do I want to say? What are the most essential topics? So... which are the main points of my speech?".
Each Main Point is composed of:
a Key Sentence – This is the concept you want to communicate (e.g. "My product is very useful", "The groom will be a loyal husband", "This company has a glorious history");
Facts to support the sentence – To say something is not enough: you should always provide proofs and facts to confirm your Key Sentence (e.g. if you are selling a product, you can describe the reason why it's useful; if you are saying the groom is loyal, you would tell some anecdotes about it);
a Transition to the next Main Point – It never sounds right to jump from one topic to another. Sometimes the right phrase is enough (e.g. "I told you about our product, now I wanna tell you something about the creation process", or "Well, now you know about the groom, but what about the bride?").
After defining your Main Points, you need to decide which is the most effective way to connect them. It could be using a chronological order, or an analytical one (first describe the product, then the benefits, then the team behind it), or the Problem/Solution strategy. That's what you'll be able to define with the card Pattern. 
The 5 Main Points Development Cards

BUILDING YOUR SPEECH
With the Structure Cards (the black cards in the deck) you can consider all the elements of your speech and start writing your first draft.
We followed a very effective structure that can be adapted successfully to any kind of speech:
Lure – In the first part of your speech you should say something to grab the audience attention (The Hook) and to explain them why they should trust you in what you are saying (The Credibility Statement);
Introduce – Now it's the moment to start promising something to your audience, to underline a problem they didn't consider yet but that you are going to solve;
Main Points – Here you can use the Main Points you developed with the red cards!
Conclusion – At the end of the speech, you'll make sure to recap all the important information and to create a call to action in the audience.
You will be able to control every detail: Figures of Speech, Actions, Gestures, the Tone of the Voice, and the Slides you are gonna project (if needed).
The 14 Structure Cards

IT WORKS WITH ANY KIND OF SPEECH
We tested Cicero and the structure is perfectly flexible:

MAKING OF
The development took almost a year. For the first 3 months we studied the theory of Public Speaking in order to synthesise a practical and easy-to-use structure. Then we worked on the actual product to create a delightful experience. At last, we tested Cicero with around 20 users and the results were extraordinary!
The very first prototype of Cicero

REWARDS
 
THE TEAM
The minds behind Cicero
Andrea Binasco and Matteo di Pascale are true creative souls. Andrea is an expert teacher and Matteo is a designer, author of Intùiti Creative Cards. Together they designed Fabula, a framework for Storytelling.
Marco Venturini is a Public Speaking expert and a Communication Consultant. Author of several books on Communication Skills, he is columnist for important newspaper.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we did with our previous project Fabula, we set the goal at the minimum possible because we want to see it realised and we want people to use Cicero. 

We are ready for all circumstances. We know very well how to produce card decks (see http://www.intuiti.it and https://fabuladeck.com/), and as every entrepreneurs we have our own history of production and shipping issues and we are now able to handle them better than ever.

So trust us: we are going to make you satisfied as much as you want!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

And thanks again for your support!

campaign.story:
This is a New Endeavor for Chop Shop Studio: Posters for Kids!  
This is a new endeavor for Chop Shop Studio: posters for kids! These new designs aim to bring space exploration to the next generation of enthusiasts and be awesome while doing so.
Poster #1: Voyager Screen Print
With this year’s eclipse and Cassini’s last transmission, there has been a lot of wonderful public interest in space. My love of space started at 12 years old when I first picked up a copy of Cosmos. We hope to capture the curiosity of our audience and cultivate a lifelong love of science and art–like Carl Sagan did for me.
We have been lucky to have built a studio of all things space.
Space Exploration Related Designs by Chop Shop 2010-17
We’ve taken the three most popular robotic space missions from our original Spacecraft Series–Voyager (shown at top), Cassini, and The Mars Rovers–and have illustrated them for the young and young at heart. These missions brought us so much incredible knowledge: the first image of Earth and our moon, the discovery of volcanoes on Io, Titan revealed as an Earth-like planet with lakes and rain of methane, and discovering a long complex history of water on Mars—and that’s only the beginning!
The Planetary Society
The Official Planetary Society Store
We are also proud to announce that as of a few days ago, this project has been officially adopted by The Planetary Society. This means that these three posters will join their growing catalog of products sold at chopshopstore.com/planetarysociety where a portion of the profits will go to help to fund their ongoing mission: To empower the world's citizens to advance the cause of space science and exploration.
We want to create a fun poster series that not only showcases these stellar bodies, but ALSO celebrates the amazing missions that opened up these worlds.
Poster #2: Cassini Screen Print
  Poster #3: Mars Rovers Screen Print
Above is poster #2 for Cassini followed by Mars Rovers featuring the full family of Mars rovers: Curiosity (front), Opportunity (back), Sojourner (right) and shown in landing mode Spirit (left) and the next member of the family Mars 2020 (top right).
This project is the first collaboration with my brother, James Romer, who is a extraordinary character illustrator (images below). His imagination had no bounds and he imbues such fun and fantastical life into the inanimate. Jim knows, as the Roman poet Horace once noted, “It’s good to be silly at the right moment”. See more of his drawings, sketches and musings on his Arrrggghhh Blog.
Work by James Romer (Arrrggghhh Ink)
THE DETAILS
We are proposing a series of posters based on three kid favorites—Mars the red Planet, Jupiter the giant, or Saturn, the coolest looking—but, we also want to celebrate the amazing spacecraft programs that brought so many more fascinating bodies in our solar system to light.
Voyager: Cool Discoveries
While many lament the downgrading of Pluto from planet to dwarf-planet — many have never even heard of the many moons that are just as fascinating as any planet and some are bigger than Mercury! With bold design and colorful characters, we want to not only include these cool bodies, but highlight some of the even cooler attributes of these moons! Active volcanos on Io! Cracks from the underground oceans of Europa! The Great Dark Spot on Neptune and active Geysers on its moon Triton!
We also plan on including an informative key to all the fun facts and discoveries represented in each design!
Each 18" x 24" poster will be screen-printed in three colors by the same shop that beautifully executed our original poster series (see below). But, the fun doesn’t stop when the lights go out! The screen printed posters have a glow-in-the-dark layer that shows each robotic spacecraft as it flows through the Milky Way as humanity’s first interstellar probe. Note: the 12"x16" archival digital prints will not include glow.
  We will finish the campaign in time to deliver for the holidays! We hope to ultimately make them available on our website, but if you back this project, the three poster series are available at a special price that won’t be available on chopshopstore.com.
Printing Information
Screen printing is an age old method that involves a manually pressing a single ink color on to the paper through a highly detailed stencil affixed to a mesh. Each poster goes through this process four times (once for each color, including the glow) and hand-produced by an actual human being well-versed in the technique. For more about the process, please take a look at this explainer web site at MoMA. Click “enter” and then choose “Screenprinting” in the nav. Then hit, “Press Arrow to Start” to watch the process or you can try and actually grab the tools and simulate the process to better understand. I was lucky to design and program that MoMA site  around 2003 when we were better known as The Chopping Block. 
An Archival Digital Giclée print is a high quality print that is made-to-order here in our studio. These prints are produced with archival inks on archival papers and have an expected display life of about 60-100 years.
For more information about the fantastic studio responsible for the actual screen printing, check out Vahalla Studio in Kansas City. They have a great portfolio which include many high profile designers and clients like Phish, Wilco, Sony Pictures, Cirque Du Soleil, and more.
The Other Rewards
THE ORIGINAL ROBOTIC SPACECRAFT POSTERS were crowd-funded in 2014 and included Voyager, Cassini, Curiosity, Sputnik, Mars Exploration, and the special edition LightSail for The Planetary Society. The next series was funded in 2015 and included New Horizons, Rosetta, and Galileo. Finally, last year we funded another series that featured crewed space missions including Apollo 11, The International Space Station, and Vostok 1. All of these designs are still available for purchase on chopshopstore.com/space except for Voyager and Sputnik which are currently sold out in the screen print version but are still available as Glicée prints.
NEW VOYAGER REPRINTS
The original blue version of our Voyager screen print has been sold out since 2016. As a part of this new campaign, we are finally offering a new edition with updated design and all new Jupiter-based colors.
VOYAGER TEE
Our Voyager tee comes in all sizes from Men’s SML-3X, Women's SML-2X, and Kid's XS-XL.
GRAND TOUR STICKER SET
This 12 sticker set measures 6"x 6" and includes Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and their amazing moons Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto, Enceladus, Titan, Triton, and the Voyager Spacecraft. 
Full Collection of Space Mission Stickers
3"x3" vinyl stickers which are ideal for either indoor or outdoor use. Set includes all 12 missions featured in both our Historic Robotic Spacecraft Series and our Giant Leaps in Space Series.
Bobby’s Biggest Bubble (A Kickstarter funded picture book!)
James Romer’s first published storybook. A whimsical tale about a little boy who wins a million gumballs which begins an unbelievable day of fun and adventure and has an appropriately cosmic ending! No spoilers!
The Manual and a user
Mike Mongo’s Astronaut Instruction Manual
The Astronaut Instruction Manual is an actual working astronaut instruction manual. It is created to let today’s space-loving young students who want to live, work, and play in space know that they genuinely do have that opportunity. The book was also recently optioned by Legendary Entertainment and is in early pre-production for a television series adaptation.
Thanks 
As always, a special thanks to The Planetary Society who supported my earlier projects and have since become an official partner of Chop Shop Store. More importantly, they help shape space policy and fight for the continued exploration of space. You might also be familiar with their CEO, Bill Nye. Consider becoming a member and see our new online store for them at www.chopshopstore.com/planetarysociety.
Big thanks to Robin Stamey for all her help with copywriting, videography, social media advice, and so much more. See Robin’s full time endeavor and wildly creative acrobatics at Almanac Dance Circus Theatre.
Also at the root of any successful Kickstarter campaign are the many friends who tweet and help get the word out for us. These have included, but are definitely not limited to Mat Kaplan of Planetary Radio (also a partner) Icarus Interstellar (a partner as well!), Yuri’s Night (OMG, also a partner!), Bill Dunford @RidingRobots, the i09 Blog, Emily Lakdawalla and so many others.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only risk we face here is not making holiday deadlines for some backers. I think we are in a good place to meet those deadlines — but there are third party vendors involved who could impose delays on us that would be outside of our control. However, we have worked with these vendors for years now and they haven’t let us down yet… so there is no reason to suspect they may now.

There are very few other risks involved with a print campaign of this sort. My wife could even complete the project in the event of my untimely demise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We Have Another Kind of Spaceship Related Kickstarter Project With Rewards That Ship in Time for Xmas!
updates.update_content: Eleven years ago we produced weRobot and later many other similar themes over the years including aliens, space probes, rock stars, etc. The one question was always, “when are you doing spaceships?”.

updates.update_userinfo: Bill Nye with an Exclusive Look at Our Newest Campaign and Exclusive Early Bird Access
updates.update_content: Our Solar System has many worlds, each of them remarkable in myriad ways. Thomas Romer, who designs our Planetary Society gear for The Official Planetary Society Store at Chop Shop, has collected 20 intriguing bodies from our celestial neighborhood and transferred them onto toy wooden blocks. Once you see them, I think you’ll agree that these “toys” aren’t just for kids! The full set includes eight planets, eight moons, three dwarf planets, and the sun.

updates.update_content:
We ran into some technical issues with the Grand Tour sticker sheet. We had to keep at least .25" between each sticker and the edge of the sheet and each one had to be at least 1" in size. So now the overall layout is not as attractive as it was, but it did result in the sheet getting bigger— from 6x6" to 7x7".
Plus we added a sticker for the Golden Record!

campaign.story:
Update: ALL finishes are now unlocked!! See 'Add-ons' below.
About this project
Following on the heels of the first Hobo Coins project, I'm super-thrilled to offer the next series of four all-new designs based on iconic US Coins.
What are Hobo Coins?
Throughout time, people have modified coins by hand-carving or engraving their own designs into existing coins. But this form of folk art really took off during the Great Depression. Those that were out of work or down on their luck took to modifying coins by engraving their own designs into them. They would use pocket knives or even filed down nails to carve beautiful designs that were as varied as the artists themselves. This art form evolved over time to often portray skeletons or skulls, incorporating elements from the coins as part of the final works of art. They would almost always keep the lettering on the coins.
The Hobo Coins project brings back this largely forgotten piece of American history. These coins are being minted by the oldest continuously operated private mint in the U.S and are SOLID. They each weigh about the same as 5 US. quarters, and are a little larger than the size of a US Dollar coins (these coins are 39 mm). Die-struck with over 100 tons of pressure in solid metal alloys and featuring antique finishes.
Please note that Hobo Coins are not actual US currency or modified US currency coins, they are die-struck new coins at different sizes, weights, and (clearly), different art than actual US coins.
Help revive a piece of history you can carry!
The Designs
Each coin was crafted and designed by me using some of the most iconic coins as their base:
‘The Davey Jones Locker’ - 1919 S Wheat Penny 
The original wheat penny designed by Victor D. Brenner made its debut in 1909. My rendition reimagines the coin with a nautical theme underscoring the dangers that lurk below. Aged with an antique silver-finish the coins will have a ‘smooth’ edge like the original (not ‘reeded’). As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 10 gauge coin.
The Davey Jones Locker - 1919 S Wheat Penny
 ‘The John Henry’ - 1871 20 Dollar Coin
Folk hero John Henry immortalized in metal. Around 1870 or '71, John Henry raced a steam-powered hammer on the C&O train line and won! He did, tragically, die soon after from exhaustion, but his spirit of determination lives on this Hobo Coin! Aged with an antique silver-finish and as with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 10 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original 20 Dollar coin.
The John Henry - 1871 Twenty Dollar Coin
‘The Good Doctor’ - 1937 Buffalo Nickel 
My take on the classic ‘Plague Doctor’ updated with an industrial age motif and featuring a fearsome rat (the source of the plague and its spread) guarding its prize. This is no mere Templeton! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 10 gauge coin. This coin will have a smooth edge like the Buffalo nickel (smooth edge).
The Good Doctor - 1937 Buffalo Nickel
‘The Aviator’ - 1942 Mercury Dime
My latest take on the classic Mercury dime, featuring one bad ass pilot on the front, and a Catch-22 inspired Mitchell B-29 on the back—which is, incidentally, the source of my website’s name Dead on Paper. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 10 gauge coin. This coin will have a ‘reeded’ edge like the original Mercury dime.
  The Aviator - 1942 Mercury Dime
The ‘Hobo Coin / Davey Jones Locker’ Limited Edition Print 
To complement the coins, I’ve designed this print which is inspired by the Davey Jones Locker coin. Each print is 18” x 24”, signed, and numbered.
Limited Edition Hobo Coins Print - Signed and Numbered - click to view higher resolution at deadonpaper.com
  Add-ons 
All Add-ons are immediately available (including Solid Silver coins this time). Additional coins or posters can be added to any base pledge as needed. Simply click on ‘Manage My Pledge’ and manually increase your pledge amount by the following:
Coins - add $14 (in the US), 15$ (international) to your pledge amount per additional coin, feel free to add as many as you would like. After the project closes you’ll be able to specify which design(s) you’d like.
Limited Edition Hobo Coins Print - add $50 (in the US), $60 (international) to your pledge amount per print. This limited edition Hobo Coins print will be signed and numbered. Based on the 'Davey Jones Locker' Hobo Coin
Two, Three, or Four Coin Display - add $15 ($20 international) to your pledge amount per display (displays come as 2, 3, or 4 coin displays, you'll be able to specify which after the project closes). A great way to show off your coins! Comprised of 3 acrylic panes with embedded magnets, this is a simple, elegant, and easy to open and close system for displaying Hobo Coins.
4 coin display - also available as 3 coin, and 2 coin displays. You'll be able to select the number of coins you're display will hold after the project closes.
  The displays are 3 pieces of crystal clear acrylic that are held together with embedded magnets.
  The bottom of the displays are engraved with Dead On Paper (my website's name).
Solid Silver Coins - add $60 ($65 international) to your pledge amount per solid silver coin. These coins are one troy ounce of solid .999 fine silver and will come with a Certificate of Authenticity card that is signed and numbered. The final quantity will be determined by the number ordered, feel free to add as many as you'd like. 
Solid Silver Davey Jones Coin - one troy ounce of .999 pure solid silver
  Solid Silver Davey Jones Back - one troy ounce of .999 pure solid silver
  Solid Silver John Henry - one troy ounce of .999 pure solid silver
  Detail of Solid Silver John Henry back
To add items to your pledge: Manually increase your pledge amount by the cost of the add-on items. After the project closes, I'll send you a link to make your final selections. For now, just click "Manage My Pledge" and add on the amount of your coin or print add-ons.
Here's a quick video on how to do this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak8SWlMeIoo&app=desktop   
Stretch Goals
Antique Bronze Finish Coins Funded to $12,000 - UNLOCKED!!!
Antique Bronze versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Bronze coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Bronze Finish Coins - UNLOCKED!!
Antique Copper Finish Coins Funded to $16,000 - UNLOCKED!!!  
Antique Solid Copper versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Copper coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Copper Finish Coins - UNLOCKED!!
Antique Brass-Plated Steel Coins Funded to $20,000 - UNLOCKED!!!  
Antique Brass-Plated Steel works with magnets! These are actually a shade thinner than the other coins - 12 gauge, that's the only option available from the mint. You can now select Brass-Plated Steel coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes. 
Antique Brass-Plated Steel Coins - UNLOCKED!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've created 4 fairly successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past - so I know there are always curveballs that challenge the best of plans. However, I feel super confident about this project. I've worked with the company who's making the coins and know their turnaround time, I've shipped thousands of coins to every corner of the world and know the complexities involved, and I've made good on every project in the past. My biggest watch-outs for Hobo Coins are the finishes and the shipping timeframe. If the project gets big (I should be so lucky), that might push out the delivery a little, but not much.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PRAISE “Bob"! – the fates have brought you into an encounter with J.R. “Bob” Dobbs through this instructional video barrage Kickstarter delivery device – the first step on your personal road to SLACK, an unsurpassable beatific experience.
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM FILMMAKER ALEX COX
PLAY

Alex Cox has directed such cult classics as Repo Man and Sid & Nancy.
DID YOU US IN TEXAS MONTHLY ?!
PREVIOUSLY FORBIDDEN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THIS FILM 
The Church of the SubGenius has been called “the most aggressively preposterous theology the world has ever known!” But what is the Church? And who is J.R. "Bob" Dobbs? And why is his name always in quotes? And for nonbelievers, why has this strangely compelling parody religion, this long-running postmodern joke, caught the attention of such pop culture icons as Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, Jon Stewart, David Letterman, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), David Byrne, Robert Crumb, Richard Linklater, Alex Cox, Ken Kesey, Frank Zappa, Jonathan Demme, and Devo’s Mark Mothersbaugh? And is it true that Tori Amos is also one of "Bob"’s chosen?  
"Bob" and the Church have caught the attention of many– include David Byrne, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), Tori Amos, Stephen Colbert, Robert Crumb, Mark Mothersbaugh and DEVO, Matt Groening, Margaret Moser, Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, and more.
ARE WE CONTROLLED BY SECRET FORCES? ARE ALIEN MONSTERS BRINGING A STARTLING NEW WORLD? DO PEOPLE THINK YOU’RE STRANGE? DO YOU? 
The Church of the SubGenius: The Early Years
“We tied together every occult, superstitious fringe belief you could think of…it was so much fun!”
– Ivan Stang, co-founder
Born into the suburban world of the 1950s, future founders of the Church of the SubGenius Reverend Ivan Stang (Douglass St. Clair Smith) and Dr. Philo Drummond (Steve Wilcox) come of age during the 1960s and 70s – a time of unprecedented social and political tumult. They experience the rise of a deafening consumer culture, the tarnishing of the "American Dream," the violence of the Vietnam War abroad, and the Kennedy assassinations and conspiracies that follow. 
As youths they revel in the delights of stable families, monster movies, Science Fiction, super-8 moviemaking, dinosaur figures, comic books, and Rock 'n' Roll. As they grow older they witness the emergence of televangelism, the Jonestown Massacre, punk culture, and Reaganomics.
Despite both growing up in Texas, it was not until the mid 70s that Stang and Drummond meet and quickly forge a friendship over a shared love of comic books, Captain Beefheart, and UFO paperbacks. One not so particular eve in 1977, while bemoaning their lack of conventional “success” for two such intelligent, well read chaps, Stang remarks, “Well, we’re not exactly geniuses.” To which Drummond replies, “yeah, we’re sub-geniuses.” 
And in that moment the Church of the SubGenius is born. It is not long after that J.R. "Bob" Dobbs reveals himself as the Church's iconic prophet and foremost patron of ineffable Slack. In fact, Stang and Drummond will later come to the realization that "Bob" has been planting evidence of his presence for them for the past twenty years!!!
THE SUBGENIUS DIASPORA
“There was that moment of realizing that this thing goes further than I ever imagined.”
– Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman)
In late 1979 Stang and Drummond, with the help of their wives, brainstorm what would become perhaps the single most significant marketing effort made at the inception of the Church of the SubGenius – the writing, design, printing, and distribution of Pamphlet #1. The doctrine of the Church quickly spreads, and the word of “Bob” and the teachings of JHVH-1 teach “time control” as a way to wrest “Slack” from the ‘Pinks’ and ‘Normals.’ The Church, it seems, has struck a nerve amidst the deadening consumer culture, the evisceration of basic social services, and the worship of wealth that occurred during the Reagan/Thatcher years.
L: An early years Devival | R: The Three Wise Guys – Ivan Stang, Dr.X and Philo Drummond – pose with a Model X Humanoid (1979)
As “Bob”’s pamphlet continues to travel the world, the emergent punk publishing scene and new wave comic writers seize on the humor and cultural critique of the Church's doctrine. In San Francisco it is fished out of a trashcan by cartoonist and artist Paul Mavrides, igniting a SubGenius cell that gives the movement some of its most enduring art and performances through LIES (Paul Mavrides), Dr. Howland Owl (Hal Robins), Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman), Janor Hypercleats and Pope Sternodox. 
"Bob" captures the zetigeist of the day. Cartoonist Robert Crumb reprints Pamphlet #1 in the first issue of his comic Weirdo. A few years later Simon and Schuster publishes The Book of the SubGenius.  Acclaimed film director and SubGenius Alex Cox channels Church mythology in Repo Man as the glowing, alien-owned Chevy Malibu soars high above Los Angeles with Otto (Emilio Estevez) and Miller (Tracy Walke) inside, their faces shining with Slack as Bud (Harry Dean Stanton) watches from below. 
Dr. Howl and Puzzling Evidence conduct legendary “Devivals,” radio shows (More than an Hour, Less than a Show), and introduce the word of "Bob" to Burning Man. The Stark Fist of Removal newsletter, The Hour of Slack podcast, an MTV special, and countless cassette tapes, posters, comics, videos, websites, and Facebook groups perpetuate the word of "Bob." 
By the turn of the century, publications as powerful as TIME Magazine begin to get the SubGenius joke when “Bob” is voted ‘Fraud of the Century” by readers of its online poll. In the late 90’s and early 2000’s, the “Free Party” constituents of Brighton in Great Britain voted “Bob” Dobbs as an M.P. to the House of Commons three times.
Today, “Bob”’s hucksterism and the wisdom of JHVH-1 is apparent in all fifty states and a multitude of countries across the globe!
PLAY

Another early SubGenius of Texas, David Boone (late husband of Slacking Towards Bethlehem director Sandy K. Boone), documents the rise of the SubGenius in his 1980 film, Invasion of the Aluminum People, which is lauded by Academy Award winning director Jonathan Demme. This is one of the first known recorded instances of the transmission of SLACK.
GIVE TO THIS KICKSTARTER NOW AND ACHIEVE SALVATION – OR TRIPLE YOUR MONEY BACK!!!!!!
Only with your support can our intrepid group of award-winning filmmakers dare to make this film. By giving us your hard earned cash, we can make this dream a reality, and breach all Earthly human, political, and cultural barriers with the searing nonhuman truth of the Word of "Bob," J.R. "Bob" Dobbs, that LIVING GOD WHO WALKS THIS PLANET EARTH IN HUCKSTER'S SHOES. 
To date, we’ve travelled over 8,000 miles and interviewed 15 SubGenius in four cities, sharing the so-called "reality" that SubGenii are forced to share with humans. We’ve only just begun to uncover many of the SubGenius’ most guarded secrets. The SubGenii are finally willing to go public and tell the TRUTH. 
This is YOUR chance to get in on the ground floor of a huge, globally important cult. You will then attract all the $$$, pleasure spacecraft, and SHEER POWER OVER OTHERS that go with high-ranking support of the Church and this documentary! 
But most important, you can smite your enemies, achieve TIME CONTROL and attain SLACK.
REMEMBERING SAINT MARGARET
Since we began production on our film, a beloved avatar of the early SubGenius tribe, Margaret Moser, passed away on August 25 of this year. One of the nation’s top music journalists and music scene nurturers, Reverend Reverend Doctor Doctor Archdoctor Saint Margaret Moser even had a photo of J.R. “Bob” Dobbs on her Austin Chronicle business card. She said it helped her connect with her interview subjects, many of whom were already members of the Church themselves.
PLAY

In her interview with us, she spoke about the pleasure, “the great release, to have all this nutty stuff in your head and find like minded people to express it with.” But most notably she sang a song written by her own hand, "Oh, Life's a Bowl of Cherries with "Bob" Dobbs." Saint Moser's life epitomized the way that membership in the Church accelerated the discovery of true friendships, experimentations, creative collisions, and rebellion through art, music, and comedy against dehumanization in any form.
WHY THIS FILM? 
Why not this film? Pull the wool over your own eyes and help us make a movie! The Church of the SubGenius is the underground movement that has galvanized the imaginative, the artistic, the nerdy, even the deranged – to examine the simmering dystopia in their culture, and do absolutely nothing about it... except, maybe, poke fun at it all. The Church of the SubGenius is taking over the universe. The sooner you learn about it, the better off you’ll be. 
PLAY

Now more than ever we feel that the story of the Church of the SubGenius needs to be told. There's a core of ideas within the SubGenius ethos – of fighting oppression with humor, community and creativity, of using absurdity as a nonviolent weapon, giving time, permission and priority to expression, creation, and zaniness with friends –  that we think has great value we believe these ideas are necessary in today's world and that our film about the SubGenius is the perfect way to invoke them.
Amongst all the spaceships, frop, pipes, eye-bludgeoning graphics, bulldada, yeti ancestors, (and yes, ‘macho spoutings’), we hope you will fund this film so you can join our merry band of pranksters on the culture-jam of the century! It’s going to be a lot of fun!!!
No stranger to hiding in plain sight – "Bob" is everywhere, IF you know to look for him!
So please, give to our film, get our cool merch, show up at screenings, and talk to us in every way possible. We will have our third nostril open at all times.
And remember, as one famous SubGenius said, “since the main message is ‘think for yourself,’ the last thing you should be doing is believing all we’re telling you. We make it up as we go along.”
Ivan Stang hosts the 999 Club (1981)
WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
With this funding, we can complete the remaining interviews, edit the film, animate key sequences, and all other post-production work necessary to bring this ridiculous story to the masses.
A behind the scenes look at our film production. Note that "Bob" is never too far from where we are. (L: Image courtesy of Paul Mavrides | R: Image courtesy of Kelly Cash)
HOW YOU CAN HELP
A Boy's Guide - fig. 13013
Let ‘Bob’ into your savings. 
Kickstarter is ALL-OR-NOTHING – If we don’t meet our $199,999.99 goal, we won’t receive ANY of the funding. Don't let The Conspiracy win!  We need to get this story out into the world before it all comes to an end.
Tomorrow is obsolete. 
SHUT UP PINK BOY AND PLEDGE EARLY! – Be the ultimate slacker and slack off on slacking. The earlier you pledge, the more likely others are to contribute.
Instant answers to everything!
Don’t wallow in submission. Reveal the Church of the SubGenius Documentary to your slackless friends through social media, and watch as their Pink minds become wonderful, abnormal soups of mush. Just how we like it.
Blasted by knowledge
SHUT UP OR STAND UP BY SHARING OUR FILM ON SOCIAL MEDIA!  – How can you direct your friends to our Kickstarter? Write your own post linking our Kickstarter at bit.ly/SlackOn, or, for the slack-est among you use one of our pre-written posts below –
Twitter: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? Don't wallow in submission any longer! bit.ly/SlackOn
Facebook: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? The Church of the SubGenius is the subject of a new documentary I am supporting – check it out! But beware, you might pull the wool over your own eyes in the process. bit.ly/SlackOn
THE REWARDS
To THANK YOU for backing our documentary we have a great selection of classic favorites -- and more. But this campaign also offers some extremely unique items. So dive in. Look around. Scroll your way to bliss!
Partnering with Paul Mavrides, we will have an original film poster by one of the great artists and cartoonists living today. NO KIDDING! This is going to be something you don’t want to miss. And we also already received --- shhhhhhh! – some amazing, crazy, stuff – memorabilia, illustrations, artwork -- from the archives of some celebrity and anonymous SubGenius alike. Stay tuned. This is the stuff that will never, ever make its way to Ebay.
*Final Reward designs may vary.

Items marked as “limited” are truly one of a kind items created specifically for this campaign as a unique offering to thank you for becoming part of the team. From a “Bob” toaster that will help you begin your day with edible Slack to real life film credits in our finished film, we hope you embrace “Bob”’s rule of thumb that “too much is always better than not enough.
Claim 'em quick! Limited quantities available.
PAUL MAVRIDES ORIGINAL ART
We know what you're thinking. FINE ARTS? SUBGENIUS? How much frop are you smoking? Paul Mavrides is one of the originators and sustainers of the SubGenius aesthetic, and he is also a major artist whose work shows at Fine Art galleries and whose graphic design is sought after by companies like Apple. Writing about Paul for a recent show at the Steven Wolfe Fine Arts Gallery in San Francisco, art critic Mark Van Proyers said that SubGenius output is a key influence "on much of the art production of the 1990s... and the mythomaniacal clip-art orgies that Mavrides concocted for several of the highly entertaining “SubGenious” books still seem to sustain a spot-on freshness…."
NEW REWARDS GENEROUSLY DONATED BY LOUIS BLACK, FROM HIS PERSONAL COLLECTION
Louis Black is the co-founder of the Austin Chronicle and co-founder of the South By Southwest Music Festival and Conference (SXSW).
ANNOUNCING NEW REWARDS FROM COMIC BOOK ARTIST CULLY HAMNER. AND WE'RE KINDA GEEKING OUT OVER IT!
Cully Hamner is an American comic book artist, known for his work on such books as Green Lantern: Mosaic, Blue Beetle, Black Lightning: Year One, and Detective Comics.
MORE COOL CRAP FROM SubGenius DR. PHILO DRUMMOND! Signed by KRK RYDEN
KRK Ryden is an artist, musician, SubGenii and Bay Area native. His surrealistic art style is reflective of his taste in cartoons and pulp art and his work is described as "colorful and visually appealing reflections on discarded icons."
ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS 
SANDY K BOONE | Director / Producer
Sandy K. Boone began making films in Austin in the 1980s with her late husband, filmmaker David Boone, whose Texas cult classic Invasion of the Aluminum People was presented by director Jonathan Demme at the Collective for Living Cinema in 1981 in New York. Three decades later, Boone and Black produced a restoration of the film as part of Jonathan Demme: Made in Texas – Six Films From Austin, which premiered at SXSW in 2015. At that screening, Richard Linklater told how seeing Invasion, and another of the MIT films at an art gallery screening in Houston inspired him to move to Austin.
LOUIS BLACK | Executive Producer 
Louis Black co-founded The Austin Chronicle, where he was editor for more than three decades, SXSW, where he is a director, and was a founding Board Member of the Austin Film Society. He has written extensively on film, music and politics. Executive producer of Be Here to Love Me, A Film About Townes Van Zandt, he was a producer on the Peabody Award Winning The Order of Myths. Working with Mark Rance he produced a reissue of Eagle Pennell's The Whole Shootin' Match.
Sandy K Boone and Louis Black, of Black and Boone Productions.
BLACK AND BOONE now closely collaborate on all projects. They were deeply involved in crafting, structuring and shaping the documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny, which premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and was the initial screening of PBS's American Masters 2017 Fall season. They worked as Executive Producers on Keith Maitland's critically acclaimed Tower and Karen Skloss' The Honor Farm, which premiered at SXSW. They are executive producers on The Newspaperman and Road Angel, both still in production. Blaze, written and directed by Ethan Hawke, on which they worked, is scheduled for a 2018 release. Their next project to be released is Eggshells, a reissue of Tobe Hooper’s first film from 1969.
MICHELLE RANDOLPH FAIRES | Producer
Michelle Randolph Faires began her career in independent film by supporting area film-related non-profit organizations before moving into production. She worked with Austin Film Festival as the Festival & Conference Hospitality Coordinator for two years before joining the staff full-time as the Outreach and Community Coordinator. Additionally, she supported aGLIFF, as the Volunteer Coordinator and Festival Manager, later serving a full three year term on the Board of Directors. After moving into the production world, she produced her first short, followed by a feature length documentary on the legendary Broken Spoke dancehall, Honky Tonk Heaven. The film premiered at SXSW 2016 and earned an Audience Award. Michelle has been a part of the funding and producing teams for film projects The Newspaperman, Leslie and Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George's Creators, as well as PBS-KLRU series Standup Empire, a series showcasing the expansive comedy scene in Austin, Texas.
LAUREN SANDERS | Editor 
Lauren Sanders is an editor and post-production supervisor with experience on a wide range of commercial and film projects. After working as senior editor at Arts+Labor for 6 years, she collaborated extensively with clients like GSD&M and C3. Her most recent film credits include post-supervisor on 2017's comedy, Ripped, co-writer and editor on the documentary The Jones Family Will Make a Way, and assistant editor and co-composer on Clay Liford's Slash. She also is credited as post-production supervisor and assistant editor on Kat Candler’s Hellion, an official selection of both the Sundance and SXSW film festivals. Lauren is a graduate of the Radio-Television-Film program at the University of Texas at Austin.
DAVID LAYTON | Director of Photography
David Layton is an Austin-based filmmaker with a passion for cinematography and documentary film. He began his career as a newspaper reporter, but honed his technical skills working in the camera department on notable documentary features such as The Unforeseen, Be Here to Love Me, The Devil and Daniel Johnston, You’re Gonna Miss Me, Nuclear Family, Troop 1500, and Letter From Waco. He was cinematographer on two recent PBS documentaries, By the River of Babylon: An Elegy for South Louisiana and Through the Repellant Fence: A Land Art Film. Most recently, David shot the feature documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny and is directing/producing The Newspaperman about legendary Philadelphia Inquirer editor Gene Roberts.
IVAN STANG | Consultant
Ivan Stang is a writer, filmmaker, radio broadcaster/personality, as well as one of the founders of the Church of the SubGenius. As a filmmaker, Stang has done animation work and editing for films such as Arise!: The SubGenius Video, a “spoof” documentary for the Church of the SubGenius, and animation work for MTV and music video shorts. He is most notable for writing The Book of the SubGenius, and other SubGenius literature. Stang hosts the hour-long radio broadcast "The Hour of Slack," produced partially by WCSB at Cleveland State University and syndicated across North America. He remains an active SubGenii, continuing his work with the Church and appearing at X-Day, the SubGenius celebration held every year in Ohio, where Stang resides.
A POEM WRITTEN BY THE FILMMAKERS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are very close to completion of this documentary. Once completed, the film will be submitted to festivals as well as seek worldwide distribution. We are confident that this film tells the extraordinary history of this unorthodox religion in a way that will be satisfying to J.R. “Bob” Dobbs’ fan base. We are committed to capturing a rare look inside the creation and preservation of this phenomenon. That being said, we cannot guarantee mass distribution of the film. But, we believe wholeheartedly in this project; we are determined to share this film with as many people as possible for hope of a SLACK REVOLUTION. 

– DOBBS APPROVED –
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: SubGenius Doc Picked Up for Distribution!!
updates.update_content:
Greeting, SubGenii – 
Did you miss us?!?!
"Bob" works in mysterious ways, and at long last we can reveal all that has been going on behind the scenes of our film. After spending the better part of 2018 interviewing, editing, color-correcting, sound-mixing, and festival submitting, we are proud and excited to announce that –
Greetings Friends! Welcome to 2018!

THANK YOU!!!!! WE DID IT!!!!!! and now...........THE END IS JUST THE BEGINNING AND PRAISE "BOB"
YOU BEAUTIFUL DONORS YOU! BECAUSE OF YOU, WE DID IT!!!!! WE raised $206,891 WITH 1,257 BACKERS JOINING US IN THIS SLACK REVOLUTION!
We want to take you with us!! The SubGenii tribe is growing and trust us, we are a lot more fun when the Conspiracy isn’t making us madly scrounge for dollars.  and let “Bob” show you We are taking all our toys, (and we have even better ones there), all our new friends, and continuing on our magic pleasurecraft ride through the world of the SubGenius, past and future. We’ll keep you posted on our progress.

updates.update_userinfo: GIVE US YOUR ADDRESS SO WE CAN SEND YOU YOUR REWARDS!!!
updates.update_content: Friends! SO EXCITING! We not only made the goal in our ALL-OR-NOTHING campaign, thanks to YOU, we also have an incredible number of backers in this beginning on our SLACK REVOLUTION!

updates.update_userinfo: Church of the SubGenius Reward Update - T-Shirts
updates.update_content:
SO CLOSE.....JUST ONE MORE DOLLAR FOR "BOB"!
Can you believe it? Some of you have been with us from the beginning getting these updates, and others have just recently joined the ranks of the chosen. The chosen who believe in "Bob" and getting this documentary made. We thank you profusely. Each one of you - which is over 1000 now! And now is the critical time of the campaign - the LAST 24 HOURS! We are less than 5K away from our goal! SHARE SHARE SHARE!

updates.update_userinfo: PRAISE "BOB"....SLACK ACHIEVED! ALL BECAUSE OF YOU!
updates.update_content: 48 HOURS LEFT AND WE ARE JUST HITTING OUR STRIDE! WE CHALLENGED AND YOU AWESOME PEOPLE DELIVERED!

project_data.project_name: The Church of the SubGenius | A Documentary

campaign.story:
We at Candylab have been creating standout wooden toy cars for over four years.  Born on Kickstarter, this is our 6th campaign, and we are now back, faithful to our roots:  Our latest creations will ONLY be available here, on Kickstarter, for this Holiday Season, reserving a special thank you and exclusivity to our backers, who helped us grow to where we are today.  
Here are our latest creations, and may they spark your imagination. Go play!
    The Outlaws are 1920's-inspired, vintage wooden cars. We took cues from a mix of Art Deco modernism and the daredevil, rough and oily car culture of those years. In our era of clean, immediate digital entertainment, we want to bring some of these stories back, blending keen design, old-fashioned playtime and some storytelling.
Our exclusive launch will feature five models total, and each has its own story and inspiration behind it. 
   This is inspired by the iconic American Truck - a newly mechanized workhorse during the late 20's and 30's.   This truck powered small businesses, construction and rebuilding projects, rumrunning, dustbowl migrations and post recession rebuild. It's ingrained in the pioneering spirit and hardships of that era, and we say it deserves a place in pop culture. The toy itself has a yellow and black herringbone pattern on the front radiator, a long bed to haul other toys, and a magnet "hitch" making sure the towed cars stay in place. 
  Our slickest, lowest riding racer. Stanced, bright blue, and decorated with a Carnival-inspired pattern, it flaunts a superstition-defying race no. 13. This is our flashiest car, with stories to tell. 
    A yellow-and red pill of a lowriding roadster, bearing the 250(mg) race number. Our first ever open-top car, sure to stand out in a toy collection.
   A black matte coat of paint, a single red light arm placed sideways, and a scribbling of the precinct numbers on its roof: this is the epitome of the churning and drama of bringing law and order to those hard years. The toy carries the visual cues of an adventurous, free wheeling era: it stands for order, fierce car chases and keeping the lid on the bad guys. The car has a cute graphic on its belly, with tally marks that one assumes stand for the vanquished baddies.
  This an homage to the fierce female race car drivers of the era. Maude Odell, Elinor Blevins, Kay Petre and many more others.  Their racers were sturdy, lifted, and off-roadish and we aimed to capture that look and stance with this toy. It has a spare tire, a positive (inward) suspension camber and a giant race number on its radiator.
So thats's what we've been sweating over all year folks!
[Update]: The good Folks at CBS This Morning just gave us some sweet national TV thumbs up. They totally nailed what we are all about. Here they are visiting us at home and telling the world about it.  Million thanks to everyone there!
https://www.cbsnews.com/videos/toymakers-retro-cars-attract-both-adults-and-kids/#
    At our Brooklyn Navy Yard workspace
  Important details:
Shipping these rewards will be via either UPS or Priority US mail as appropriate, for all US-based backers. A couple of important points, especially if you are an international backer:
- If your parcel sits unclaimed and / or you have not answered our increasingly alarmed emails, there is a chance it will be sent back, or abandoned at destination. We would not be able to resend your reward nor refund you in such a situation.
- We can offer no refunds. If your set arrives damaged or somehow defective, we will replace it.
- International backers will likely be charged customs fees or sales tax - even both at the same time! It's infrequently enforced, depending on each destination country and we really can't help this nor control it, but remember that essentially you are acquiring these items with no VAT or sales tax.
 But where are we with this process?
We started production a little while back to ensure our December delivery, but we need your help to make sure we can hit the MOQ counts our suppliers have to meet.
This is where you come in: with your backing, we can make sure that we have a home for these beauties, and for our end of the deal, we will ensure exclusivity: this Holiday Season, no one else will have access to these outside this campaign!
So for a truly special gift this Holiday season, hop on our bandwagon.
Thank you from all of us!

updates.update_content:
Ahem, the shameless kind, not the spark one. 
We really never ever do this, plugging someone else's campaign, that is.  We figure that with email traffic being what it is these days, we want to save our messaging for truly important news about humanity.   And this project you are about to find out definitely fits the bill, so please forgive us, grit your teeth and read on. 
Abigail is a friend of ours, a fellow gearhead, entrepreneur, designer, engineer, and somehow a mom to two adorable human beings.  And she had a truly catchy idea: create an RC toy car that teaches kids about the inner workings of a toy, a car, and all the interesting, science-y bits that make that toy behave that way. The whole thing is called .  Company + Idea + Racing, etc.

Hey gang, long time no hear, but aside from the usual comings and goings of building a indie toy biz, we haven't had many news FIT to share until now. A few months is a long time, so we built up quite a mail bag:  
We came up with a few new color schemes for our existing line;  We designed and almost put into production a lifeguard beach tower kit (pics coming soon) and we are about to shake your collector hearts with a radical new line, still wood, still sleek, and 100% awesome! We promise to break the biggie news right here, with you.  More on that in the coming days. *wink
But until then, we wanted to tie a narrative all the way back to 2016:  Some of you who backed us then may recall that we were intent on making some toys in PA, where we found an  affordable roof and skilled folks ready to jump into the toymaking biz.  While the product campaign itself did quite well thanks to you, we came short of the undeclared, quite-moving-target goal of starting manufacturing in the US, so nothing happened in the immediate aftermath - as some of you asked.

updates.update_userinfo: The ADD-ON Update. Shipping starts this week!
updates.update_content:
24 hrs left. 
That's it!  We had a real quick month, full to the tilt folks, and thanks to you we kept moving ahead at blistering speed.   You funded us in the first day and then an entire month zoomed by. Thank you for the ride!
We have been relatively quiet here, but lots happened in the backdrop.  We'll do more of a recap / corollary below, but first, the good news.

campaign.story:
After 9 months of sweating every tiny detail, we're proud to bring you the most luxurious Vanda deck series to date. The Planets is a collection of decks representing the planets in our solar system, starting closest to the sun and moving outwards into the surrounding universe. The first deck of this series is Mercury, featuring creatures with stone-like heat-resistant skin.
We are printing 2 editions:
          Tuckboxes—Limited & Standard Editions
  Small Flap Detail
  Limited Edition Tuckbox
  Limited Edition Numbered Seal
  Ace of Spades
  Tuckbox Interior
  King of Spades
  Back Design
  Court Cards
  Joker
  Solar System Map
  King of Hearts (close up detail)
  12 Court Card Illustrations + Jokers
  Mockup of Uncut Sheet (frame not included)
   Standard Tuckbox Side (as part of complete set)
  Limited Tuckbox Side (as part of complete set)
  To add items, just manage your pledge and increase the total amount to include costs for extra decks or uncut sheets by the amounts shown in the image below. If you have questions, just send me a message.
You will be able to specify what you've added on through BackerKit after the campaign ends and you can also add on decks and uncut sheets at that point as well.
    The tuckboxes will be printed by Clove St. Press, producers of gorgeous letterpress printing. The decks will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company (USPC), makers of Bicycle & Bee brand decks and supplier to casinos around the world.
Tucks: 2 foils, embossing, interior foil, black/blue paper stocks
Cards: USPC Bicycle stock, Embossed finish
  Srdjan Vidakovic is a graphic designer better known as Widakk. He lives and works in Novi Sad, Serbia. His main focus is vintage / retro / old fashioned designs (mostly for brewery and distillery companies).
Learn more about Srdjan at vandacards.com/srdjan.
We've been working with some incredibly talented artists to produce a series we call Vanda Artists Series. The Planets is the 2nd product launched in collaboration with freelance artists who have a passion for creating playing cards.
Domestic Orders (USA)
All domestic orders will be fulfilled by the card experts at Art of Play. They do an outstanding job of getting products shipped out quickly and safely.
International Orders (Everywhere else)
International orders will be fulfilled by Keen Hong. They are one of the largest international distributors of playing cards and specialists within the field.
See the FAQ section below for common questions. If you have any further questions, please email us directly at ace@vandacards.com
Art & Design: Srdjan Vidakovic
Artistic Advisor: Lance Miller
Photography: Mark Schou
Tuckbox Printing: Clove St Press
Proof Deck Printing: makeplayingcards.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After producing 9 decks of cards with the United States Playing Card Company (USPC), we've got all the logistics figured out. We learned a lot during our first few Kickstarter campaigns and at this point the process is a well-oiled machine.

We'll be partnering with Art of Play and Keen Hong to handle all order fulfillment. They are pros at shipping logistics and specialize in the playing card industry.

Proofs have already been finalized and approved with our deck and tuckbox printers and they are just waiting for the green light to start printing, so you can expect to receive your rewards without any extended wait times after the campaign ends.

If you have any concerns or questions, please send us an email at ace@vandacards.com and we'll get back to you ASAP.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey all,
Just a quick update to let you know that we had a few delays getting the final items together but that orders have started shipping and they should all be sent out by tomorrow, which means that USA orders should still arrive before Christmas (international orders will take longer, unfortunately). You should receive an email confirmation with tracking info once your order is shipped.

updates.update_userinfo: One more thing: Neptune launch date + FREE 8-deck set!
updates.update_content:
I know I said the previous update was the final one but I wanted to make sure that nobody misses the final campaign of this series. Neptune will launch this coming Sunday, September 2nd at 3pm PST. There will be some very exciting announcements made throughout the campaign so be sure to come check it out! In the meantime, you can check out the campaign preview.
Also, make sure to enter the Vanda contest to win a FREE set of all 8 decks (SE)!
Note: If you backed a tier that includes a complete set of planets decks, you will be able to add on any of the extra goodies through BackerKit after the Neptune campaign ends.

updates.update_userinfo: Final Update: All orders shipped + Mars Launch + Future updates
updates.update_content:
Hey all,
This will be the final update for the Mercury Kickstarter. If you would like to receive notification about the launch dates/times for the rest of the series as well as other Vanda products and news, please sign up for our email list at http://vandacards.com
At this point, all orders (except for full sets of the planets series) have shipped out. USA backers should have received decks by now and international backers should receive your decks in the next couple weeks, depending on where you are.

updates.update_userinfo: Good news: LE decks now shipping!
updates.update_content:
Hello my patient friends,
I'm happy to announce that the Mercury LE decks are finally shipping! They will be en route either today or tomorrow and USA backers should receive an email with tracking information. The decks for international backers have been sent to Keen Hong where they will then be dispersed to all of you even-more-patient people.
Again, I apologize for the extended delay and hope that you'll find the results to be worth the wait.

Hey guys,
Please don't shoot me—there's one more delay on getting the LE deck orders shipped out. I just heard that the LE decks were inadvertently cello wrapped without their seals so they're carefully unwrapping, sealing, and rewrapping right now.
Fortunately, Mercury's retrograde just ended so I'm hoping there won't be any further communication problems from this point forward. As of now, the rewrapped decks should be completed later this week and fulfillment will commence next week. I'll post any new information as soon as I have it.

updates.update_userinfo: Earth launch minutes away! + LE decks shipping
updates.update_content:
Hey folks!
Just a reminder that the Kickstarter campaign for planet Earth launches today in just over 30 minutes from now. Hope to see you all there!
Also, the Mercury LE orders should be shipping this week (I realize I keep saying that, but I think it's true this time). I apologize again for the long delay in getting these decks sent out. Unfortunately it's been completely beyond my control and these delays do happen but the good news is that the rest of the series will not have the same issues with delayed rewards. Venus is on track for delivery by the expected timeline and the other planets are ahead of schedule already.

updates.update_userinfo: SE decks shipping + LE foil update
updates.update_content:
All good news today, folks...
Mercury SE decks are shipping
We finally got the SE decks completed and over to fulfillment and US orders are shipping out today! If your order contains only SE decks (and not LE decks), then you should receive an email with your tracking number soon (if you haven't already received it). The SE decks for international orders are shipping out to our international fulfillment center as those orders will start shipping out once the decks arrive there and get processed.
LE Deck foil fixed (I hope)

Hey folks,
As I mentioned in the previous update, shipping will start very soon for SE-only orders so this will be your last chance to update your shipping address if you haven't already. If you need to update your shipping address, please send an email ASAP to ace@vandacards.com with your new address.
Thanks! -David

Some exciting news...
Mercury SE orders ship soon
Hooray! Final assembly is underway and orders will start shipping out later this week. Standard Edition Mercury deck assembly will be completed in the next couple days and orders that contain only SE decks will begin shipping out shortly thereafter.

Hey guys,
I have good and bad news today...
We'll get the bad news out of the way first. There evidently was an issue with the foil not adhering properly to the LE tuckbox (blue) paper, resulting in a lot of foil flakes that look like glitter and get everywhere. Fortunately this wasn't an issue for the SE tuckbox (black) paper. So, Clove Street is now working with the paper manufacturer and the foil manufacturer to try to resolve this issue and get the boxes printed at a superior quality level so that you good people don't end up with decks that are flaking glittery foil everywhere. The result is further delays on getting the LE decks completed and shipped out. In the meantime, we may start shipping orders that only contain SE Mercury decks but I'll get back to you with more details on that.

campaign.story:
********************************************************************************
As a thank you to all those who have or will support this campaign, we're going to conduct two drawings for a printed album of photos from our upcoming tour. The first drawing will be comprised of all those  who pledged from the beginning of the campaign through August 31 and the second will consist of all pledgers from September 1 through the end of the campaign. See the band's Facebook pages for a video from Exene talking about this.
**********************************************************************
X! Live in Latin America! 40th Anniversary Celebration Continues!  
We want to release the first ever, all original X line up (Billy Zoom, DJ Bonebrake, John Doe, Exene Cervenka) LIVE X ALBUM! While there are other live recordings, this is the first and only one we are producing and releasing on our own.
Here’s the story… In November of 2011, X was fortunate to be touring Latin America as the opening band for Pearl Jam’s South America Tour. What a life-changing and mind-altering experience it was! Our first show was in Sao Paulo, Brazil. We had no idea what the crowds would think of us, and we were really surprised when we started playing that first show.
PJ’s devoted fans were so welcoming and enthusiastic! We were playing stadiums, and sometimes it felt like a club. The early punk days in Los Angeles (and really, all the scenes in the U.S.) were about intensity as much as music. No barriers between band and people in the crowd. It was wild!  
And on Thanksgiving, in Mexico City, playing and singing Los Angeles, while earthquakes rattled the Foro Sol Stadium stage, it felt that same way. We had that “this is crazy, this is only going to happen once so remember it and enjoy it” feeling.
X - Los Angeles 1981
  X live in Brazil 2011
While we toured in South America, Costa Rica, and Mexico, another fortunate thing happened. Pearl Jam’s sound engineer recorded all our shows, and gave us these incredible, professional recordings to use.
But we didn’t know what to do with the recordings! We didn’t want to give them to a record label, or license the songs, we didn’t even know if we could. We were apprehensive the songs would just disappear into somebody’s pocket and never be heard from again. (We’ve had a few bad experiences…)   
One day a friend suggested we release the tracks via Kickstarter. We just needed someone great and amazing to mix the songs….  
We asked Rob Schnapf (Beck, Fidlar, Booker T., Elliot Smith) if he would produce, engineer and mix these for us. When he said yes, we decided to give this a go. Best case scenario!  
We came up with a long list of prizes and rewards for your patronage, should you be so kind as to donate to our project. There is something for everyone! X has always been a do-it-ourselves kind of band, as you will see by our rewards. We still love the hand-made, the paste-up, and the songbooks. Plus, you will get the first ever, all original member, X! LIVE RECORDING!   This is the ONLY place you can get it, as the album will be exclusive to this campaign and won't be available outside of that.
X at the Roxy in LA by Rick Nyburg 2017
Thank you for staying with us the last 40 years! And thank you for funding our project. If we surpass our goal (which includes mixing & engineering, making & manufacturing rewards, and shipping & handling) we will use the money to keep our 2 vans running and keep ourselves touring. Maybe even get some matching outfits tailor-made…. Gotta come up with something special for the 41st year.   
THANKS!!!  
X
*****TRACKS ON THE ALBUM LIKELY WILL INCLUDE*****
Your Phone's Off The Hook  
White Girl  
Hungry Wolf
Sugarlight  
It's Who You Know  
Devil Doll  
Johny Hit & Run Pauline  
Los Angeles
Blue Spark
We're Desperate  
Nausea  
Once Over Twice  
The World's A Mess  
Because I Do
Soul Kitchen
The album will also likely include additional tracks but we won't know for sure until the mixing is completed.
*****HIGHLIGHTED REWARD PACKAGES*****
You can see along the right hand side all the great reward packages we have available in detail. We wanted to highlight a few of them here as well, in order to draw your attention to the truly unique nature of this campaign. Many of these packages touch on other aspects of the band's creative lives and offer a different insight into who X really is.
- Exene Art Postcards. This is a great way to get your hands on Exene's visual art. You'll get a set of  photographs of her work embodied on high quality postcards, with information about the work on the reverse side.
- John's Book Club. You get a copy of a book picked out for you by John, with a message as to why he finds the book significant, what it means to him, etc. 
- Disposable Camera Tour Photos.  Ever wanted to see what life is really like on tour with X, behind the scenes? Now you can. You'll get the undeveloped disposable camera full of X tour photos. Each one of these packages will be totally unique, with pictures never to be used or seen in any other context.
- Handwritten Lyric Sheets. Both John and Exene are offering this package, whereby they'll hand write the lyrics to an X song of your choice. Of course, this will also double as an artistic piece for the pledger, as the particular expression and style will be something only that band member could do.
- Guided Tour of Grammy Museum. On October 13, the Grammy Museum in Los Angeles will open an exhibition dedicated to X.  Pledgers for this package will get treated to a personalized tour of the exhibition by Exene and DJ. You can ask any of those burning questions to which you've been dying to know the answer, as well as get an insight into the band and its history available nowhere else.
- X and/or John and Exene Live. Ever had a notion that you wanted to see X or John and Exene in their acoustic duo performing for you and your friends? That's now a possibility.  Both of these packages require a lot of planning and discussion, so if you're interested you'll want to reach out via Kickstarter message and get the discussion rolling, but this is now possible!
These are just a few of the great packages we have available for pledgers.  We encourage you to look through them in detail, ask whatever questions you may have and we'll be happy to answer them. You can send questions via Kickstarter Message if you already have a Kickstarter account or XKickstarter@gmail.com.
One final note...often times in campaigns, people wish to pledge for more than one package.  Kickstarter limits you to one package per account, but if you have your eye on more than one, please contact us and we'll be happy to specify price and what you'll need to do in making your pledge.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks and challenges in this project are minimal. As a self sufficient band for 40 years, we're used to doing things for ourselves and all of what's required to make this project work is within our control. We have a good handle on our costs and will have no difficulty in fulfilling rewards if we hit the target goal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
