updates.update_content:
The new Cones of Dunshire Kickstarter page is now live! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/152274765/cones-of-dunshire-relaunch
As noted we have made a few major adjustments to the project including:
All unlimited levels that include the game are being dropped by $100 ($400 for the Deluxe game, $550 for the game with bases, and $700 for the game with metal figures). The limited, prestige levels will remain where they are. (We are still scared of the postage for where we might have to ship that carpet!)

updates.update_userinfo: Update #11: A Slight Delay for Relaunch
updates.update_content: Unfortunately there has been a delay in the relaunch of the Cones of Dunshire project. Look for us in just a few days. Stay tuned!

So, let's talk.
When we started this Kickstarter, we had several important considerations. Running it in parallel with Parks and Recreation's final season was an important part of the timing; we have several more exciting opportunities on the horizon for promotion, and we knew we would need to run the project for a longer time to accommodate them. But, it also meant that we needed to rush our typical planning cycle to get this project started.

Well, today we added the first of the color character sketches with more on the way over the next few updates! We hope you’re as excited about this artwork as we are – it’s coming together nicely.
Also, Thursday we will be sharing the first set of images for the Ral Partha Metal Miniature Figures that are available at the $800 Pledge Level. We will be posting all of them over the next week. Who doesn’t love Metal Minis?!?

Just a quick update to let you know that the hat design is up over on the splash page. It's also now available as a $30 add-on, if you're so inclined. We'll have a lot more art for you next week, including the full-color versions of the characters, so stay tuned!
Sure, we've got our last two character sketches up, and they're really cool Abbot Shaman yadda yadda. Let's talk about the board!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #6: We're All About the Base
updates.update_content:
It seems that everyone here is either leaving for a show (the Nuremberg Toy Fair) or getting back from one (PAX South, where we actually pulled out the Cones prototype for a few people). So, a quick update today.
Two more character sketches are up: the Duchess and the Dragonman. The final two sketches will be shown on Thursday, and then we'll start rolling out color versions. Sooo Fancy!

updates.update_userinfo: Update #5: Directors, Retailers, and the Non-Deluxe
updates.update_content:
Well, we're still enjoying the Director's Cut of our Kickstarter video that went up on YouTube yesterday. Check it out here!
The Dragonman and the Duchess sketches have come in, so watch for those to be posted. Also, our first color art pieces (for the Brinksman and the Maverick) are in, and those will really give you a sense of how cool the final art for the figures will look.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #4: Posters and the Director's Cut!
updates.update_content:
The poster art has now been added to the splash page. We thought about giving you a choice about which of our two designs we should go with, and then said to ourselves "doesn't paper have two sides?..." So, instead, you get BOTH designs on a double-sided poster, suitable for dorm rooms, covering unsightly drywall holes, and much more! A thousand and one uses!
Because we hope that people might actually like both sides of the poster, we are now looking at adding some of the small pledge level items as add-ons for higher pledge levels, so that you can get extras easily. More on that as we enter next week.

campaign.story:
Thank you all you wonderful backers!!! 
Please visit deadonpaper.com for more news and to catch some of these decks if you missed the project
The standard playing cards we know today have a history that's intertwined with and inseparable from tarot cards. I want to pay homage to that history and create a deck of playing cards with art inspired by the tarot. 
In some countries, traditional tarot cards aren't used just for divination, they're actually used for games the way we commonly use regular playing cards. Likewise, today's standard playing cards are used by some for divination—known as cartomancy. The two card systems started out as the same thing and are still inextricably linked. This deck is the first I'm aware of that takes that simple fact as the inspiration for its design.
The Art, Suits, Symbolism, and the Rider-Waite
The art for this deck is heavily influenced by the 1910 Rider-Waite-Smith tarot deck—its pretty much the standard for tarot cards used for divination. Though the style of my art is very different from Pamela Smith's art, the themes and intent will be very much in the spirit of her artwork with a healthy dose of my own intent and interpretation. 
Arcana is first-and-foremost a playing card deck. Wherever possible I've pulled inspiration from the RWS Tarot, the Tarot of Marseilles, and the Sola Busca Tarot. That includes the royals, the suits, and the symbolism. That said, combining the two has meant a few tradeoffs.
Arcana isn't intended to be a full tarot deck. Playing cards printed through USPCC are 56 card decks (main cards plus 2 jokers, and 2 extra cards) while the tarot uses 78 cards. As a playing card deck, I'll be designing 56 cards, which means I have to limit the Major Arcana to 4 cards (replacing the two jokers and the 2 extra cards). The four cards I've chosen to include are The Tower, The Lovers, The Fool, and Death. I've consulted with a lot of tarot readers on this and they more or less agree that these cards are of importance to any reading and make sense to include. Additionally, these cards will not include the Page/Knave cards.
Correlating the suits was also a little dicey as there is at least a little healthy debate about which playing card suit goes with which tarot suit. I opted to go with what seemed like the most common concensus. Spades, Clubs, Hearts and Diamonds are paired up in this deck with Swords, Wands, Cups, and Pentacles respectively.
Also, just a note about my art. I take inspiration from all over—art history, found images, my own sketches and photographs. I combine all of it to create something new. I create the final art by combining art from scratchboard and images I draw on my tablet. It's all hand drawn, and I'm meticulous about making sure the final imagery works at the relatively small scale of playing cards.
The Cards
I hope you can tell from this artwork how much passion and dedication I have for the project. Each card takes many, many hours to draw, and I've been working on it for about a year. For me, the art is what custom playing cards are all about. If you backed one of my past projects, you know how detailed and unique my work is. It's a great pleasure to bring you these cards which I think takes my art to a whole new level. Please note that all images are just comps and subject to change.
Card back light
Card back dark
Jack of Clubs/Wands - light
King of Spades/Swords - light version
Jack of Spades/Swords light version
Ace of Hearts/Cups - dark version
Queen of Hearts/Cups dark
10 of Hearts/Cups dark
Ace of Spades/Swords light
Ace of Spades/Swords dark
7 of Spades/Swords dark
Queen of Diamonds/Pentacles
5 of Clubs/Wands dark
The Tower - one of the 4 major arcana cards in this deck
The Lovers
Death
Jack of Hearts/Cups light
King of Hearts/Cups light
King of Diamonds/Pentacles - light
Many of the other royals are in various stages of completion. My goal is to have all the artwork finalized by the end of the funding period. That's a tall order, so it's possible completing the art might stretch a bit past the funding period. I'll definitely be posting more card images as I create them, so be sure to check back and feel free to offer suggestions.
The Box
As you can tell, there will be 2 versions of Arcana, one light and the other dark. Here are some images of the box:
Text translates roughly to 'As above, so below'
The Prints
NOTE: Prints can now be included as add-ons for $50/ ($58 Int.)
As with my past projects, I'm making prints available of of each royal design, the card back, box front, and the aces. My process is to create plates from the original card art. I ink the plates, then run them through my press on museum-grade artist paper:
Inking the printing plate
Lining it up on press
The finished hand-pulled print
An example of the detail in the prints
The finished print, signed and numbered. Please note that print rewards will not include the easel or board.
I think there's something really rare and special about the artistry of hand-pulling editions. I'm thrilled to offer these gallery worthy prints for about the same as what others offer mass-produced silk screened prints or even less than Giclee prints (which are nice, but really they're just ink-jet prints with a fancy name). These hand-pulled prints are a unique chance to own a limited edition work of art.
All prints will be 12" x 16" on Stonehenge paper, with hand-torn deckled edges—I personally tear down the paper myself to size. All prints will be 1 color, signed and numbered editions.
Prints can be added on to your pledge for $50/($58 Int.)
Add Ons
Adding any of the add on items below is pretty simple:
First, choose a reward tier
Second, click on the "Manage my pledge" button, and add the amount of the add-on. 
That's pretty much it. After the funding period, You'll be able to specify versions, sizes, etc.If you're an international backer, be sure to add the shipping amount if an add on has additional shipping costs (specified below).
Hardbound Illustrated Book - $28/$36 (Int.)SHIPS  DECEMBER 2015
This 6" x 9" black linen hardbound book with dust jacket will be illustrated with full page art for every major card (every card that has an illustration) and gives you a chance to learn more about what I wanted to accomplish with each illustration. It also will serve as a primer for those newer to tarot on how to read each card. It will contain approximately 150 – 200 pages. 
Please note that this is only a comp image and final art and layout is subject to change
Comp image of an interior layout. Minor cards (2s-10s) will likely be ganged 2-up on a page, all major illustrations will be full page art.
MAJOR ARCANA Expansion Deck - $20/$25 (Int.)
Deck with both light and dark versions of the Major Arcana tarot cards. This deck is for folks who want a complete tarot set and is in addition to the light and dark main cards. 
PLEASE NOTE THIS DECK WILL NOT SHIP UNTIL DECEMBER 2015
Major Arcana Expansion Deck
Tarot 2-piece Boxes - $5 each, int. shipping included
Ships December 2015
Dark version 2-part box (please note that no cards are included with the box and the design is subject to change
Light version 2-part box (please note that no cards are included with the box and the design is subject to change
As promised, these premium finished boxes are being made available to you more-or-less at cost. These are 2mm thick cardboard boxes that will come in dark and light versions, will have metallic foil and spot UV varnish. These are 2-part boxes, meaning the top fits over the bottom and encloses the cards within. I did my best to mock these up, but please note the comps are for the general idea only and do not show the final design or premium finishes. These boxes are intended for folks who want to separate light and dark cards from the expansion deck and keep full tarot sets together.
Black Walnut and White Oak Inlay Wooden Tarot Box with Arcana Medallion - $45 / $55 Int.
Ships December 2015
Please note: The medallion in this image was comped, the box is a real prototype. Wooden box does not include cards.
Please note: Wooden box does not include cards.
This box is STUNNING in person, I hope the images do it justice! The white oak inlay really sets off the black walnut which has an at times reddish cast to it. This is sized to perfectly contain one full Tarot set (not included). This box can be used to protect and store complete tarot sets when used with the expansion deck. It features a swing hinge top piece that opens up to reveal the cards within. And, of course, it is topped off with an inset Arcana Silver-Finish Medallion.
30" x 30" Black Silk Tarot Reading Cloth with Metallic Silver Imprint - $22 / $26 Int.
Silk Tarot Reading Cloth. Please note design is subject to change slightly before being produced. Does not include wall or moulding, but shadows are included free of charge.
 I've found an amazing source for 100% silk tarot cloths. These beauties will be screen printed with metallic silver ink. They'll make an amazing setting for tarot readings!
Extra decks - $11/$13(Int.)
No Extra deck limits, add on as many as you'd like.
T-Shirts - $22/$32(Int.)
Premium 4.2 oz. Available in S-XL (after the funding period you'll be able to select which version and size you'd like).
Arcana tree of life t-shirt
Arcana rota fortunae t-shirt
Arcana Uncut Sheets - $50/$75(Int.)
Uncut sheets are taken off the press as they're printed at the USPCC. They show every card in the deck, front and back. Each sheet will be signed and there is no limit to the number you may add-on. Each sheet is approximately 22" x 26.5"
Arcana Uncut sheets - dark and light versions
Antique Silver Finish Coins—$12, shipping included for domestic and international
These are the same heavy-duty, 10 gauge, half-dollar sized coins I had minted for my past projects, this time with an antique silver finish. They're a great weight (about the same as 5 quarters), super detailed and have a gorgeous finish. Other coins are molded, these are minted and that's a difference you can see and feel in the detail. Nothing beats a 100 tons of pressure making every detail pop. 
Antique finish coins - this is just a comp image and art is subject to change
Solid Silver Proof Arcana Coin—$55 (shipping included for domestic and international)
One troy ounce of .999 pure silver coin - note that this is just a mockup.
One of the advantages of having coins minted (as opposed to molded, don't get me started…) is that I can mint them in solid precious metals. For the first time, I'm proud to offer a SOLID silver version of the Arcana coin. This coin isn't silver plated, it is one troy ounce of solid .999 pure silver. These are "proof coins" and will have with a mirror finish. Below is a comp (since they aren't minted yet), but should give you an idea of what it will look like and how it differs from the regular antique silver-finish coin (which is a great genuine metal minted coin, but is not solid silver, it's a brass alloy coin with a finish applied).
Please note that because of the nature of this reward, outside the US it is strictly "buy at your own risk". We will under no circumstances issue replacement coins if your postal carrier loses it, misplaces it, or you otherwise do not receive it. We lose tracking ability when most international shipments fly out through Chicago, but our responsibility for packages ends when ship to you in good faith. We've experienced some fraud in the past, and this type reward opens us up to a LOT of risk, so we are also limiting orders to 5 per backer. Also, within the US these coins will be sent separately from other rewards and the USPS will request your signature for you to receive the coins.
 It's hard to comp up the coins to show exactly what they look like, but here's a picture from a past project showing the detail when coins are minted:
Actual minted coins
 Stretch Goals
50K - Iridescent pearl paper stock for tucks—REACHED!
55K - Designs/printing inside tucks—REACHED!
60K - Embossing + foil(s) on tucks—REACHED!!
65K - Major Arcana expansion deck—REACHED!!!
75K - Free print for EVERY PRINT BACKER—REACHED!!!
100K - Free gift for EVERY BACKER (over $11)—REACHED!!! 
120K - The Illustrated Guide to Arcana hardbound book released. —REACHED!!!
150K stretch goal - LE deck sleeve for every every deck, Gilded Edition released—REACHED!!! What? Yes!
This last stretch goal requires a little explanation. I want to do something very special that doesn’t require backers to add anything on—a true thank you from me to you for getting the project to this point. So if we reach this goal, I’ll include a signed and numbered sleeve for every deck that won’t interfere with you being able to open the cards up and use them. This will only be for backers—only the KS decks will come with the LE sleeve. This will make every deck in the project extra valuable, since only KS backers will ever have them.
The Gilded Edition release will be a set of all three decks with a special leather bound book box I’ll be hand binding myself (book binding is a one of my passions as you might have been able to tell from all the pictures with the cast-iron book press in this project). The decks will have edges gilded with palladium leaf. Palladium leaf is more expensive than silver leaf and has one major advantage. Palladium leaf does not tarnish, or oxidize, and maintains it’s finish under the harshest of conditions. It’s so stable in fact, that it’s used for gilding in conditions where it will be exposed to outdoor elements. Personally I think it’s more beautiful too, it has a slightly warmer tone than silver leaf. There will only be 25 (changed - now 45, also, will include everything at the $500 level too) of these very rare and special sets made available. Because these decks will be EXTREMELY labor intensive to produce, they will be a new reward tier and will cost $500. I know that sounds like a lot of money, and it is, but others sell genuinely gilded decks (not fake gilding using cheap foils) for upwards of $125 a piece. Hand gilding decks is an EXTREMELY labor intensive process requiring sanding multiple times at progressively finer grits, buffing to a glass-like finish, sizing the edges to receive the metal leaf, and then carefully applying the leaf. Truly these will be the ultimate collector’s item. If we reach the 150K mark, I’ll release the timing details of the Gilded Edition tier in advance (see Update) so everyone has a fair shot if interested in them. They will be first-come, first-serve.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third project so I feel like I've got a lot of experience. That said, there's any number of things that could go awry. From printing errors (they happen sometimes), to shipping issues, to production problems with other rewards, these projects have a way of throwing curveballs. BUT, after two successful projects I think I know what to look for and how to plan as much as possible for the unforeseen. And, of course, it'll help to consult the divinatory powers of these cards to ensure things go of without a hitch ;)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Pretty Filthy is a musical that dares to go where no other major musical has gone before: the San Fernando Valley, world capital of porn. Here on the other side of the Hollywood sign, they’re not pretending to have love scenes--they’re doing it for real. The creators of Pretty Filthy spent months visiting porn sets and interviewing the real people of porn. What we learned changed our lives—and now we want to change yours. This labor of love (and sex) has been years in the making—YOUR support will help bring this bold new musical to the stage!
A SHOWBIZ MUSICAL ABOUT PORN?
The story of Pretty Filthy began several years ago. Members of our company, The Civilians, found themselves talking about some of their favorite musicals—Gypsy, Cabaret, A Chorus Line. What do these classics have in common? They’re shows about performers— lives on the other side of the bright lights. We asked ourselves: “Well, what type of entertainer has yet to have their own major musical?” The obvious answer was the “adult” entertainer. The porn star on the other side of your screen. 
But the hard question was—what would it take for us to do this right? We didn’t want to just write about our pre-conceived ideas. So we left New York for the Valley, and over several months we interviewed hundreds of porn professionals. We visited sets, visited porn stars at home, ate sushi with porn stars. We listened. We learned. And the extraordinary people we met proved our hunch was right—porn is the next big show-biz musical. In a sense, porn is a mirror of our society (and a mirror that shows everything from the sublime to the totally trashy). But most importantly, these characters need to be heard on stage. (And they need to sing.)
A TRUE LABOR OF LOVE.
The show’s creative team, composer Michael Friedman (Bloody Bloody Andrew Jackson, Fortress of Solitude), writer Bess Wohl (American Hero), and director Steve Cosson (Mr. Burns, a post-electric play), have been crafting this musical for the past several years. Taking inspiration from the extensive research, the writing team developed the script. Along the way, we tried out songs and material in front of small audiences, much of which you can listen to on The Civilians podcast here.  (For quick reference: episodes 49, 50, 51, 52, 54, 55, 56, 58, 65)
The Civilians are thrilled to be producing the culmination of all these efforts with the premiere production of Pretty Filthy. The show will be presented in a beautiful hundred-year-old Broadway style theater in New York City’s historic Lower East Side. We’ve put together a cast featuring some of the brightest stars of musical theater, and a dream design team of Broadway visionaries. We are primed to launch, but we are doing this ourselves without the support of a larger institutional theater. And that makes this campaign all the more critical to our ability to fully realize the potential of Pretty Filthy.
Composer Michael Friedman and Writer Bess Wohl
WE CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU.
This is by far the most ambitious project The Civilians has undertaken to date. We are producing on a bigger scale than ever before, and taking this risk because we believe so completely in Pretty Filthy. By supporting this project, you are an integral part of this brilliant team. Every contribution, no matter the amount, is vitally important and will go directly towards supporting this non-profit production. Your help also enables us to host a series of discussions with several leading adult entertainers such as the legendary Nina Hartley. We invite you to take this leap with us and boldly go where no major musical has ever gone before.
Research in the valley
THE PERKS
To thank you for joining us on this Pretty Filthy journey, we’ve put together some exclusive awards—benefits and experiences that are only available through this Kickstarter campaign. You can help bring the legendary Nina Hartley to New York, and join her for a pre-show dinner, a backstage tour, and you’ll sit next to her during the show! Other rewards are one-on-one script development sessions with writer Bess Wohl and composer Michael Friedman. A special, behind-the-scenes download of photos and excerpts from our investigation. Free advice by phone from a porn star! And for the very brave, you can make your own movie with multiple AVN Award-winning director Eli Cross! We’re delighted to be able to share these unique experiences with you. And we’re immensely grateful to our friends in the adult industry for helping to make it all possible. Thank you! 
Please note that some restrictions to ticket-related perks apply:
-Tickets are for specific dates during the performance run. Midweek preview performances refer to the following dates: 2/1/15, 2/3/15, 2/4/15, 2/5/15. Any preview performances refer to the following dates: 1/31/15, 2/1/15, 2/3/15, 2/4/15, 2/5/15, 2/6/15, 2/7/15, 2/8/15.
-All tickets must be redeemed and booked by Friday, January 16, 2015.  We cannot guarantee that we will be able to accommodate specific requests after this time.
-Please specify if there any special accessibility needs in advance.
-The show is suitable for adults only.
MORE ABOUT PRETTY FILTHY
Originally commissioned by the prestigious Center Theater Group in Los Angeles, Pretty Filthy will have its world premiere at The Playhouse, in the Abrons Arts Center in New York City.The limited engagement runs from January 31 - March 1, 2015 with preview performances taking place January 31 - February 7.
Click here to view coverage of Pretty Filthy in the New Yorker winter season preview!
Tickets and more info here!
New Yorker illustration by Daniel Hertzberg
Is my donation tax-deductible?
Yes! The Civilians is a 501(c)3 non-profit entity, so all Kickstarter donations are tax-deductible. "How much of what I give is deductible?" you ask. That depends. When the campaign ends, we'll send you a survey. If you choose to receive the tangible benefits associated with your donation, those costs will be deducted from the amount you gave. And, yes—we'll also email you a tax receipt for your records.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
By definition, this is a musical about an industry that is pushing boundaries, taking risks, and overcoming new challenges. This industry has had to adapt to major changes brought about by rapidly evolving technologies. Doing honor to this industry and the candid interviews given by insiders has been a huge challenge, and one we feel we have conquered.

The Civilians have created a musical about porn that is honest, which is a risky thing to put on stage! In addition, this is a huge step for us as a company as we embark on producing a musical on a bigger scale than ever before. The success of the show is dependent on our Kickstarter supporters and audiences. We hope you will help us by helping us to create a full and complete production this February.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Join the Pretty Filthy creators and cast at The Civilians Spring Benefit on Monday, April 27th
updates.update_content:
Dear Pretty Filthy Kickstarter Backers, 
One week from today, we will be celebrating the world premiere of Pretty Filthy along with The Civilians 2015 season at our Annual Spring Benefit, taking place at City Winery (155 Varick Street).  It'll be a glittery night honoring Jon Platt, a multiple Tony-award winning Broadway producer and producer of Pretty Filthy and renowned playwright José Rivera.  
We invite you to join the festivities! You won't want to miss out on intimate musical performances by the Pretty Filthy cast, Michael Friedman, Jill Sobule, previews of upcoming Civilians productions, and unique tributes to our honorees. The evening begins at 6pm with a VIP cocktail hour and dinner. At 8:30pm, there will be a cocktail reception followed by the performance.

updates.update_userinfo: Lortel Nominations for Pretty Filthy / Announcing Original Cast Recording / Civilians Spring Benefit on April 27
updates.update_content:
Dearest Pretty Filthy backers,  
We are writing with some very exciting news and updates. First up: Pretty Filthy received a 2015 Lucille Lortel Award nomination for Outstanding Musical! And the good news doesn't stop there- the extraordinary Steve Rosen was recognized for Outstanding Featured Actor in a Musical and the formidable Luba Mason for Outstanding Featured Actress in a Musical. The Lortel Awards recognizes excellence in Off-Broadway theater and we could not be more proud. We wish all of the nominees a hearty congratulations - we're in esteemed company! The awards ceremony takes place on Sunday, May 10th at The Skirball Center.

updates.update_userinfo: Pretty Filthy SUNNY CALIFORNIA ticket discount offer – a cold weather remedy
updates.update_content:
Dear Pretty Filthy Kickstarter Backers, 
Our third week of Pretty Filthy performances is underway and while we’re facing an arctic chill here in NYC, we invite you all to come bask in the warmth of our show. We’ve set up a special discount ticket code that will help transport you to that sunnier place- enter code SUNNYCA to purchase discounted $40 tickets by clicking here.

updates.update_userinfo: Pretty Filthy opens in New York to rave reviews!
updates.update_content:
Dear Pretty Filthy Kickstarter backers, 
After several years of research, development, and rehearsals, we were so proud to open the world premiere of Pretty Filthy at Abrons Arts Center this past Sunday evening. It has been a long road and through your contribution to our Kickstarter campaign, you were among the original believers who got us here. We're pretty darn grateful.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you everyone for making this the best holiday ever.

updates.update_content:
THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts! WE DID IT!
We just met our income goal of raising $25,000 to go towards supporting the world premiere of Pretty Filthy thanks to YOU!
Our campaign ends this Tuesday, December 23rd at 11:59pm EST, so let all of your friends know that there are still a few more days left to gain access to discounted tickets for preview performances, insider access to The Civilians’ process, VIP performance events, and once-in-a-lifetime experiences with superstars of the adult entertainment industry! We are also only 28 backers away from reaching 300 before the end of the campaign for our additional $3,000 boost- which would be a tremendous help to the show. Please continue to spread the word!

updates.update_userinfo: New raffle for a signed poster + an exclusive behind-the-scenes video
updates.update_content: This just in! All backers will be entered in a random drawing to win a classic poster of The Devil in Miss Jones signed by the legendary Georgina Spelvin at the close of this campaign. This includes all pledges made to date and new ones at any level going forward. Georgina Spelvin is the star of this iconic adult film and the author of a memoir titled The Devil Made Me Do It, which chronicles her journey from Broadway stages to the porn industry. And if you've never seen this 1973 porno chic gem, we highly recommend it. Maybe you could throw a viewing party of The Devil in Miss Jones to get people in the holiday spirit? We think it is existentially seasonal, a personal battle over good and evil, heaven and hell—like Ebenezer Scrooge himself.

updates.update_userinfo: Help us reach 300 backers for a $3K boost!
updates.update_content:
Dear Pretty Filthy backers,
As of today, we are officially at the halfway point of our campaign with 12 days remaining. We've made tremendous progress so far thanks to your support. And now, big news! A saintly donor has offered to kick in a $3,000 boost if we are able to reach 300 backers by this Friday, Dec. 12 at 11:59pm EST. This is not going to be easy. We are currently halfway there and we need your help in spreading the word about our campaign to help us get there. Any donation level counts towards this challenge!

updates.update_userinfo: A special video clip for our early backers!
updates.update_content:
Thank you for being an early supporter of our Kickstarter campaign. You are the ones launching us off in making this world premiere musical become a reality, and we are showering you with endless gratitude through the magic of the internet. We've crossed the $10,000 threshold and are nearly half way to our campaign goal thanks to YOUR support.
But now come the second week slumps. We’ve been warned, but we are hoping you will be our secret weapon. You are a part of something truly special and unique – the world is starting to take notice. But the reality is that a campaign like this is dependent on our dedicated supporters (you!) and their friends who may not know about us yet, but would love us if they did. It would mean more than you know if you take a moment to post our campaign link on your favorite social networks, tag us, and tell them why you decided to back us. Here are some suggestions:

campaign.story:
If you love coffee as much as we do, we're sure you would LOVE to be able to drink it anytime anywhere. And so would we! That is why we decided to make a coffee mug that is practical and sustainable, but is also a fashion accessory and tells the primeval story of coffee.
Its most obvious feature is definitely its shape which resembles the goat´s horns but it also helps you drink that last sip of your coffee and makes you look good.
We designed a special holder with leather touch which simply turns into a coffee mug stand so you can easily keep the Goat mug on your desk.
Also, Goat mug comes with a set of two straps (short and longer part combine in to one), so you can simply attach it to your bag or just let it fall across your shoulder. This way you can carry your books or bags and talk on the phone while carrying your coffee around.
Goat mug is 100% leak proof so don't worry about getting coffee stains on your jeans. It s also safe for your health because it is BPA FREE.
Since you are on-the-go kind of person, we made your life easier by making the Goat´s lid so user friendly, you can easily open and close it with only one hand.
 Here's a look inside the Goat mug. It's shape makes it simple to clean.
We designed a beautiful packaging to deliver your Goat mug in style. It can then become a perfect storage place for your fresh coffee beans.
We would love for more coffee lovers to learn the real story about coffee as much as we would love all of them to be stylish and eco-friendly while drinking their coffee wherever and whenever. That is why we would appreciate you backing our project. Surely, there will be more coffees enjoyed if we manage to make our dream come true.
Help us share our project among other coffee lover out there
Awards structure:
The first stretch goal is an idea we got from our backer Tamara. If we manage to raise $60,000 we will offer everyone a new colour option of the Goat mug - the PANTONE COLOUR OF THE YEAR: MARSALA. Let's do it!
The second stretch goal is out! If we manage to raise $250,000 we will offer a new reward: HEMP EDITION Goat mug - for all those on the relaxed side of fashion.
 Never. Enough. Coffee. You asked for big, we're giving you GRANDE. Third streth goal is set to $350,000! Can we do this together?
If all goes according to our plans, we will be shipping out products already in second half of February. Let's do this together!  
Design of the GOAT STORY Coffee mug was done by design studio Desnahemisfera in cooperation with MyEqua.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team has lots of experience with product design, production and tooling processes. We believe that being well prepared, expecting the unexpected and having a back up plan is what makes us trustworthy. 

Since the design of the Goat mug is so different from all other coffee mugs out there, we had to pay special attention to finding the right producers that will enable the production of the Goat mug to run as smoothly as possible. We spent almost a year arranging and optimising all steps in production line. We already financed some parts of necessary tooling, but we need your support in order to finalise all the details and missing parts.

We want to be 100% honest with our customers and will keep you up to date with EVERYTHING. Every bit of change will be posted in our updates section, so you'll always know how far in production or in the shipping process your Goat mug is.

Speaking of shipping... We got that covered too, so you don't have to worry about anything, just sit back and get Goat mug delivered to your door.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
UPDATE: We "leveled up" and we’re so excited to add Criminal, The Heart, The Allusionist (Helen Zaltzman's new show), and now Mortified to the collective. For Radiotopia - and all of radio - to be the best it can be, we need to find even more people who are not currently on our radar.
So we have a big idea. At $600,000, Radiotopia will create a pilot development fund to find new, talented producers and hosts. We will specifically seek out new voices to pilot programs that tackle subjects not well covered in traditional public media.
Quality will always be our first criteria. I believe diversity of people and perspectives is the key component to quality that’s too often neglected in media.
We are interested in producers who pilot their own program, as well as contribute stories to existing Radiotopia shows.
Bringing in new voices and broadening the audience are critical steps in remaking public radio. Our collective of shows is already proving that incredible talent exists in unexpected places, and that we have a knack for finding it.
If you believe in this mission, kick in another buck or two, or just spread the word.
***The Hover 20,000 Backer Challenge***
We did it! Thank you so much for being one of the 20,000 and helping us get the extra $25,000 from Hover. Look what we did together!
"[A] kind of Justice League for smart documentarians and sound artists."
--Bill McKibben
This is Radiotopia. I'm Roman Mars.
Radiotopia became a reality in November 2013, when I called on the backers of the last 99% Invisible campaign to fund "a new kind of public radio." Radio full of the most compelling stories imaginable, made by a group of talented creators combining their energies to grow their audiences and thrive. 
People - probably many of you - rallied beyond our wildest dreams. It was an awe-inspiring moment, the realization that the heart of a radio fan can grow to make room for many deserving shows. Together with PRX, we’ve taken that love, trust, and money to bring together a collective of the best storytelling shows on the planet.
99% Invisible
Fugitive Waves
Love + Radio
Radio Diaries
Strangers
Theory of Everything
The Truth
These shows make you laugh, cry, cringe, remember, reflect, strive, despair, relax... everything. 
As if that weren’t enough, as members of Radiotopia, they are reimagining radio from broadcast to digital, and the life of a creator from starving to sustainable. Radiotopia is bringing a listener-first, creator-driven ethos to public radio.
In just a few months, we have built a true collective of indie producers who share editorial, business, and emotional resources. It’s not just an amazing group of podcasts, it’s an amazing group of people. And we’re getting somewhere:
The Radiotopia Network has increased downloads by 165% since our launch nine months ago.
Two shows have more than quadrupled their audience.
99% Invisible, which had the biggest audience to begin with, has grown by 135%.
The dream is alive, but our work here is far from done. 
To take it to the next level, we need you. Podcasts need about 50,000 downloads per episode for some measure of financial sustainability. Radiotopia wants our existing shows to blow through that number. That takes more gear, more staff, more travel, more branding and promotion. Our shows are not just two people chatting in front of microphone (not that there's anything wrong with that - I love a lot of those shows); they are skillfully crafted, sound-rich productions. That commitment to craft requires a lot of time and resources.
Your Kickstarter pledge will support all the shows in Radiotopia and ensure that all of us will continue to produce our best work.
We also want to invite more shows into Radiotopia. A win-win-win for us, for deserving creators, and for you, our fans and listeners. Your support will make that happen.
 The Rewards
Radiotopia Ringtones
All the shows in Radiotopia are contributing to a set of awesome and awesomely weird ringtones/alert tones. Sample:
Strangers Pen-Pal Letterhead
Print-your-own Strangers letterhead and gain a stranger pen-pal, assigned to you by Lea. (Pen-pal part is optional.) Both letterhead AND the pen-pal are included at all levels $10 and above.
Strangers digital letterhead, comes with pen-pal (if you want one).
Melodium: 99 Digital LP
Melodium (Laurent Girard) has inspired and scored more of 99pi's radio stories than any other artist. Girard has created an exclusive, new digital album just for this Kickstarter, called "Melodium: 99." Sample track:
Love + Radio Remix album
New electronic music sourced from past L+R episodes and made into something wondrous. Sample track:
Signed copy of Hidden Kitchens book by The Kitchen Sisters, producers of the Fugitive Waves podcast. Alice Waters wrote the foreword. Word.
Love + Radio "Another Planet" Poster
Screen-printed 11x17
L + R Another Planet
 T-shirts. Lots.
99% Invisible Logo t-shirt- available in Men & Women sizes
Radiotopia logo t-shirt available in Men and Women sizes
The Truth t-shirt available in Men and Women sizes
Radio Diaries t-shirt
Strangers women’s t-shirt (one of the available colors). Designed by Matt Jeans.
Strangers mens t-shirt (one of the available colors)
99pi Black "Holdout" t-shirt- available in Men & Women sizes
99pi Army Holdout" t-shirt- available in Men & Women sizes
NEW: Just added a new "army" color option for the Holdout t-shirt. You will be able to specify size, color, and t-shirt selection (for any multipacks) in the Kickstarter survey sent out after the campaign ends. 
Theory of Everything t-shirt design
99% Invisible "Ray Cats" Baseball T- available in Men & Women sizes
NOTE: The 99pi "Ray Cats" shirt CAN BE included in any of the t-shirt packages (e.g. "Two t-shirts of your choosing..."), so feel free to increase that pledge for more great Radiotopia apparel. You get a deal for being so generous!
Mugs
NOTE: When you order the Mug for $45, you'll also receive all the digital gifts: L + R album, Melodium album, Strangers letterhead, ringtones. 
Radiotopia favorites collection, plus incredible headphones.
We'll send you a little mp3 player packed with our favorite episodes. But keep the earbuds in your pocket, because you'll also get these gorgeous Radio Silenz headphones by Tivoli, with travel case. Special thanks to Tivoli for donating!
Radio Silenz headphones by TIvoli. In Walnut, Black, or Cherry.
DIY Handbook by Radio Diaries
A storytelling guide for making your own radio diaries. (Not the final cover, but close)
99% Invisible Producer for a day
Pick from a couple dozen potential days (we'll make something work) and we'll invite you into the 99% Invisible production. You'll sit in on a story meeting, critique whatever rough draft we have in process, go out to lunch (probably for pho, we love pho), and just hang out all day. You just need to get yourself to Oakland.
Check out the sidebar for lots of other great rewards, such as lunch with the Kitchen Sisters, Theory of Everything, or Radio Diaries, online mentoring sessions, live events and so much more!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Radiotopia "Season 2" is scheduled to start February 3, 2015 and end in January 2016.

We are a collective of individually owned and operated programs, so each of us have individual challenges and goals. As such, it's hard to achieve milestones at the same rate and produce results on the same timeline. Of course, a lot of these risks would be mitigated by us raising a record-setting amount of funds and we can all devote all our energy solely to our radio shows! That sounds like a good idea.

Reward fulfillment is always a tough challenge for a small group that specializes in making radio, not shipping t-shirts, but we've partnered with people who are experts at getting merchandise to your door.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
ANOTHER NOTE: The rewards have gotten crazy with all the stretch goals. Contact us direct if you have any questions.
NOTE: All backers — no matter what the original reward text reads — will be able to choose between any of the designs declared by the end of this campaign. So even though it might say “VOYAGER or any one of the planned designs” that now includes Voyager, Cassini, Curiosity, the Mars Exploration Rovers and Sputnik. The digital downloads will also include all designs.
FEELING GOOD ABOUT THIS GOAL: 34K
We will design and print a poster celebrating The Planetary Society itself and donate 300 copies to them for sale on their own site to help support the institution and their goals.
STRETCH GOAL MET FOR POSTER #4:
We have crossed the 22K line and that means that there will be a poster #4 for The Mars Exploration Rovers; Opportunity and Spirit. Chosen by the users of planetary.org in poll conducted in October. We expect that design to be completed after the campaign has ended, target date November 15.
STRETCH GOAL MET FORPOSTER #5:
We have crossed the 28K line and that means that there will be a poster #5 for Sputnik. Chosen by the users of planetary.org in poll conducted in October. We expect that design to be completed after the campaign has ended, target date November 18.
Poster #3: Curiosity
The Chop Shop is excited to launch our second Kickstarter, the first of which was completed last November. For those of you unfamiliar with that campaign, we successfully funded an illustrated map populated with the locations of 136 of the most popular sci-fi and fantasy events to ever take place in the Altered States of America.
Image Altered States, our first Kickstarted campaign
After delving deep into the world of fantasy and fiction we are now setting our sights much higher… deep space exploration. Having already launched our own line of space-themed t-shirts including Beyond Earth, Above Earth and You are the Sun — we are happy to have confirm that real robot themed designs seem to be just as popular as fictional robot designs.
50+ YEARS OF ROBOTIC SPACE PROBES
With the recently completed airing of the new Cosmos series, a new high-tech rover on Mars, Europeans landing on a comet in November and New Horizons on it’s way to Pluto in 2015 — the public is excited again about deep space exploration. Additionally, the age of the internet has made data from various past missions easily accessible to the masses. From all corners of the globe, amateur imagers are re-working old data sets with the power of modern computing and generating new looks at faraway places without ever having to leave the ground.
Each of these missions represent the best of what human intellect can achieve and can also provide a nostalgic sense of pride. To many, Voyager was a big part living through the '80s with it’s tour of the outer solar system and Carl Sagan’s original Cosmos series. In the ’90s Galileo treated us to a thrilling tour of Jupiter and it’s exotic moons. Then Y2K served up Cassini at Saturn and two particularly robust rovers on Mars with two out of the three operating to this day. 
We have noticed over the last few years, that there have been some beautiful poster series by various designers covering themes such as Earth science, manned space missions, the planets and astronomy. However, designs that focused specifically on any particular robotic planetary missions seemed to be almost non-existent. When you do find something — the designs are generally data-driven. The likes of which might be expected gracing the walls of a high school science lab, but not hanging prominently in one’s own living room. Well we want to change that and here is how we propose doing it.
THE PROJECT
We are proposing a series of posters based on three different historic robotic spacecraft programs. Each poster will be screen-printed in a minimum of three colors by Vahalla Studios who beautifully executed our previously mentioned Kickstarter project from last year.
How were the missions selected? First, we wanted to find out what missions are favorites among an audience that is passionate about space exploration. So on October 19th, The Planetary Society completed a simple poll on their website. The poll put to users what their three favorite robotic spacecraft missions were from Sputnik to Curiosity. This poll ran it’s course for two weeks and we now have the results which have determined what missions will be the subjects of the full series.
Poster #1: The Voyager Program (2nd below)
Poster #2: Cassini / Huygens (1st below)
Poster #3: Mars Science Lab (seen at top)
Poster #2: Cassini / Huygens
Poster #1: Voyager
As of this date, all three posters are complete. Originally we established the look and design approach we were proposing for the whole series by designing a poster for the Voyager missions which we knew would wind up being in the top three of the survey results. We later added Cassini’s design on October 21, and then Curiosity on October 31.
PROJECT PHASES
PHASE 1 We consider this campaign to have four phases. Phase 1 ran for two weeks and polled for the most popular missions according to planetary.com users.

PHASE 2 We published the poll results and announced the three missions that will comprise the series.

PHASE 3All three design options are made public.
PHASE 4Is where we are now. Hoping to reach the stretch goals.
OTHER REWARDS
MEMBERSHIP TO THE PLANETARY SOCIETY
The Planetary Society was founded in 1980 by by Carl Sagan, Bruce Murray, and Louis Friedman. The group is an advocate for funding and for missions of exploration from within NASA. In it’s many years it has been responsible for some well-known initiatives such as SETI, making rover-based exploration the standard for ongoing Mars missions and was instrumental in getting Pluto to be the first target of NASA’s New Horizons type missions. We are offering on several reward levels an opportunity for backers to also become Members of The Planetary Society at a special rate of 50% the usual cost (normally $36, but available to backers for only $18). Membership to TPS includes a subscription to their quarterly magazine, The Planetary Report, and you will receive special opportunities and invitations to participate more in community activities and Citizen Science projects. 
We have also decided to include a complimentary copy of our Beyond Earth letterpress print to the first 30 backers who choose from the membership included rewards.
The Planetary Report Quarterly Magazine
YOU ARE THE SUN T-SHIRT Displays the new solar system on your chest, featuring Carl Sagan’s “Pale Blue Dot”, Pluto lost among the Kuiper Belt, all the major moons and your head as a stand in for the sun. These will be made available in styles for Men and Women and screen-printed on American Apparel brand t-shirts. See more at chopshopstore.com.
Tshirt: You Are the Sun
ABOVE EARTH T-SHIRT Featuring 23 historic missions that explored near-Earth space both manned, unmanned and sometimes monkeyed or dogged. The missions are spirally arranged in chronological order starting with Sputnik (the first man-made object to be set in Earth orbit) to Space-X’s Eagle module. These will be made available in styles for Men and Women and screen-printed on American Apparel brand t-shirts. See more at chopshopstore.com.
Tshirt: Above Earth
BEYOND EARTH T-SHIRT (please note: this was accidentally called “Above Earth” in two of the rewards so we marked those as sold out) Featuring 23 historic missions of various nations that traveled beyond Earth orbit to explore our solar system. The missions are also loosely arranged according to their some of their most notable destinations. The design includes some of the earliest missions such as the Soviet Union’s Venera 7 which was the first probe to soft-land on the surface of another planet to one of the newest members of the Martian community of surface dwellers, Curiosity. These will be made available in styles for Men and Women and screen-printed on American Apparel brand t-shirts. See more at chopshopstore.com.
Beyond Earth on an American Apparel Men’s Black
BEYOND EARTH LETTERPRESS PRINT (please note: this was accidentally called “Above Earth” in one of the rewards and we can no longer fix that error) An impressive large-scale print with the same design as noted above with the exception of featuring the Sojourner Mars Rover instead of Curiosity (printed before it’s successful landing). Print is two color grey inks infused with a metallic silver on a black sheet of 19" x 25" French, Speckltone 80lb paper. See chopshopstore.com for more.
Beyond Earth as a letterpress print
THANKS
We would in particular like to thank The Planetary Society for their involvement in this project. I myself joined the society at age 12 — soon after reading Cosmos from cover to cover. So I am honored to have the Society assisting or campaign in the way it has.
Also, a specific shout out to Mat Kaplan and Planetary Radio for coming up with the idea to crowd-source the most popular missions in the first place.
To Jeff Sheilds (aka Kleptonaut also on Sound Cloud) for always creating music that is perfect for my Kickstarter projects even before I have conceived of them.
And thanks to you for considering our project. I hope we will be sending you a print or two or three in December.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The one thing out-of-our-hands is the printing turn-around. We are contracting a very professional outside agency which we worked with on our previous campaign. We will be subject to their production times and schedule but do not expect that to be an issue. 

We do expect delivery in December, but there is some possibility that unseen forces could result in screen prints not being shipped and arriving by December 23rd.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We are finally planning New Missions for our Historic Robotic Spacecraft collection! 
Enough time has passed that we can actually start to consider new missions that have been successfully deployed since we launched our first campaign in in 2014. This would include missions like Juno, Parker Solar Probe, InSight, OSIRIS-Rex, and Hyabusa (1 & 2).

updates.update_userinfo: We Have Another Kind of Spaceship Related Kickstarter Project and Rewards Ship in Time for Xmas!
updates.update_content: Eleven years ago we produced weRobot and later many other similar themes over the years including aliens, space probes, rock stars, etc. The one question was always, “when are you doing spaceships?”.

updates.update_userinfo: 5 Hours to go on Planetary Blocks and we Added a Free Supplemental Two-Sided Fold-Out Poster!
updates.update_content: We wanted to give one last shout out to our previous backers when there was just a few hours left to go.

Our Planetary Blocks campaign has been going well thanks to our previous backers and Planetary Society Members! Backers funded us in just 36 hours and as of today we are at 289% and rising. 
We have posted two “explainer videos” which illustrate how the various sides of the blocks will work with one another. The first of these videos is for the side dealing with SCALE. By comparing the various worlds, the viewer can see easily the relative size of all twenty worlds as compared to the Earth. There is even a solution for the giant gas planets and the Sun.

updates.update_userinfo: Bill Nye with an Exclusive Look at Our Newest Campaign and Exclusive Early Bird Access
updates.update_content: Our Solar System has many worlds, each of them remarkable in myriad ways. Thomas Romer, who designs our Planetary Society gear for The Official Planetary Society Store at Chop Shop, has collected 20 intriguing bodies from our celestial neighborhood and transferred them onto toy wooden blocks. Once you see them, I think you’ll agree that these “toys” aren’t just for kids! The full set includes eight planets, eight moons, three dwarf planets, and the sun.

updates.update_userinfo: A Small Delay on Our Next Kickstarter. Please Sign up to be Notified!
updates.update_content:
Sorry to bother everyone again, but the next Kickstarter with The Planetary Society was delayed for a few weeks more. We promise, it is going up this month for sure. 
If you like, please sign-up to be notified as soon as it goes live here. Note: You may need to enable or allow pop-ups to view the simple form. Then once you are done, take a look at the collection. All the products on that page are the result of previous Kickstarter campaigns. 
For now, here is another sneak-peek at the upcoming project:

updates.update_userinfo: Our Next Kickstarter with The Planetary Society is Coming Next Week!

updates.update_content:
Greetings supporters!
There is a new campaign running on Indiegogo to reboot our Robotic Spacecraft Screen Print Series and we added a perk exclusive to previous supporters. A 46% discount featuring products that may have not have been available to most of our backers as they hadn’t been created yet!

updates.update_userinfo: Our Poster Series for Future Astronauts is Complete!
updates.update_content: If you saw our last update, you know we started a series of Spacecraft posters for kids. At that time we only had Voyager to show. Now we have all three posters complete and there’s only 50 hours left to back our campaign!

campaign.story:
SERIALBOXTV is an episodic sixty minute television show that combines documentary explorations, intimate interviews, cinematic studio performances, and on-location, single-camera one-takes with a simple goal in mind: to create a music show unlike anything you've seen before in an effort to capture the truest, most honest portrait of both the music and artists that we all know and love.
We're incredibly excited to invite you into the process of bringing this show to life.
SERIALBOXTV will be a show that creates the rarest of commodities in today’s over saturated, desensitized audience; true and genuine connection. Connection with the music, with the artist, and with the community of fans around the world.
A frame from David Ramirez's "Any Given Tour Stop"
THE PILOT EPISODE:
While we envision SERIALBOXTV as an episodic series, with each episode of the series focusing on a different band, we want to go ahead and create the pilot episode right now. What better way to explain what we hope to accomplish than to be able to point to something specific and tangible? That's what this project will be; the pilot episode of what we hope will become a series you see on TV in the near future.
Each episode of SERIALBOXTV will focus on one artist with segments that interweave and intertwine in a way that has a multiplying effect, with the whole becoming greater than the sum of its parts.
SEGMENTS (A BREAKDOWN):
 Some visual examples of the segments of SERIALBOXTV
ONE-TAKES (CINEMATIC/STUDIO-BASED) - The studio based one-takes are the bread and butter of SerialBoxTV. Shot completely live using the highest quality audio gear that you’d find in a recording studio, but with the production equipment you’d find on a movie set, the studio based one-takes aim to occupy a space at the intersection between the energy of a live show, the sound quality of a record, and the look of a movie.
Everything you see and hear in a studio based one-take is 100% live, absolutely as it was played, without any punch-ins or pickups. The tiny imperfections present in any live performance are not something to be removed or glossed over, but rather become the very things that make for a beautiful, unexpected performance.
A frame from The Lone Bellow's studio based one-take
 IN-DEPTH INTERVIEW - The interview is the hallmark of the SerialBox take on an artist. This isn’t a “what’s your favorite color?” type of interview. Rather, it’s one that aims to dig deep into the foundational elements of why an artist creates the music that they put out. It isn’t a perfect facade, but an honest conversation about the very profound challenges of what it means to bare your soul in an effort to connect with listeners across the country and across the world. It’s a conversation about writing, about storytelling, about the big “why” elements that drive any artist. The paradox of the interview is that, the more vulnerable, the more honest the conversation, the more the audience will connect with the artist on a fundamental level.
The interview is the yin to the studio session’s yang. An audience likely has some working knowledge of the artists featured on the show, be it live concerts, music videos, or records. But the SERIALBOXTV interview will be the mortar which sets the audience’s growing appreciation and connection with the band.
A frame from JOHNNYSWIM's interview
 ONE-TAKES (SINGLE-CAMERA / ON LOCATION) - If the studio one-takes are about fidelity of image and fidelity of sound, the on-location one-takes are about creating an impression, a tone. They are about exploring how the layers of a song, a band, are revealed by performing these songs in places not normally associated with playing music.
An alleyway, a mountain top, a campfire. The “where” provides a unique perspective on the “why.”
Additionally, the broken down nature of these performances serve to further lower the wall between artist and audience. The viewer gets to experience these songs as if they were actually there with the artists while they perform them.
A frame from NEEDTOBREATHE's single-camera one-take
DAY-IN-THE-LIFE DOCUMENTARY - Sometimes the small moments, the in-between moments are the ones that tend to be the most revealing. The final minutes before an artist takes the stage. The down time wandering around an unfamiliar town. The moment alone, right after a show, before meeting the fans. These are the small things that give a glimpse into the peculiarities, the difficulties, and the rewards of a life spent playing music. These are the moments that say something about a band, about a sound, and about life behind the scenes.
The documentary segments are the unguarded and ultimately transportive moments that allow the audience to truly step into the shoes of the bands they love.
A frame from David Ramirez's "Any Given Tour Stop" doc
FEATURED ARTIST: NOAH GUNDERSEN:
Noah and Abby Gundersen
 We've chosen Noah Gundersen as the artist we'll feature in the first SERIALBOXTV pilotepisode. Noah is an incredibly talented singer-songwriter and his SerialBox Presents session was the most viewed session we've ever made. We felt that he would be a perfect fit for this longer form project. We know we have more to accomplish with Noah and are excited to explore his music in this format.
One of the challenges of any SerialBox session is communicating the process and what it is that we're looking to accomplish with the artists. Many bands today do multiple performance video projects, sessions, and takeaway style videos. Creating a successful video with us is very different than creating a successful video with other productions and requires a shift in thinking, oftentimes. The beauty of working with Noah in this form is that being that he is a SerialBox Presents alum, he's very familiar with our method of production.
 Noah Gundersen - "Cigarettes" (SerialBox Presents, S2)
PRODUCTION:
We have already scheduled the studio based one-takes and interviews for 11/14/14, and pending the successful funding of this campaign, will accompany Noah on the road for both the on-location one-takes as well as the day-in-the-life documentary.
Behind the scenes of a SerialBox session
KEY CREW AND COLLABORATORS:
Over the last couple of years of making SerialBox Presents sessions, we've developed a short hand among our key crew and collaborators, all of whom will be involved in the production of our first SERIALBOXTV episode, including the following:
Numerous other regular key crew, too many to count, will be involved in the pre, production, and post of this episode. SerialBox is a family and we're looking forward to creating together for this format. 
REWARDS:
We have a handful of rewards for contributing to this campaign, primarily centered around getting the music into your hands. We'll be pressing a limited run of vinyl that will include the studio audio from both Noah's SerialBox Presents session as well as the upcoming SerialBoxTV episode. We're very excited to be able to offer this limited edition as a thank you for contributing. 
Mock up of the vinyl
Photography has been an important component of any SerialBox project and SERIALBOXTV will be no different. As a special thank you for contributing to this project, we'll be offering a limited run of polaroid diptychs of portraits and images we shoot during production. Obviously each polaroid will be the only one in existence and will be shot with a Polaroid 600SE (which shoots 3.25"x4.25" prints). 
Ben Rector polaroid portraits
Andy Davis polaroid portraits
In addition, we're planning a few events surrounding the release of the pilot episode. Primarily, a Houston premiere party that, in addition to the full episode, will include a live Q&A between Ryan and Noah, as well as a Noah playing a handful of songs, acoustically. It will be an evening you won't want to miss. 
Finally, we're making a few spaces available for those that may be interested in attending the studio session in November. It's an incredibly special way of experiencing the music and will be a memory you won't soon forget. Hang with us as we build sets, light, set up cameras, and our multicam system. Sit back and enjoy a view that very few people will get to see. We'll wrap the session and head to dinner together and then go to Noah's concert in Houston that evening. If you're interested in the filmmaking, or the audio, or simply the music, we'd be honored to have you on set with us.
A THANK YOU FROM THE SERIALBOX TEAM:
We couldn't be more excited about the future of SERIALBOXTV and that you've decided to come along on this journey with us. We look forward to bringing you performances, documentary, and interviews with your favorites artists in a way that you haven't really seen before. By pledging to this campaign, you're joining the SBOX family as we partner together to bring something beautiful into the world. We really believe that this is the beginning of something very special.
THANKS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our highest priorities in this project are as follows:

1. Delivering a high quality, broadcast ready episode of SerialBoxTV
2. Delivering said episode on time and within budget
3. Delivering the stated rewards in a timely manner 
4. Exceeding the expectations of our backers. 

We believe that we're set up to achieve these goals for the following reasons:

1. This isn't a hypothetical idea, it's one that in some capacity, we've been working on the components of, for years.
2. We've created over 25 sessions worth of content, including a series of longform livestreams earlier this year. Our pre, production, and post workflows have been refined and we are routinely hired to create content of this nature for some of the biggest brands on the planet (with the requisite deadlines/expectations to match).
3. Those of us involved in SerialBox are full time filmmakers, designers, engineers, and photographers whose primary work consists of creating and delivering client work in a timely manner. We wouldn't get hired if we didn't do what we say we will do. We will bring the same mentality to this project, conveying information honestly and realistically. We're also limiting the number (and kinds) of rewards to further streamline the delivery process. 
4. If you've seen any of our previous work, I hope that we don't need to dive too deeply into this one. Exceeding expectations, creating something memorable, and helping you connect with music that you love? That's what we aim to do, every single time. This time wouldn't be any different.

We’re thankful for your contribution and look forward to delivering a fantastic episode of SerialBoxTV!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Backers! 
Wanted to share a short preview of EP/01 of SerialBoxTV. 
We're in the final stretch getting everything wrapped up for release/premiere/etc. Couldn't be more excited to show you what we've all been working on, thanks to you.
